loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap, etc. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap, etc. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods and will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y tiene un hijo pequeño que va a la escuela, el cual depende de el.
Antonio tiene una Oleria en su casa, mediante este trabajo ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. El es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de arcilla, lo cual es el elemento fundamental de su trabajo. Esta agradecido por la ayuda que recibe de la fundación y de kiva, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Antonio is from the city of Santaní. He is 35 years old, single and has a young son who goes to school and depends on him.

Antonio runs a 'olería', a place where bricks are made from clay, in his house. By means of this work he has been able to give his family all that they need in order to have a dignified life without suffering hardships. He is a hard working person who wants to get ahead and progress and this is why he always makes a great effort.

He is requesting a loan to buy clay, which is fundamental for his job. He is grateful for the help he receives from the Fundación and from Kiva, as it is of great help.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El señor Guido de 30 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Mirna, tienen un hijo, ella le ayuda en su negocio, tienen una casa de venta de celulares y accesorios bien surtidos, además el Sr Guido realiza reparaciones de celulares de todas marcas y modelos.
Guido comenzó desde muy joven vendiendo mercaderías de forma ambulante por toda la ciudad de Villarrica, hace 5 años pudo con un ahorro y créditos obtenidos abrir su negocio en un lugar bastante concurrido. Desde siempre recibe la ayuda de su esposa quien hace las ventas especialmente recargas de saldos y activaciones, mientras él repara celulares y realiza compras de Ciudad del Este.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de celulares, carcasas, estuches, cargadores, con lo que quiere tener un buen stock y de esa forma seguir manteniendo sus ventas, e incrementar sus ingresos que le permitirá seguir mejorando su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Guido is 30 years old. He is married to Mirna and they have a son. She helps him in his business; they have a phone shop where they sell mobile phones and a wide range of accessories. Guido also carries out repairs on all makes and models of mobile phone.

Guido started selling stocks as a street vendor when he was very young in all the city of Villarrica. Five years ago, thanks to his savings and conceded loans, he was able to open his business in a fairly busy place. He has always received the help of his wife who makes sales, especially phone credit top ups and activations, while he repairs mobile phones and buys in Cuidad del Este.

He requests a loan to buy mobile phones, shells, cases, chargers, etc. with which he wants to have a good stock. In this way he will continue maintaining his sales and will increase his income, which will allow him to continue improving his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, shells, cases, chargers, etc.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada Luz de 53 años de edad vive en un tradicional barrio de la ciudad con su esposo y tiene una hija de 28 años. Ella vende medicamentos en un local arrendado, ubicado  frente al hospital de la ciudad; su negocio inició hace 15 años, con recursos propios provenientes de su trabajo como instrumentadora, para apoyar el bienestar de su familia, contribuyendo con los gastos del hogar. La ubicación de su negocio frente a un hospital es oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas cada vez más y aumentar sus utilidades y su capital de trabajo para comprar las medicinas que se requieren, son su mayor desafío porque se torna insuficiente ante su propósito de ventas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará medicina que tiene mayor rotación en su farmacia, con el fin de aumentar el volumen de sus ventas y mantener  la farmacia siempre bien surtida. Su sueño mas adelante es tener una casa propia y en esto enfoca sus esfuerzos para lograr un mañana mas tranquilo.
texts.en:
Ada Luz, age 53, lives in a tradional neighborhood with her husband.  She has a 28 year old daughter.  She sells medicine at a rented spot in front of the city hospital.

She started her business 15 years ago with her own resources from her work as a nurse.  She did this in order to support her family’s well-being and to contribute to the household expenses.

Her business location in front of the hospital is opportune for increasing her sales more and more, her profits, and her work capital to buy the medicines she needs.  They are her greatest challenge because they do not have a sufficient turn around for her sales plan.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy medicine that turns around more quickly for her pharmacy. 

Her goal is to increase her volume of sales and to keep her pharmacy well-stocked.

Her dream for later on is to have her own home.  She focuses her efforts on this dream in order to have a more comfortable future.

loans.use: to buy medicine that turns around more quickly for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis con su credikiva anterior compró en mayor cantidad sus víveres de mayor rotación como aceites, pastas, leche en polvo, café detergente etc. El agradece y pide a sus  financiadores lo siguiente: “Sigan apoyando a este programa ya que estamos logrando objetivos pendientes de realizar. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el que comprará un mayor número de artículos de la canasta familiar que están siendo ofrecidos por sus proveedores con descuentos al ser comprados en mayor volumen; con ello tendrá un buen inventario y muy elegantemente surtida su tienda, ofreciendo a su clientela diversidad de artículos, con los que satisfacer sus necesidades y esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan Luis bought wholesale his supplies that sell the most, such as oil, pasta, powdered milk, coffee, detergent, etc.  He thanks his lenders and requests the following: "Continue supporting this program because we are achieving our unrealized goals."

Currently he is applying for another Kiva loan with which he will buy a greater number of staple items being offered by his providers with discounts for wholesale purchases.  With this he will have a good inventory and a very elegantly stocked store to offer his customers a variety of articles to satisfy their needs.  This is exactly what guarantees the success of his investment.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of staple items.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 30 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school.  She lives in Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past six years, Allen has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells food and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Allen is requesting a loan for 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy more food and vegetables to sell.  This loan will help Allen to generate greater profits and pay for her children's medical expenses. Allen hopes that in the future she will be able to open a grocery business. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase food and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sol Marina

texts.es: Sol con su anterior credikiva compró de contado y en mayor volumen  medicinas naturales, ropa, cosméticos, calzado y variedades; ella  aprovechó  las fechas especiales como día de la secretaria y día de la madre, comercialmente le fue muy bien, obtuvo  sus mejores  ingresos en cuanto se incrementaron sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva y está haciéndolo en la misma temporada que el anterior; ahora responderá a pedidos de sus clientes y ajustará sus compras a sus solicitudes de ropa cosméticos, calzado y variedades. Con ello una vez mas aumentará su capital de trabajo y cada día crecerá un poco más su negocio; esto es justamente lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva el es siguiente: Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, deseo que me sigan apoyando, para continuar progresando personal, familiar y profesionalmente.”
texts.en:
Sol used her previous Kiva loan to buy natural medicines, clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and a variety of ítems for cash and in greater volumen.  She took advantage of special dates like Secretary’s Day and Mother’s day.  Sales went very well for her.  She got better income as she increased her sales.

She is now applying for a new Kiva loan.  She is doing so in the same season as the previous loan.  She will now fill her customers’ orders, and she will adjust her purchases to requested items like clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and a variety of items.  

With these purchases she will once again increase her working capital, and her business will grow a little more every day.  This is exactly what guarantees the success of her investment.  

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  “Many thanks to Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domino.  I hope you continue supporting me in order for me progress personally, professionally, and with my family."

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and a variety of items.

loans.name: Gumane Group

texts.fr:
J.Marie fait partie du groupe Gumane  et habite à Ruyigi. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Noëlla, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, l’un  étudie en première maternelle,l'autre n'étudie  pas encore.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…) depuis 12 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des articles de plusieurs sortes pour satisfaire ses clients.Cela va lui permettre de gagner plus.
texts.en:
J. Marie lives in Ruyigi and is a member of Gumane Group. He's 31 years old and married to Noëlla, a cultivator. Together, they have two children. One goes to kindergarten, the other doesn't go to school yet.

For twelve years, J. Marie has been selling various products (rice, beans, salt, etc.) in his shop. He's seeking his fifth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame.

He will use it to bolster his working capital and purchase various sorts of products to meet customer demand. This will enable him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy various products, such as rice, beans, salt, etc.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 50 years old. He lives in a small village of the Samtredia District with his family; wife, Marina and a 21-years-old daughter who is a student. Marina works as a sales lady at a local store. She gets monthly salary in the amount of 200 Laris per month. The family also sells a small harvest of nuts every year. The total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris. According to Credo estimations, they are in the subsistence poor category. 

With the requested credit Avtandil will re-start the functioning of a family owned bread bakery. A year ago Avtandil stopped the business, because he didn’t have any funds for financing the bakery’s ongoing costs. His loan request was approved based on a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program credits businesses in areas with soft financial conditions, such as the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Avtandil will purchase flour and wood. He will produce traditional Georgian bread and sell it in the village. The income of the family will increase by 300 – 400 Laris, which will mean 120 – 160% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to purchase flour for re-starting the bakery.

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en:
Valeri is 56 years old. He lives in the Khoni district with his 14-year-old daughter Khatia. She goes to school. Valeri’s wife is out of the country. She works abroad and helps her family financially. Valeri grows maize on a family-owned plot of land. He sells harvested maize in the village. The total average monthly income of the family equals 200 Laris. The family lives in poverty.  

Valeri requested credit for the start-up of a grocery store. He has constructed a small building for the store. It is located near his house. With the requested credit he will purchase refrigerators for the store as well as some grocery products for resale. According to his estimations, his store will work well, as there are no more similar stores. Also he will attract clients with quality service and a wide assortment of products. 

Valeri’s loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. After the start-up of the business, the living conditions of the family will significantly improve and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase refrigerators for the start-up of a grocery store.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 26 years old. He lives in the Khoni District of West Georgia with his family: his wife, Tamar, his two sons (3 and 2 years old), his father and grandmother. Zurab is the only income provider in the family. He trades on the local open market, selling nuts and maize. The family lives below the poverty line, and they receive social assistance from the local government. The total average monthly income of the family is 270 Laris, including social assistance. Zurab requested credit for the start-up of a trade business. 

His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Zurab will purchase a mini-bus. He will use it for trade activity, selling fruits and vegetables. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from local farmers at wholesale prices and take them with the mini-bus to nearby towns for resale. According to Zurab’s estimations, the monthly income of the family will increase by approximately 300 Laris, which means a 110% increase. Zurab will be able to create better living conditions for his children, as well as the other family members. Also, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market in the future, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for trading with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Tinyarinas Group

texts.es:
La Srta. EDITH CONSUELO de 22 años de edad soltera, actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal, siempre carismática y emprendedora del grupo “LAS TINYARINAS” grupo conformado por 07 personas. 
EDITH CONSUELO se dedica a la venta cosméticos de belleza productos EVON que vende en el local de su casa, ya que ella se esmera en aperturas otros nuevos locales de ventas
El préstamo solicito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar accesorios de cosméticos, perfumes, etc. 
Sus objetivos para el futuro es aperturar su salón de belleza. Ella se ubicada la segunda persona  lado derecha viste con polo color celeste casaca color negro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith Consuelo is 22 years old, single and lives in a village. She a charismatic and enterprising member of “The Tinyarinas” group, made up of seven members.
Edith Consuelo sells Avon beauty products and cosmetics. She sells them dooor-to-door. She is always looking for new places to sell her products.
This loan, which she is requesting, will be used for working capital and to buy accessories such as cosmetics, perfumes, etc.
Her future goal is to open a beauty salon. She is the second person from the right in the photo. She is wearing a light blue shirt and black jac

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 27 years old.  She lives in a small village of Tskaltubo District.  She lives with her family: husband – Zaza, her five-year-old daughter, her four-year-old son and her father in law.  The family earns a living through agricultural business.  They have a plot of land, where greens are grown.  Zaza sells harvested greens at Kutaisi (a nearby town) market. The total average monthly income of the family is 150 Laris per month.  According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the category 'subsistence poor'. 

Manana has requested credit for the construction of greenhouses.  Her loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Manana will purchase materials to construct greenhouses (iron pillars and polyethylene) and vegetable seeds. Zaza and Manana will grow greens, cucumbers and tomatoes in the greenhouses throughout the whole year.  They will sell the harvested products on Kutaisi Market.  The income of the family will significantly increase.  They will be able to combat their poverty and in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct greenhouses and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 56 years old. He lives in a small village of Zestaponi District with his family: his two sons (21 and 15 years old), his daughter-in-law and his one-year-old granddaughter. David’s wife is an emigrant; she works abroad and assists her family financially. 

David earns a living through agricultural business. They have a milk cow and 200 nut trees. Dairy products are mainly consumed by the family; a small surplus and the nut harvest are sold in the Zestaponi District by David. Total average monthly income of the family from the above-mentioned activities is 150 Laris. David’s wife sends them money monthly, but still, according to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

David requested credit for the start up of a small poultry farm. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with easy conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

 With the received credit David will purchase chickens and place them in the old hen-house, located in the family yard. Also, part of the credit will be used for purchasing feed for the chickens.  He will grow chickens and start selling them in 3-4 months. Also, David will sell eggs as well. According to his estimations, the monthly income of the family will increase by 300 – 350 Laris. That will mean a 100 – 133% increase. The family will be able to improve their living conditions. In addition to the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, for further expansion of their new business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to start up a poultry farm

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Samuel has been working hard to manage his stationery shop, which also sells books. 

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale and will help Samuel to generate greater profits and cover medical expenses. Samuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand with various branches of the same business. 

Samuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Samuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale

loans.name: Sayangana Group

texts.fr:
Edouard fait partie du groupe Sayangana et habite à Gitega. Il  a 33 ans et est marié à Frédérique, cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  2 enfants,  dont un,  étudie à l’école primaire.

Il fait le commerce du riz, haricot,… depuis 8ans.

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, haricot,... à revendre pour gagner plus.

Les gains tirés du commerce, lui permet d’améliorer la ration alimentaire. Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des terres cultivables.
texts.en:
Edouard lives in Gitega and is a member of the Sayangana group. He is 33 years old and married to a farmer named Frédérique. They have two children, one of whom is in primary school.

He has been selling rice, beans,...for the past eight years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans,...to resell in order to earn more.

The profit that he makes from his business allows him to improve his food intake. In the coming years, he would like to buy some farmland.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans,...to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es: Angélica de 34 años de edad vive en el municipio de Soledad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años. Ella se dedica al comercio mediante una miscelánea ubicada en su casa donde vende artículos de misceláneas, como accesorios femeninos, de hogar y ofrece el servicio de telecomunicaciones mediante celulares, vendiendo minutos, productos alimenticios y ofrece el servicio de impresiones. Su vida de negocio inició porque no tenía un trabajo formal y fueron muchas las hojas de vida que llevara a empresas, donde no pudo ingresar para obtener un empleo formal y de calidad. Con la responsabilidad de sus dos hijos,  su inquilino de un local de su propiedad, le insinuó que emprendiera su propio negocio y esto fue hace 4 años, desde los cuales ha ido poco a poco creciendo, compró dos vitrinas, un computador, impresora y cada día que pasa resulta desafiante atender  la clientela, con la infraestructura que hoy cuenta. Su mercado le señala la necesidad de tener una impresora mas, una fotocopiadora para ofrecer un nuevo servicio y mantener las vitrinas bien surtidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará una fotocopiadora y mercancía variada con la cual surtirá sus vitrinas. La inversión planea ser exitosa porque responde a la demanda y la hace en el marco de su experiencia como comerciante. Su sueño más adelante es tener un café internet, con la infraestructura necesaria para que sus clientes se sientan en un ambiente confortable,  mientras satisfacen sus necesidades de estos servicios tan modernos.
texts.en: Angélica is 34 years old and lives in the town of Soledad. She has two children, ages 9 and 12. She sells miscellaneous merchandise from her house such as feminine and household accessories and telecommunications services such as cell phones, cell phone usage minutes, food products and printing services. She began this business because she didn’t have a formal job. She needed a lot of documentation to get a formal job and she wasn’t able to get the paperwork for a good job. With the responsibilty of two children and her rent for her house, she began her own business four years ago. Little by little it has been growing. She has bought two display cabinets, a computer and a printer. Each day it is challenging to serve her customers with the infrastructure that she currently possesses. She needs a second printer to keep up with her business, a copy machine to offer a new service and she needs have a variety of products in her display cabinets. This is her first application with KIVA through “The Mario Santo Domingo Foundation”. With this loan she will buy a copy machine and various merchandise to provide a variety of items in her display cabinets. This investment will be successful as it is in response to customer demand. She is making these purchases with the knowledge she has as a businessperson. Her dream for the future is to have an internet café with the infrastructure necessary to make her customers comfortable while they participate in these modern services.

loans.use: to buy a copy machine and various merchandise to restock her display cabinets.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kisasi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Isaac has been working hard to manage his stationery shop, which also sells books. 

To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale and will help Isaac to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Isaac hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his business by buying more inventory that will attract more customers. 

Isaac is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaac who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens and printing paper for resale

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 8 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and reduce poverty in her family. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business more. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 2 years, Hanifah has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells video CD's. 

To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more video CD's for resale, and will help Hanifah to generate greater profits and cover medical expenses for her family. Hanifah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Hanifah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hanifah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more video CD's for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, one of whom is currently enrolled in school. For the past five years, James has worked hard to manage his small business, which involves selling building bricks. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use this loan to buy more materials for making bricks, generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. James hopes that in the future he will be able to start a retail shop. 

He is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making bricks,

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva porque necesita comprar tanques plásticos para comercializarlos y aumentar su capital de trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Con su anterior credikiva logró comprar tambores plásticos y los comercializó en las ciudades de Montería, Sincelejo y Magangúe, lugares también ubicados en la costa  Caribe de Colombia. Con ellos les fue muy bien porque rotó rápidamente su capital y logró un ligero aumento en sus ventas. En su mensaje a los financiadores dice lo siguiente: “Muy agradecida con esas personas que nos han ayudado para seguir adelante en nuestros negocios y continúen con esta bonita labor. “.
texts.en: Alba is applying for a new Kiva loan because she needs to buy plastic tanks to sell and increase her working capital as she has been doing.  With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to buy plastic drums. She sold them in the cities of Montería, Sincelejo, and Magangúe, also located on the Caribbean coast of Colombia. She did very well with them because she quickly turned over her capital and achieved a slight increase in her sales. In her message to the lenders she says the following: "Very grateful to these people who have helped us to move forward in our businesses, and may they continue with this beautiful work."

loans.use: to buy plastic tanks to sell

loans.name: Gurenik

texts.en:
Gurenik is 54 years old. He lives in Stepanavan town, in the North of Armenia, with his family: his wife, son and two daughters. Gurenik is a fireman and works at the city fire service. Besides that, Gurenik also runs a little farm where he breeds cattle. Gureneik has been breeding cattle for 3 years.

Gurenik has applied for this loan to expand his farm. With the loan's help he will purchase cattle and forage to feed them. This will allow Gurenik to gather more income, which is important for him to be able to renovate the barn and create better conditions for cattle breeding.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Henry has been working hard to manage his small business, which does welding, making metal doors and windows. 

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more metal materials for making doors for resale and will help Henry to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Henry hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more metal materials for making doors for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa tiene un negocio de variedades como ropa, calzado, perfumes, desodorantes, sombrillas entre otros artículos y también vende queso y suero costeño, que constituyen sus ingresos adicionales. Rosa inició vendiendo pocas mercancías y con el transcurrir del tiempo ha ido creciendo y agregando opciones como la venta de suero y queso que ofrece a su ya fiel clientela. Su mercado principal lo conforman sus vecinos del barrio donde habita y de otros barrios al sur de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, donde es muy conocida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa y calzado especialmente, preparándose para el día de las madres, mes en el  cual hay una inclinación de sus ventas pues sus clientes conocen de sus productos y están a la espera de su oferta y de los muchos pedidos que han hecho a Rosa. Esta es la razón por la cual su inversión se postula como exitosa, pues se basa en su habitual demanda y en los pedidos puntuales de sus más fieles clientes, lo cual augura una rotación muy rápida de sus inventarios y un ligero aumento de sus utilidades. Su meta es continuar el crecimiento de su negocio y no hay  una mejor forma de hacerlo,  si no es con su trabajo persistente y disciplina de inversión. Su sueño es lograr un futuro exitoso para su hijo, que siempre se mantenga sano y lograr el  máximo crecimiento de su microempresa comercial.
texts.en: Rosa has a business that offers a variety of merchandise such as clothes, shoes, perfumes, deoderants and hats as well as other items. She also sells cheese and farmer’s cheese, which give her additional income. Rosa started this business with a little bit of merchandise and over time has grown her business and added more items such as selling farmer’s cheese and regular cheeses. She offers these goods to her loyal customers. She mainly sells to her neighbors in the area where she lives and also to other neighborhoods in the south of the city of Cartagena de Indias, which is a well-known city. She is asking for this loan from KIVA to buy clothes and shoes in preparation for Mother’s Day. There is a lot of business in this month and her customers are familiar with her products and are awaiting her new offerings. Many customers request her products. This is why she believes her investment will be successful as it is based on customer demand and on the requests of her loyal customers. She would like to rotate her inventory and increase her inventory a little. Her goal is to continue growing her business and there isn’t a better way to do this. She will do it with hard work and discplined investment. Her dreams for the future are the success of her child, who she always keeps healthy, and the maximum amount of growth for her commercial business.

loans.use: to buy specialty clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Buenas Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Martina es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de blusas y faldas, inició este negocio con poco capital y el apoyo de su hijo, hasta el momentos lleva 8 años de experiencia,  cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio de materiales de construcción de viviendas.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizar´`a para la compra de telas licra de varios colores, ya que espera en el futuro contar con operarios. Las demás integrantes se dedica a la confección de blusas y faldas, venta de delantales, venta de servilletas y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Santos Martina is 48 years old and married. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She has six children, three of whom are in school. She works making blouses and skirts. She started this business with very little capital and the support of her son. She now has 8 years of experience. She has her husband's support. He works selling construction materials for houses.

Santos Martina organized a group to request a loan. She will use it to purchase lycra material of various colors because in the future she hopes to employ workers. The rest of the members of the group work selling blouses and skirts, aprons and napkins and raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase lycra material.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: La cliente, Griselda, es una señora de 25 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo dependiente y es madre soltera, la cliente se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, en donde actualmente tiene 3 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, y la leche que produce entrega a las personas del lugar por donde ella vive, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive la cliente es propia y de su familia, la cliente vive con su hijo, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de cabeza de ganado lechero, para aumentar sus ingresos  por la venta de la leche, y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su domicilio, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de la cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: Griselda is a 25-year-old woman. She is a single mother with one dependent child. She owns three milk cows that produce raw milk. She delivers the milk they produce to people who live nearby. They live in the south zone of the city of Cochabamba, which is located about 10km from the city of Cochabamba. She lives in a house she owns with her family. She lives with her child. Her loan will be used to buy another milk cow in order to increase her earnings selling milk. This will give her another resource to use to meet her household expenses. This is why she tells her story, so that you will know her.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 56 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. For the past 15 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap.

Ruth has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more stock for her store to generate greater profits. She hopes in the future to expand her business further.

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), a program that primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Mónica Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Mónica es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del país. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, podemos encontrar muchas artesanías como: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.

Doña Mónica tiene de 40 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, dos de sus hijos están en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Mónica es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas como Avon y Esika, labora sin horario fijo y se dedica a este negocio desde hace 7 años. También hace 3 meses comenzó a trabajar de empleada domestica.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Tenacious Women) comunal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, the capital of the Azuay province.  It is known as the “Atenas del Ecuador” (Athens of Ecuador) and as the cultural city of the country.  Its historic center is the largest and best preserved of the country.  A lot of handicrafts like weaving, embroidery, ceramics,  gold work, silver work, and Panama straw hats can be found there.

Mónica, age 40, is in a common-law marriage and has six children.  Two of them are married and live independently.  One of children works and helps her financially.  Two of her children are in high school.  Her last child is in a city elementary school.  Her husband works as a security guard.  She does not have her own house; she rents where she lives.

Mónica sells various brands of cosmetics like Avon and Esika.  She does not have a fixed work schedule, and she has had this business for seven years.  Also, she started working as a domestic employee three months ago.  

She has been a member of the communal bank for seven years.   She will use her new loan to buy cosmetics.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lahai M.'s Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of teachers in a primary school in Kenema. The school was founded in 1994 by the Ansarul Islamic Mission to improve education in the community. The teachers have come to SMT in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone to request a loan. 

Lahai is the leader of the group. He is 38 years old, married, and has one child. He was born in Talia Torgboma  in Eastern Sierra Leone. Lahai has been in the teaching profession for 10 years . He is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as iron, corrugated zinc, bags of cement, nails, etc. for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Sandra Maricela

texts.es:
La Sra. Sandra es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay, es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador" y la ciudad cultural del país. Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, podemos encontrar muchas artesanías como: tejidos, bordados, cerámica, orfebrería, platería y sombreros de paja toquilla.

Doña Sandra tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 12 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Sandra se encuentra muy bien en la salud al igual que todos los miembros de su familia.
Ella se dedica a la atención de su tienda  y a las manualidades, realiza todo tipo de tejidos, se dedica a estas actividades porque le gusta y tiene todo el tiempo para estar pendiente de su familia.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió comprando víveres para su tienda y los pagos del crédito los realizo sin ningún problema. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vitrinas y  productos de primera necesidad para su tienda La banca comunal le gusta por el compañerismo que comparten dentro del grupo y la solidaridad, también porque los créditos son rápidos dándoles la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is a member of the “Struggling Women” Community Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is the capital of the Azuay Province. This city is known at the “Athens of Ecuador”, the cultural center of the country. It’s historical center is the largest and the best preserved of the country. There you can find a lot of folk art such as woven and embroidered items, ceramics, and jewelry, silver and straw hats.
Mrs. Sandra is 41 years old and married with three children, ages 17, 12 and 2. Her older children study in the secondary school in the city. Her husband is a security guard. They rent their house.
Mrs. Sandra is in good health as are the members of her family.
She works at her store and does handwork. She does all types of weaving. She does these activities because she likes them and is able to look after her family at the same time.
With her last loan she purchased items for her store and she paid all her loan payments without any problems. With this new loan she will buy display cabinets and much needed products for her store. She likes the community bank for the companionship and solidarity it provides. They provide the loans in a timely manner, which provides her the opportunity to grow her business. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets and products that she needs for her store.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is 32 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school.  He lives in Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Nasser has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells auto spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Nasser is requesting a loan for 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which he will use to purchase more spare parts for his business. This loan will help Nasser to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses. 

Nasser is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nasser who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 38 years old and lives in the town of Matuga in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year, Betty has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for resale, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for resale

loans.name: Oidinoi

texts.ru: Ойдиной трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Она занимается шитьем и продажей национальных халатов(чапан). У нее много постоянных клиентов, которые заказывают ей. Ойдиной хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки тканей и ватина для пошива халатов. Ойдиной надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Oidinoi is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is a widow and has two children.  She is involved in sewing and selling national robes (chapan).  She has many regular clients, who order from her.  Oidinoi wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 5000 Somoni to buy fabrics and cotton filling for sewing the robes.  Oidinoi relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Manuel Ernesto

texts.es: Manuel Ernesto es un emprendedor que ha luchado por salir adelante y tener su propia herramienta de trabaja para brindarle a su familia lo mejor, este emprendedor  ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el cual en el crédito anterior lo utilizo en el negocio en la compra de productos nos expresa el emprendedor que gracias al apoyo ha aumentado su inversión en la compra de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Actualmente el emprendedor está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como granos básicos, tan pan, huevos, detergente, pasta de diente entre otros productos.
texts.en: Manuel Ernesto is an entrepreneur who has fought to get ahead and have his own means of offering his family the best.  He has already worked with Fundación León 2000, where he used the credit toward the purchase of products for his business.  He has expressed his appreciation to us for the support, which has allowed him to increase his investment with the purchase of products to offer his customers.  Currently, he is asking for financing to buy basic staples, such as bread, eggs, detergent, toothpaste and other items.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, such as bread, eggs, detergent, toothpaste and other items.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor (Faith and Love) 1 & 2. The group is located in Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic and known for its tobacco and beef production. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes, and jewelry.

Ana, who lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child, is dedicated to working hard and helping her partner to generate extra income to better their family living conditions. She is starting her business with this loan, which is her first. She is excited to receive this loan and start her shoe sales business. She will purchase many different pairs of shoes for women and men.

Ana will reinvest her profits in her business, as well as save part of the profits. One of her dreams is to succeed in her business. Her most difficult challenge is to finish her secondary school education. She enjoys watching television. Ana thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Fiona

texts.en:
Fiona is 32 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom currently attends school. For the past five years, Fiona has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells mobile phones. 

To help expand her business, Fiona has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more mobile phones for resale, and will help Fiona to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. Fiona hopes that in the future she will be able to open another shop of the same business. 

Fiona is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fiona who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Jabor

texts.ru: Чабор женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 10 лет Чабор занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Еженедельно ездит на рынок, покупает скот и привозит их домой. В течении недели  откармливает и на  следующей недели продает за выгодную цену. Чабор хотел бы получить займ в размере 10000 Сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Jabor is married and has six children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Jabor has been involved in buying and selling cattle for over ten years.  He goes to a market weekly, buys livestock and brings it home.  He fattens it up for a week and sells it the following week at an advantageous price.  Jabor wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 10000 Somoni to buy cattle.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 7 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna  7  a été formé par 5 femmes membres d’un même réseau : Association pour le développement des femmes de cette localité qui se trouve à environ 60 km de la ville principale. Leur activité consiste à acheter pour revendre des denrées alimentaires.
La présidente s’appelle Seynabou et elle gère une boutique. Elle aune expérience de 15 ans dans ce domaine. Avec le crédit, elle  va pouvoir acheter  10 sacs de riz, 50 kg de sucre et 30 litres d’huile. 
Madame Seynabou appui son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne du foyer et a comme souhait d’agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en: The Djiguène Bakhna 7 group was formed by five women who are members of the same network: the Association for the Development of Women in a town which lies around 60km from the capital. Their business is buying and selling food products. The president is called Seynabou and she runs a shop. She has 15 years of experience in this field. With the loan she will be able to buy 10 sacks of rice, 50 kg of sugar and 30 liters of oil. Seynabou helps her husband to cover the daily household expenses and her ambition is to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy food for resale (rice, sugar, oil..).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a membership into a taxi cooperative.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Valor Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Fuerza Y Valor” es un nuevo grupo que está conformado por 07 socios, siendo la gran mayoría vecinos de la zona. Gladys tiene 40 años de edad, es separada con 02 hijos independientes.  Hace más de 25 años que Gladys se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de verduras, como segunda actividad se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Gladys es una mujer trabajadora, pues gracias a su trabajo y dedicación a podido mejorar su vivienda  y mantener su negocio.  Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. A  fin de seguir creciendo en su negocio solicito el crédito para comprar verduras y comida balanceada para sus cerdos. La nueva Alcancía Comunal “Fuerza Y VAlor” agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
The “Fuerza y Valor” (Strength and Value) Communal Bank is a new group composed of 7 members, the great majority of whom are residents of this zone. 

Gladys is 40 years old and separated with 2 independent children. Some 25 years ago Gladys began selling vegetables in the street and as a 2nd activity, raising pigs. Gladys is a hard-working woman and thanks to her work and dedication, she has been able to improve her life and  maintain her business. Gladys' biggest desire is to finish construction of her residence. In order to continue expanding her  business, she is soliciting a loan to buy vegetables and balanced food for her pigs.

The new “Fuerza y Valor” Communal Bank is grateful for this offer of a loan.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell and balanced food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles ya ha trabajado con Fundación león 2000, en el cual la emprendedora ha aprovechado el financiamiento en aumentar su productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes, durante el financiamiento que se le brindo ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio intachable, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar leña y cerdos y ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria de los Angeles has previously worked with the "Fundacion Leon 2000," having used the financing to augment her products in order to sell them to her customers. During the loan period we offered her, she demonstrated herself to be a responsable person with an unblelmished credit record.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy additional firewood and pigs to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy firewood and pigs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.ru: Собирчон женат и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Более 5 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за ребенком. Собирчон имеет широкий ассортимент продуктов, а также много постоянных клиентов. В бизнесе помогает его младший брат. Собирчон хотел бы получить займ для покупки сахар, яйцо, макароны и другие виды продуктов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Sobirjon is married and raising a child. For over 5 years he has been running a grocery store, while his wife takes has taken care of the household and looked after their child. Sobirjon offers a wide assortment of products and has many regular customers. His younger brother helps him with the business. Sobirjon would like to obtain a loan to purchase sugar, eggs, pasta and other foodstuffs. He is hoping for your help and compassion.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Frdaouss

texts.fr: Madame Frdaous est une dame âgée de 39ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur de pièces détachées et a 04 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 18ans et le dernier 07ans. Depuis 1993, elle vend des détergents au grand marché de Lomé et s’approvisionne au même lieu chez les grossistes qui achètent en CHINE. Un membre de la famille l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité. Frdaouss est à son second cycle de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des détergents. Elle veut encore réinvestir dans l’activité, louer une boutique et faire les commandes elle- même. Elle voudrait aussi assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Frdaouss is a 39-year old woman, who is married to a retailer of spare parts and has four children who are all at school. The eldest is 18 years old and the youngest seven. Since 1993, she has been selling detergents at Lomé's Grand Market and gets her supplies at the same place from wholesalers who buy from China. A member of her family helps her to run her business. Frdaous is on her second loan cycle with WAGES and is requesting this loan to buy detergents. She would like to reinvest in the business, rent a shop and prepare the orders herself. She would also like to be able to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy detergents

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Marta Lorena continua con su negocio de ropa usada, mujer dedicada a la educacion de sus tres hijos, negocio mismo que le permite tener el mayor tiempo posible para atender a su familia, puesto que lo tiene ubicado en su propia casa de habitacion. En esta ocasión el uso que le dara a su credito es re-invertirlo en su negocio comprando una paca de faldas y una paca de ropa usada mixta, inversion que le ayudara a incrementar el inventario de su negocio y producto a esto que sus ganancias sean mejores. Agradece la confianza que Afodenic ha dado a su persona ya que por medio de financiamientos brindados por la misma micro-financiera ha venido aumentado su mercaderia y que su familia goce de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marta Lorena continues with her used clothing business. She is a woman who is dedicated to the education of her three children. Her business is located in her home, which allows her to spend as much time as possible with her family.

On this occasion, she will use this loan to reinvest in her business by purchasing a bundle of skirts and another bundle of mixed used clothing. This investment will help to increase the inventory of products in her business so that she can improve her earnings. Marta is grateful for the trust that AFODENIC has given to her as a person. With the micro-loans she has received, she has been able to increase her merchandise and provide her family with better living conditions to enjoy.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Primero De Abril  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla. Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace bastante tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha servido de mucho, ellos Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive es Señor Walter, tiene 33 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos 17, 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, todos  estudian, los mayores  en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa.
 
Él se dedica a la venta de  frutas y verduras, trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, él se desplaza en su carro desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista en Portoviejo para comprar los productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes, luego recorre la ciudad y ciertos sitios cercanos vendiendo sus productos, tiene 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a Dios le da lo necesario para poder vivir.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para financiar su negocio.

Su sueño es comprar otro carro ya que el que tiene está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Primero De Abril" gets together every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are recognized on a national and international level, the place of the famous "Panama hats." This is a group of people who decided to unite some time ago and form this communal bank which has served them well. They work at various things such as business, services, food sales, and other activities.

This is where Walter lives. He is 33 years old, he is married and has four children with his wife; they are 17, 16, 14, and 11 years old. They all study, the older ones in high school and the youngest in elementary school. His wife is a housewife.

He works selling fruits and vegetables every day from 5 am to 2 pm. At dawn he goes in his car to the wholesale market in Portoviejo to buy the products to be able to offer them to his customers. Later he goes through the city and certain nearby places selling his products. He has been doing this for 16 years and thanks to God it provides him with what is necessary to live.
 
This loan is to buy fruit and vegetables. He has had five loan cycles with the communal bank and he likes it because the loans are a big help to finance his business. His dream is to buy another car since the one he has is a little run down.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали добрый и трудолюбивый человек, который женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Жена работает техничкой в средней школе. Курбонали занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он в этом бизнесе уже более 5 лет. В бизнесе помогает его сын. Курбонали хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Kurbonali is a kind and hard-working person. He is married and raising five children. His wife works as a custodian in a high school, while Kurbonali sells cattle. He has been running this business for over 5 years, with help from his son. Kurbonali would like to obtain a loan to purchase cattle and thereby expand his business. He is hoping for your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Orquidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Orquidia mujer esforzada y emprendedora, continua con su pulperia. Misma que ha sido el pilar para ella poder sacar adelante junto con su esposo a su familia. Manifiesta sentirse muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad de pertencer a la familia de creditos. Siendo este su tercer ciclo de financiamiento lo que se propone con el es invertirlo en la infraestructura de su vivienda, construyendo divisiones internas a su hogar. Para llevar a cabo dicho proyecto requerira comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de plywood, laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera grande, clavos de zinc, clavos para madera, pintura de aceite, puerta  entre otros. Asegura el logro que tendra con estas mejoras y es que les ofrecera a su familia mayor privacidad y mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Orquidia is a determined and enterprising woman who continues to manage her grocery store. This has enabled her to be the pillar of her family, thus allowing her to move forward along with her husband. She says that she is very grateful to AFODENIC for the opportunity to be part of its credit family. Orquidia is receiving her third loan and plans to invest it in the infrastructure of her home. She plans to build room dividers in her house. In order to carry out this project, she needs to buy the following construction materials: sheets of plywood, sheets of zinc, large wooden beams, zinc nails, nails for wood, oil-based paint, a door, and other supplies.

Orquidea assures us that by making these improvements, she will be able to provide her family with greater privacy and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to build room dividers in her home.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.ru: Исмат женат и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Более 13 лет он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Имеет торговую точку и много постоянных клиентов. Он также продает промышленные товары. Когда он начинал свой бизнес он торговал на рынке, а затем после получения займа от "ИМОН Интернешнл" он открыл еще два магазина возле своего дома. Займ помог ему в развитии  бизнеса, и он хочет получить еще  займ для расширения ассортимента продуктов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ismat is married and has three children.  He has been involved in buying and selling food products for over 13 years.  He has a retail outlet and many regular customers.  He also sells household goods.  When Ismat first started his business, he sold at a market, and then opened two more stores near his house after obtaining a loan from "IMON International."  The loan helped him with developing his business, and he wants to obtain another loan to expand his product selection.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Guljokhon

texts.ru: Гулжохон 31 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 2010 году Гулжохон начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 30,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулжохон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Гулжохон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Guljokhon is 31 years old, married and raising three children.  To provide a source of income for her family, Guljokhon became involved in animal husbandry in 2010.  The business, started with an initial sum of 30,000 som (KGS), today yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Guljokhon requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru: Алтынай 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1994 году Алтынай начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 17,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов дойных коров. Доходы Алтынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Altynai is 41 years old, she is married and raising 3 children. As a source of income for her family, in 1994 Altynai began raising livestock. Her business, which she started with an initial sum of 17,000 som (KGS), currently earns roughly 12,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to continue developing her business, Altynai has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional dairy cows. Altynai plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Jumakul

texts.ru: Жумакул 60 лет, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1992 году Жумакул начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумакул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Жумакул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Jumakul is 60 years old, married and raised two children.  To provide a source of income for her family, Jumakul became involved in animal husbandry in 1992.  The business, started with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS), today yields about 9,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Jumakul requested a loan in the amount of 55,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.es: Paulina es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 66 años años de edad, es dueña de una Carpintería, fue socia de Finca Perú hace 7 años ,tuvo que retirarse porque sufrió una fractura grave en el tobillo y no podía trabajar, y volvió a su bancomunal cuando ya se encontraba mejor de salud, cumplirá 3 años desde que regresó, todo lo que aprende en su bancomunal lo trata de practicar porque le ayudan a progresar, esta muy agradecida por las cosas que pudo aprender y por la oportunidad que le dieron para trabajar en su negocio. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una caladora para su carpintería.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Nueva Vida” (New Life) communal bank.  She is 66 years old and owns a carpentry shop.  

She was a member of Finca Perú seven years ago but had to drop out because she suffered a serious fracture of her ankle and couldn’t work.  When her health recovered she rejoined her communal bank and it will be three years since she returned.  

She tries to put into practice everything she learns in her communal bank because it helps her make progress.  She’s very grateful for the things she was able to learn and for the opportunity they gave her to work in her business.  She will use this loan to buy a jig saw for her carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy a jig saw for her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella vende chompas desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas y lanas para hacer las chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues with her business selling crafts.  She sells sweaters from 8am until 6pm and through this business is able to support her children.  Her dream is to expand and improve the craft selling business.  She’s asking for a loan to buy sweaters and yarn to make sweaters.  She is happy about the loan and committed to make her installment payments.

loans.use: La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas y lanas para hacer las chompas.  to buy sweaters and wool to make sweaters.

loans.name: Wilson Israel

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre soltero de 25 años que vive en "Santo Domingo" que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Wilson trabaja como metalmecánico desde hace tres años, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y hoy en día trabaja junto a él. Está cursando sus estudios formales por lo cual necesita dinero para realizar su tesis y también si le sobra un poco de dinero piensa comprar materiales para su trabajo. Por esto ha solicitado a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Wilson y KIVA un crédito, el cual le permita poder cumplir este objetivo personal. A pesar de ser su primer crédito, ha pasado la evaluación de su asesor como un cliente con bajo riesgo de incurrir en morosidad.

Trabaja seis horas al día, su oficio es considerado de riesgo ya que al soldar los objetos metálicos existen emanaciones de gases los cuales resultan altamente tóxicos, a pesar de ello piensa seguir con este oficio que hoy en día es su sustento.

Está muy optimista por estar más cerca de su título profesional; su sueño es tener su título profesional y luego, algún día construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 25-year-old gentleman who lives in Santo Domingo, the fourth largest city in Ecuador. Its population is rapidly growing and there is a great deal of trade that takes place at the wholesale livestock markets. The average temperature is around 25.5°C, but sometimes it gets up to 38 °C. The entire province of Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas lies in the mountainous territory along the western coast. It has been known historically as Yumbos Province and the Capital of Los Colibríes (the Hummingbirds). Santo Domingo is located in a tropical area of Latin America and is a newly-created province that was formed in 2007.

Wilson has been a metal worker for three years. He learned the trade from his father and continues to work with him to this day. Wilson is taking formal classes, but he needs money to complete his thesis. He also needs a small amount of money to buy materials for his work. For this reason, he submitted a request to Fundación Alternativa, the intermediary organization that is connecting Wilson to a Kiva loan so that he can complete his personal objectives. Even though he is receiving his first loan, the credit assessor's evaluation determined that Wilson is at low risk of default.

Wilson works six hours a day. His job is of considerable risk since welding metal objects emits gases that are highly toxic. Despite this risk, he continue with his work since it is his current means of support. Wilson is very optimistic of receiving his professional degree in the near future. His dream is to earn his degree and eventually build a house of his own someday.

loans.use: to pay for the completion of his thesis and to buy materials for his work.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre 5 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú hace 4 años, con las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió a valorarse, le apoyaron con el estudio de sus hijos, cada vez que llega de su Bancomunal su esposo le pregunta que aprendió y con mucho entusiasmo le enseña, para que los dos puedan cambiar y progresar, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y ajo pelado, esta muy orgullosa de sus hijos porque ahora son profesionales, ella siempre trabajó mucho para poder lograr sus objetivos, esta muy agradecida con Finca Perú porque le dió un capital para poder trabajar, ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de ajo.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the “Nueva Vida” (New Life) communal bank.  She is 50 years old and is the mother of five children.  She’s been in Finca Perú for 4 years.  With training from her communal bank she learned to value herself.  They helped with her children’s educational expenses.  Every time she comes back from her communal bank her husband asks her what she learned and she passed it on to him very enthusiastically so that both of them can change and make progress.  

She sells vegetables and peeled garlic.  She’s very proud of her children because they are all now professionals.  She always worked very hard to reach her objectives and she’s very grateful to Finca Perú because it gave her capital to work with.  She will use this loan to buy garlic.

loans.use: to buy garlic.

loans.name: Carmen Eddy

texts.es: Carmen es socia del Bancomunal Bienestar II, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, es casada, es comerciante de abarrotes y tiene su empresa de transporte de pasajeros, gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal supo como administrar sus ganancias y sus ahorros, ahora ha comprado otro carro para su empresa,también antes vendía sus abarrotes en un local alquilado ahora ha comprado su propio local, el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá para la compra de repuestos para los vehículos de su negocio.
texts.en: Carmen is a member of the “Bienestar II” (Wellbeing II) communal bank.  She is 54 years old and the mother of five children.  She’s married and is a grocery merchant; she also has a passenger transportation firm.  Thanks to training in the communal bank she was able to better administer her profits and savings.  Now she has purchased another car for her firm.  Also, she used to sell the vegetables in a rented space but now she’s bought a space of her own.  The loan she’s requesting it so buy spare parts for the vehicles in her firm.
