La señora Maria Antonia es casada tiene 42 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la elaboración de bordado de blusas, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria y hasta el momento lleva 17 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente colores y mejorar su producción de bordado de blusas, espera en el futuro dejar este trabajo a sus hijos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la artesanías producción de tejido y bordado y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is married and is 42 years old. She completed three years of primary education. She has two children who are both studying. She makes a living embroidering blouses. She started as a worker and now has 17 years of experience. 

She is organizing this group to request a loan that she will use to purchase different colored thread and to improve her production in embroidering blouses. In the future she hopes to leave this work to her children. 

The other members of the group make their livings in artisan crafts, weaving and embroidery, as well as raising animals.

loans.use: to buy different colored thread and improve her production in embroidering blouses.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad  de Encarnación, surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, se trata de un grupo antiguo que trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2008. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo numero 15 y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Ls Sra. Juliana es la presidenta del grupo y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, tiene un pequeño puesto en su casa, el cual es muy concurrido por todos sus amigos y vecinos. Su sueño es poder ampliar su pequeño negocio y de esa forma tener un mayor ingreso para su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, con lo cual podrá surtir su negocio y ofrecer la misma variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is in the city of Encarnación, and came about because one of the members contracted the Foundation. This is a long-standing group which has been working with the Foundation since 2008. Currently they are in their 15th loan cycle and want to be able to get to the program's maximum level.

Juliana is chairperson of the group, and tells us that she sells fruits and vegetables. She has a small stand in her home, that is very popular with all her friends and neighbors.

Her dream is to be able to expand her small business, and this way have greater income for her family. She is applying for the loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables, which will enable her to stock her business, and offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Intiqam

texts.en:
Intiqam is a 41-year-old man, and he is married with three children. He is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, ketchup, and candies. He has 8 years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and demands of his clients. 

The food products he sells are very popular among people and in high demand, especially goods like butter, candies, and beverages. His monthly profit from selling foods is 250 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). His mother helps to purchase products and brings them to the shop. This business is the sole financial income for his family. Intiqam is a very successful entrepreneur because of his good location, in the central bazaar of his home town.

Intiqam applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify his range of goods to cover customers` demands.

loans.use: to buy more food products and diversify his range of goods.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik has been engaged in beekeeping and gardening for 16 years.  Andranik sells the honey he produces from his home. He uses the fruit from his garden for his family. Also Andranik grows ornamental trees, especially firs. Andranik says that the main customers for ornamental trees are from Yerevan, as they always order many trees from Andranik. 

Andranik is 44 years old; he is married and lives with his wife and 3 school-aged children in Ijevan. Andranik’s wife helps him in beekeeping and with joint effort they produce high quality honey which is always in popular demand. Simultaneously with beekeeping and gardening Andranik works as a boxing teacher at a sports school. Thanks to his occupation Andranik is able to support his big family.

Andranik is seeking a 600,000 Armenian dram loan to buy some more bee families, which will allow him to produce more honey in future and thus to increase his family's income.

loans.use: to buy some more bee families, which will allow him to produce more honey in future

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en:
Lusya sells clothes, food and household goods at her own small stall in Ijevan city. She has been running her business for more than 15 years. Lusya buys women’s, men’s and children’s clothes from Yerevan and also from one of the neighboring countries. Food and household goods are bought from suppliers. Lusya says that towels, children’s sets and confectionery are always in demand without reference to the season so she puts an emphasis on this merchandise. 

Lusya is 62 years old. She is widow and she lives with her son’s family in Ijevan. Lusya has 3 grandchildren. 

Thanks to her business Lusya solves most of her family’s needs, as her daughter-in-law stays at home and takes care of her children. Lusya’s son is an employee in one of Ijevan’s companies.

Lusya needs a 550,000 AMD loan to develop her shop assortment. She will especially buy spring season clothes and a lot of candy and confectionery to resell.

loans.use: to buy spring season clothes and a lot of candy and confectionery to resell

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe has been making furniture for the last 10 years. He makes cupboards, bookcases, chairs, tables, sofas, armchairs, etc. in his own garage, which he remodeled as a workshop. Vahe repairs old furniture as well. He fulfills private orders and also sells his production in Ijevan's shops. Vahe always has many customers as he does his work very well and his furniture is very durable. 

Vahe brings raw materials and necessary items for his business from Yerevan. He needs a 700,000 Armenian dram loan to buy a car, which he will use for  bringing materials from Yerevan and also to transport his products to his clients. 

Vahe is 27 years old and he lives in Ijevan. Vahe's family consists of his parents, two brothers and his brother's family. Thanks to his business Vahe covers the major part of his big family's needs, as his parents, as one of his brothers and sister-in-law don't have a job. 

This is Vahe's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy a car for his furniture production business

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara está tiene 37 años está casada con Ronald. Tienen 3 hijos de que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Desde que nació ha vivido en La Libertad. Su esposo trabaja desde hace 7 años en Pacipetrol. Empezó aperturando una pequeña tienda en su sector y hoy en día está muy surtida. Se decidió a abrir la tienda porque en la parte de atrás de su casa hay una escuelita es por ese motivo que tiene mucha acogida. Ahora la tienda la maneja con sus hijas de lunes a domingo, su esposo también colabora en sus días libres. Como es muy conocida no ha tenido problemas con robos y se siente segura en su barrio. Su inconveniente principal es la temporada invernal por la lluvia. Solicita el crédito para comprar bebidas, snack, dulces, helados etc. productos que tiene mucha demanda por los estudiantes. Su meta es incrementar su negocio y poder tener más estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Clara is 37 years old and is married to Ronald. She has three children who go to public school. She has lived in La Libertad since she was born. Her husband has worked at Pacipetrol for seven years. 

She started a small store in her neighborhood and now it sh very well stocked. She decided to open the store because at the back of her house there is a little school. This is why she is so well received. Now she runs the store with her daughters Monday through Friday and her husband helps out on his days off. As she is very well known, she has not had any problems with robberies and she feels safe in her neighborhood. Her biggest issue is the winter season due to the rain. 

She is requesting a loan to buy drinks, snacks, sweets, ice cream, etc. These products are in high demand from the students. Her goal is to expand her business and have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, sweets and ice cream.

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession et âgée de 36ans, Aku est mère de 04enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 13ans et le dernier 05ans. Son conjoint est couturier de profession. Pour bien répondre aux besoins de ses nombreux clients, Aku ajoute à son activité la vente des produits cosmétiques (mèches, tissages, maquillage). Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et exerce son activité dans un atelier.  Elle a une difficulté financière et sollicite ce second prêt pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle veut réinvestir le profit dans son activité et assurer sa pérennité. Aku voudrait voir ses enfants évoluer. Elle a démarré en 2002 son activité.
texts.en:
Aku, age 36, is a hairdresser. She has four children aged 5 to 13 who all go to school. Her spouse is a tailor. To meet the needs of a large customer base, Aku also sells cosmetic products (hair extensions, weaves, makeup). She buys her stock in Lomé and works out of her shop. She started her activity in 2002.

She is facing financial difficulties, which has prompted her to seek a second loan to stock up on cosmetic products. She wants to reinvest her profits in her activity and ensure its sustainability. Aku wishes to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.es: Emerenciana es socia del Bancomunal Bienestar II, tiene 50 años de edad, es dueña de una empresa de transportes, es madre  de 3 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú hace más de 16 años, inició vendiendo golosinas, ceviche y chicha,gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió la responsabilidad y como progresar en su negocio,y también en su hogar,ella dice que Finca Perú le brinda las oportunidades que otras entidades no , el préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y repuestos para sus vehículos.
texts.en:
Emerenciana is a member of the Bancomunal Bienestar II communal bank. She is 50, and owns a transportation company. She is the mother of three children, and has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 16 years. She started out selling candy, ceviche and chicha (traditional Peruvian drink made from corn). 

Thanks to the training in Bancomunal, she learned how to be responsible, and how to move forward in her business and also in her home life. She says that Finca Perú offers her the opportunities that other institutions did not.  

She will invest the loan she is applying for, in tires and spare parts for her vehicles.

loans.use: To buy tires and spare part for her transportation company.

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
59-year-old Arus is engaged in running a business in Achajur village, Tavush region. She rents a shop where she sells clothes, food, household goods and tableware as well. Her husband helps Arus in the business.  Arus brings merchandise from Yerevan and also buys from suppliers in her village. Arus says that food and clothes-selling brings in good profit so she always tries to diversify her shop's assortment. She has been running her business for almost 20 years.

Arus has a big family and her business allows her to support her family. Arus's family consists of her husband, her son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren. Arus's son fulfills private orders for construction, and her husband works as a watchman. 

Arus is asking for an 800,000 Armenian dram loan to buy spring season clothes, and a lot of foods and household goods to resell.   This is Arus's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy spring season clothes and a lot of foods and household goods to resell

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina breeds cows, pigs and chickens in Sevan. From produced milk Alina makes cheese, curd and sour cream which she sells to a neighbor restaurant. Beef, pork and chicken meat she sells to a butcher’s shop. 

Agricultural business is the only source of income for Alina’s family, as her mother is retiree, and Alina’s daughter is a pupil. Alina’s mother tries to help her in her occupation as far as possible.  Alina is 43 years old and she is divorced. For many years she has worked as a waitress in a restaurant. 

This is Alina’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now she needs $2,000 loan to repair her tumbled down barn.

loans.use: to repair her tumbled down barn

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is a 40-year-old man, married with three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in Bilasuavr IDP Settlement. Elshad repairs vehicles such as dump trucks, tractors and other farm vehicles. He has 10 years of experience in this field.  He is considered a specialist in this area and has a lot of orders.

His monthly income from the service he provides is 200 AZN.  Now more and more farmers are buying modern tractors and other vehicles useful in farming places, and Elshad needs to satisfy his customers and be able to repair modern cars, to change oil in them from time to time. He will buy modern tools and will take training in a nearby city to achieve his goals. 

He applied for 1000 AZN loan and promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to buy modern tools and take professional development  training

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy egg plant seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 49 year old business man married with six children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 
He deals in cocoa selling and has been in the business for 20 years though price fluctuations has been a major hardship in his business. He hopes to educate his children and buy land to grow crops for sale. Boniface needs the loan facility to purchase cocoa for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa for sale

loans.name: Bakir

texts.en:
Bakir is 30 years old and a married man. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds sheep for meat and wool purposes for local butchers. Bakir has more than 5 years of experience in this field, thank to his father who taught him how best to look after sheep. He receives 120 AZN financial support from government monthly, but this is too low to cover family needs.

Bakir usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them for 4-5 months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  His monthly income is 230 AZN.  People use meat in everyday national dishes as "pilau" and "dolma" and always use yoghurt sauce. Mutton is considered as very healthy and is also present in everyday life. Wool is very useful for blankets and mattresses made by local woman. 
   
This is only one financial income in his family.  Bakir applied for 1500 AZN to purchase 15 sheep and fodder.

loans.use: to buy 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Qahraman

texts.en:
Qahraman is a 30-year-old man, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last 5 years. During these years Qahraman gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this crop business because it  is profitable and fresh fruit and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetables, like "pilau" and "dolma". Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan and also used to make fresh punch.  Qahraman raises pears, apples, peaches, plums, pomegranates, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrot and potatoes.   He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 240 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Qahraman wants to expand his business and produce more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to invest in new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 
Rebecca has a food shop or carenderia that sells viands (an item of food; especially a choice or tasty dish) like vegetables saute, afritada and caldereta. She had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands.
Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands

loans.name: Con Dios Adelantre 1, 2 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante  (Forward with God) 1, 2 & 6. This group is made up of fifteen micro-entrepreneur women and it is located in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the harvest of sugar cane, in a batey founded for sugar cane workers, especially for Haitians.

Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and her three children. She says that her most important challenges are to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family. After the loans, her business is expanding her business and getting more clients. She enjoys working and cooking for her family.

She is running a miscellaneous sales business where she sells cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her businessinventory. She is excited to receive her 6th loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost 4 years and with each loan she has been able to improve her business. With her business profits, she has been able to save and reinvest in her business when she needs to buy bigger orders. Xiomara thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy different miscellaneous products

loans.name: Chistine

texts.en:
Christine is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya where she lives with her  husband and three children aged between eight and two  years. She has been in farming for five years  with her farm currently producing mainly  milk and eggs for the local market.She  is a tailor as well which provides additional income.

Christine has requested a loan of  82,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES  and  build a zero grazing unit for her animals. She says  both will help  improve her milk  and  enable her  provide milk for family consumption as well as provide income to meet other family needs.

She laments of food shortage for animals which usually become very expensive during dry seasons. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loans services and reiterates she will pay in time.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married mother of three children of primary school going age. She lives with her family in her rural home in Western Kenya. She has been in farming for four years and operates a hotel in the local market to supplement her farming income. She sells her farm produce which are majorly onions and milk to the local market.

Christine has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes her hotel business will benefit much with increase in milk production and generate better income to meet other family needs. Her focus is to own rental houses and venture into transport business and scale up her dairy business.

She says challenge posed by animal diseases is the most significant in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: Miguel es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Yahve Yire” la cual está conformada por 10 socios responsables y trabajadores. El tiene  23 años de edad, soltero y no tiene hijos. Actualmente vive con sus padres, la cual han sido su motivo para seguir adelante. Miguel cuenta con un estudio de grabaciones. Este negocio surgió con la idea de obtener ganancias y así seguir pagando sus estudios de ingeniería de sistemas. Su mayor deseo es  de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera de ingeniería de sistemas, pues al culminar desea buscar trabajo en una empresa reconocida. Con el crédito que solicito va a implementar su estudio de grabaciones comprando instrumentos como tarjeta de sonido, amplificadores etc la  cual le permita trabajar mejor. La Alcancía Comunal “Yahve Yire” agradece el crédito brindado ya que hacen posible su progreso. Miguel está ubicado en la primera fila, él viste un polo rojo y pantalón color beige.
texts.en:
Miguel is a member of the Yahve Yire comunal bank, which is comprised of ten responsible and hard-working members.  He is 23 years old, single, and has no children.  He is currently living with his parents, which has been his motivation to get ahead.

Miguel has a recording studio.  This business emerged from the idea of getting income to continue paying for his systems engineering studies.  His greatest wish is to satisfactorily complete his systems engineering studies.  Upon completion he wishes to look for work in a well-known company.

He will use the requested loan to purchase instruments like a sound card and amplifiers, etc. to equip his recording studio.  The will allow him to work better.

The Yahve Yire communal bank is grateful for the loan they were granted because it makes their progress possible.  

Miguel is in the first row wearing a red shirt and beige pants.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya where he has had twenty years in active farming and meets all family needs through farming income. His farm currently produces milk, millet, eggs, sorghum, beans and potatoes.

William has requested a third loan of 100,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help him put up a dairy unit at a cost of 30,000 KES and also boost his poultry business by expanding the housing unit at 40,000 KES with the remaining 30,000 KES to go into purchasing chicks. William is planning on concentrating more on poultry and dairy farming in the coming years.

William says Juhudi Kilimo loans have empowered smallholder farmers with him being among the beneficiaries of the loans. He however notes poultry diseases are a challenge and farmers must learn management to avoid gross losses in their businesses.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy poultry

loans.name: Renson

texts.en:
Renson is a farmer in Western Kenya and a father of five children all of school-going ages. He has a farm which produces milk and vegetables for the local market. He also runs a cereals processing business in the local market where he sells his farm produce.

Renson has made a loan request of 82,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow at 52,000 KES as well as construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows at a cost of 30,000 KES.This is his second loan request after the first loan of 40,000 KES which was repaid in a timely manner. He believes his family will benefit greatly with improved farming and more specifically with good milk production both for family consumption and for resale.

Renson concurs that the major challenge in farming remains feed shortages and common diseases for animals. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a father of six children with the first three being adults and the other three being of school-going ages. He has been in farming for eight years and currently sells his produce at the local market. He mainly produces milk, maize and other horticultural products.

He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into the poultry business. He plans to construct a poultry housing unit at 50,000 KES and buy chicks for 30,000 KES. Besides farming he operates a motorcycle transport business which he adds will improve too, once the farming business picks up.

He says sourcing capital has been the main challenge in farming and Juhudi Kilimo loans will help small holder farmers significantly.

loans.use: To construct a poultry housing unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 49 and has been in farming for twelve years in his rural home in Western Kenya. His farm produces milk and maize among other items which all go to the local market. Joseph deals in scrap metals besides farming.

Joseph has requested a loan of 71,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 41,600 KES and build a dairy unit at 30,000 KES. He says these will improve his dairy business income. He believes the income will permit a better living standard for his family and make them more secure financially.

He however laments fluctuations in market prices for farm produce, coupled with unreliable rains and rampant diseases. He reiterates that Juhudi Kilimo loans have helped bridge small holder farmers'  capital challenge.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit and buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Maria Nicolasa, es una persona casada, tiene 44 años de edad, cuenta con 6 hijos 5 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de cortes típicos, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia, inicio siendo trabajadora para otras personas y con el apoyo de su esposo, actualmente ampliar su producción, por lo que solicita un préstamo para compra de hilo que le servirá como materia prima para su trabajo, espera que con el préstamo pueda mejorar y crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Nicolasa, 45, is married and has 6 children, 5 of whom are in school.  She has a business weaving traditional Guatemalan skirts.  She has 5 years of experience with this work, having started out working for other people.  With the support of her husband she is now expanding her production.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy thread that she will use as a raw material for her work.  She hopes that with this loan she can improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave skirts

loans.name: Ingrid Raquel

texts.es: Ingrid Raquel tiene 26 años de edad, es una emprendedora que su actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde atiende a sus clientes a quienes les ofrece sus producto. Esta emprendedora es una luchadora desde muy joven inicio a trabajar para apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Ingrid Raquel está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para la pulpería como granos básicos, aceite, detergente, pan, huevos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Ingrid Raquel, 26, is an enterprising woman who has a grocery store business.  Her store is located in her house, which is where she tends to the customers to whom she offers her products.  This entrepreneur is a fighter.  From the time she was very young she started to work to support her family with the household expenses.  Ingrid Raquel is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store such as: staple grains, cooking oil, detergent, bread, eggs and other products.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, cooking oil, detergent, bread, eggs and other products

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a 31-year-old man, IDP who lives in Bilasuvar, IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 7 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and in fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan family and are also used to make fresh punch.

Ramil sells his crops in the BIlasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 250 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). His wife actively helps him to raise crops.

Because his products are in high demand, Ramil wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit  and purchase a chuff cutter

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth, se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva para ambos sexos; su capacidad de producción mínima es de 16 prendas deportivas por mes, las cuales son vendidas con seguridad a intermediarias que le compran inmediatamente pues los pedidos ya están hechos con anterioridad.  Esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más tela para la confección de los deportivos, pues tiene un pedido mayor y así obtendrá mejores ingresos.
Janeth, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la séptima vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Janeth manufactures sportswear for both sexes.  Her minimum production capacity is 16 sportswear items per month that are guaranteed to sell to intermediaries who buy them immediately because the orders have been placed beforehand.  This is her only source of income to support her family.

She needs the loan to buy more fabric to make sportswear because she has a large pending order and she will earn better income.

Janeth is married and has two children she lives with in her in-laws’ house in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.

This is the 7th time she’s worked with IMPRO and fourth with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make sportwear for men and women.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.es:
Ramil ha dejado su trabajo anterior por motivos de familia.Ahora Ramil, trabaja como administrador en una empresa de bebidas energizantes propiedad de su hijo, del cual percibe un sueldo cada mes.
El crédito lo requiere para realizar los trámites de ingresos de materias primas en aduanas, ya que el negocio es de su hijo y de esta forma ayudar al negocio familiar.
Ramil, es casado y tiene un hijo vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona El Rosario en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Due to family motives, Ramil has left his previous employment.  He now works as an administrator in his son’s energy drink firm earning a monthly salary.

He needs the loan to pay customs fees to import raw materials since the business is his son’s and this is a way to help the family business.

Ramil is married and has a son.  He lives in his in-laws’ house located in the city of La Paz’s El Rosario Zone.

This is the second time he’s worked with IMPRO and second with KIVA.

loans.use: to pay customs fees on imported raw materials.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a farmer in Litein, South Rift area of Kenya, and mother of four children with ages ranging from seventeen to one year old. Her farm produces milk and tea which both go to the local market. She runs a retail shop business besides farming.

Caroline has made a loan request amounting to 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming by buying chicks worth 30,000 KES and improve the dairy business by buying a chuff cutter to ease feeding and reduce the wastage in dairy feeds.

Caroline says harsh weather conditions in the area have always been a challenge, coupled with poor markets locally.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and poultry birds

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya, aged 36 and married with two children aged ten and two years old. He has been in farming for nine solid years. He states that farming income meets all  his family's needs.

Geoffrey has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. His main focus is to own five dairy cows and a motorcycle to ease timely delivery of milk to the market. He adds the income will be used to educate his two children.

He points at lack of finance and animal diseases as the major challenges for farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a farmer in Kitale and is aged 32 with 10 years of experience in farming, besides operating a motorcycle transportation business, popularly known in the area as ‘’boda boda.’’ He currently produces onions, vegetables and tomatoes which he sells at the local market.

Eric has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will help him venture into the dairy farming business and help him realize his dream of having three dairy cows of good breeds which is his focus for the near future.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services but points out that drought and animal diseases are challenges that hurt farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Hubaldo

texts.es:
Hubaldo, trabaja en el área de transporte público como chofer asalariado en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, piedra, ladrillo, para la construcción de una pared para tener linea y nivel de la casa donde vive, requeridos por la alcaldía de la ciudad.
 Hubaldo, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Hubaldo works in pubic transportation as a salaried driver in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy cement, stone and bricks to build a wall that’s straight and level at home that’s a municipal requirement.  Hubaldo is married and has two children.  He lives in his in-law’s house in the city of La Paz’s Chuquiaguillo zone.  This is the first time he’s worked with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Isrrael

texts.es:
Isrrael, trabaja como supervisor en una empresa privada de seguridad y también cuenta con ingresos provenientes de contratos de comida Buffet para eventos especiales.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su capital comprando material de cocina, como más vajilla y ollas  para la elaboración de comida a contrato ya que tendrá más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Isrrael, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz, a quienes colabora con los gastos de la casa.
Es la sexta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Isrrael works as a supervisor in a private security firm and also earns income from contracts to provide buffets at special events.  He needs the loan to increase capital buying kitchen equipment like more dinnerware and pots to prepare the food to spec since he’d than have more income to help his family.

Isrrael is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Obrajes zone and he contributes to household expenses.  This is the sixth time he’s worked with IMPRO and the fourth with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy more dinnerware and pots.

loans.name: Teresa Gerarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa Gerarda;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papas, ella vende en uno de los  mercados de la ciudad del Cusco,la socia trabaja todos los dias vendiendo su mercaderia a las personas que le solicitan para sus distintos negocios como pollerias,restaurantes entre otros, ella tiene un puesto donde vende toda variedad de papa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia , la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia de papas.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa Gerarda belongs to the village bank "Virgen Asunta de Rasca" located in the district, province and department of Cusco. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling potatoes.  She sells potatoes in one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She works every day selling her merchandise to the people who are looking to buy for their different businesses, such as roasted chicken eateries, restaurants and others.  She has a stall where she sells different varieties of potatoes, and this is how she gets ahead with her family.   She wants to expand her potato-selling business. 

She asks for a loan to buy more potatoes. 

She is happy to be getting this loan, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Tirisa

texts.en:
Tirisa is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Tirisa has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Tirisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Tirisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya, where he has been in farming for 20 years. His farm currently produces milk, vegetables, eggs, beans, and maize. He says farming has been his source of income since he became an adult and still provides his family with basic needs. His farm currently employs three farmhands, with dairy farming being his latest venture.

Thomas has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition of a good breed will ensure better milk production and hence good income that will provide for family needs.

He is married with four children aged between 16 and 1 years.

He says poor infrastructure and fluctuation in farm produce remains farmers' main challenges, since their farming follows the seasons.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella tiene un puesto en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia trabaja todos los dias vendiendo su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia de papa para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Rasca” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Elena is the member.  She alternates her daily chores with the business of selling potatoes.  She has a stand in one of the city of Cusco’s markets.  She works every day selling her merchandise to her customers that request it.  She is a responsible person and this is the way she moves her family forward.  She wants to enlarge the potato selling business.

She is asking for the loan to buy more potatoes for her business.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes.

loans.name: Gulbara

texts.ru: Гулбаре 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, 10 лет назад Гулбара начала   заниматься животноводством.  На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулбары имеется 2 дойные коровы, 3 лошади и 25 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульбара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы Гулбара планирует вложить в ремонт дома и покупку мебели, и в  дальнейшем - в увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulbara is 33 years old, married and raising three children. To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry ten years ago. Today, Gulbara's business contains two dairy cows, three horses and twenty-five sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Gulbara requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves. She plans to invest the earnings into repairing her house and purchasing furniture and a future expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Husanboi

texts.ru: Хусанбой сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2008 года.Он женат имеет детей.Хусанбой занимается откормом скота и  разводит их дома.Его жена домохозяйка она сидит дома и воспитывает детей.Но она помогает своему мужу и в сезон когда Хусанбой стрижет коз,она продает шерсть.  Он разводит скот,  с детства ,почти с 3 лет. На полученный кредит он хочет увеличить поголовье скота.Хусанбой выражает свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Husanboi has been partnering with our organization since 2008.  He is married and has children.  Husanboi is involved in fattening up livestock that he keeps at home.  His wife is a homemaker, who stays at home and raises the children, but helps her husband and sells wool during the season when Husanboi shears goats.  Husanboi has been breeding livestock since his childhood, almost since the age of three.  He wants to use this loan to increase his livestock headcount.  Husanboi expresses his gratitude to our organization for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Diele

texts.fr:
Madame Diele gère une boutique de denrées alimentaires depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Diele adore son métier, elle se lève très tôt pour ouvrir à 6h 30mn du matin et ferme à 20 h du soir. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400.000FCFA pour pouvoir honorer une commande de riz, 5 sacs de sucres et 20 litres d’huile. 
Madame Diele ne reste pas les bras croisés car elle participe à la dépense quotidienne de la maison.
Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite disposer d’un bon fond de roulement afin de mieux cerner la clientèle qui demande dès fois de la marchandise qu’elle n’a pas dans sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diele has been running a food store for over five years. She is married with children. With a great love for her work, she gets up very early to open the store at 6:30 in the morning, and closes at 8:00 in the evening.

She is seeking a loan of 400,000CFAF to pay for an order of rice, five bags of sugar and 20 liters of oil. 

Mrs. Diele is actively involved in the daily household expenses. In the future, she would like to be able to rely on her working capital to better meet the needs of her customers who sometimes request merchandise that she does not have on hand.

loans.use: to buy food items such as rice, sugar and oil to sell from her store.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella vende diferentes variedades de papa, la socia trabaja todos los dias en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco vendiendo de forma independiente a las personas que le solicitan,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia ,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de papa. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercaderia de papa para su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Rasca” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Angelica is the member.  She alternates her daily chores with the business of selling potatoes.  She has a stand in one of the city of Cusco’s markets.  She works every day selling her merchandise to her customers that request it.  She is a responsible person and this is the way she moves her family forward.  She wants to enlarge the potato selling business.

She is asking for the loan to buy more potatoes for her business.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca;La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella tiene un puesto de venta de papa en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia trabaja todos los dias en su negocio ,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de papa.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia de papa para su negocio.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Rasca” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

Francisca is the member.  She alternates her daily chores with the business of selling potatoes.  She has a stand in one of the city of Cusco’s markets.  She works every day selling her merchandise to her customers that request it.  She is a responsible person and this is the way she moves her family forward.  She wants to enlarge the potato selling business.

She is asking for the loan to buy more potatoes for her business.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Eliana Roxana

texts.es: Eliana  de 29 años vive (milagro ecuador ). Ella empezó a LOS 14  años solo cociendo ropa con una SEÑORA aprendió  .De Esa manera se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio y decidió poner su propio taller lo hizo y le va bien . A futuro anhela tener su empresa con el préstamo comprara ( maquinas, telas ).
texts.en:
Eliana is 29 years old and lives in Milagro, Ecuador. 
She started out when she was 14, sewing clothing for a lady, and learned from her. That way she realized it was a good business and she decided to set up her own workshop. That is what she did, and it is going well. 
In the future she aspires to have her own company.
She will use the loan to purchase machines and fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and machines.

loans.name: Elikana

texts.en:
Elikana has been farming for eleven years, selling his farm produce of sugarcane and vegetables to the local market. He also drives a motorcycle for a fee on the popular “boda boda” (transport ) business. Elikana, 32 years old, is married and has two children, aged 10 and 2 years.

Elikana has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to grow the dairy business and sell his milk to cooling plants in large quantities. He will use the income to educate his two children.

Elikana laments of poor infrastructure which compels farmers to sell their produce to the local markets which offer very low prices. He, however, appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, ha buscado como mejorar los ingresos para su familia con el fin de que nada les haga falte y puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida cada día. Rosa tiene 3 hijos y es junto a su esposo, con quien los saca adelante, actualmente el se dedica a manejar taxi. Ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú junto a su familia, lugar que ha enfrentado fuertes e intensos sismos en los últimos meses.

Rosa actualmente se dedica a brindar el servicio de alquiler de 3 cuartos en su casa, lo que le permite a tener a sus clientes rentando las habitaciones, lo que le permite generar sus ingresos diarios, a su vez Rosa también realiza el servicio de limpieza de las habitaciones. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y es por eso que actualmente labora también como vendedora de ropa recorriendo las principales calles de la zona en donde vive.

Rosa siempre ha querido progresar y  fue por eso que quiso realizar esta idea de negocio, en la cual está logrando tener los ingresos que ella necesita. Gracias al apoyo que se le está brindado ella podrá realizar la compra de una escalera en forma de caracol y unos cables para tener ropa, lo que le permitirá tener la ropa de sus clientes, después de haberla lavado, de esta manera sus ingresos se incrementaran y así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, principalmente la de sus hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo.

Ella está dispuesta a dar lo mejor de sí, lo que con el tiempo y esfuerzo la llevará a poder construir una habitación más, incrementar sus ganancias y cumplir su gran sueño y meta “Tener un hotel”.
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising, tenacious woman who has sought ways to improve family income so that they would lack nothing and have a better quality of life every day.  Rosa has three children and it’s she together with her husband who moves them forward.  He currently works driving a taxi.  She lives in the city of Ica, Perú with her family, a place that has experienced strong and intense earthquakes the last few months.

Currently Rosa rents out three rooms at home which makes it possible for her to have customers renting her rooms which makes it possible for her to earn daily income.  At the same time, Rosa also is the one that cleans the rooms.  She’s always been a tenacious woman and this is why she’s now also working as a clothes vendor through the main streets in the zone where she lives.

Rosa has always wanted to make progress and this is why she wanted to carry out this business idea that’s producing the income she needs.  Thanks to the support she’s getting she will be able to buy a spiral staircase and cables to hang clothes which will let her hang up her customers’ clothes after she washes them so that her income will increase and she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family, especially for her children who she loves very much.

She is willing to give the best of herself so that in time and with effort she will be able to build an additional room, to increase her profits and reach her great dream and goal: “To have a hotel.”

loans.use: to buy a spiral staircase.

loans.name: Rodolfo Javier

texts.es: Rodolfo C. de 31 años de edad, casado, con metas a futuro. Tiene a su cargo a su abuelita de 69 años de edad  y a su pequeña familia que esta conformada de su hijo de apenas 8 años y su señora esposa quien lo apoya en los gastos del hogar. Hoy en dia esta trabajando fijo, como conductor de reparto  en una de las empresas que se ubican en nuestra capital managua. Sin embargo al tener un tecnico en contabilidad y por falta de oportunidades de empleo no ha podido ejercer su carrera. Una de sus grandes metas es el mejoramiento de su vivienda para ello recurre a Afodenic que le ha sido de apoyo en este proyecto por lo que comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion tales como: bloques, hierro,arena, cemento, tablas, cuartones, piedrin, alambre de amarre, laminas de zinc entre otros y asi comenzar la obra de la construccion de un cuarto, logrando con esto brindale mayores comodidades y mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Sus planes en un futuro es poner su negocio propio para asi trabajar por cuenta propia y ser el su propio jefe.
texts.en:
Rodolfo C., 31, is married and has future goals.  His 69 year old grandmother is in his care and his small family is composed of his 8 year old son and his wife who helps him with household expenses.  

At present he has a steady job as a deliveryman for a firm located in our capital, Managua.  However, he’s an accounting technician but due to the lack of employment opportunities has been unable to practice his profession.  

One of his great goals is to do some home improvements and this is why he calls on Afodenic which has supported this project.  He will buy construction materials and supplies like concrete blocks, rebar, sand, cement, boards, beams, gravel, metal ties and metal sheeting, among others, to start building a room thus providing more comfort and better living conditions for his family.  

His plan for the future is to set up a business of his own so that he can work for himself and be his own boss.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married mother of four children aged from 1 to 18 years old. Her eldest child has completed high school. Sarah sells her farm produce of beans and peas to the local market. She also trades livestock, mainly cattle, to supplement her farming income.

Sarah has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to repay the loan as well as educate her children. She hopes to own four dairy cows in the next four years. Sarah is advocating for bigger loans that can fund the purchase of assets such as land.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El presente grupo se formo con miembros que formaban parte de otro comité, ellas decidieron seguir trabajando y por medio de ese trabajo ayuda a cada una de sus familias.  Actualmente el grupo se encuentra  en el tercer ciclo del programa y su meta es poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra. Carmen es integrante del comité, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada con el Sr José y  juntos tienen 5 hijos. La Sra Carmen se dedica a la venta de tortas en su propia casa. Comenta que tiene buena clientela ya que los productos que hace son muy ricos y eso le da muy buena fama. Ella es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Solicita el crédito para comprar harina, huevos, mantecas,  azúcar y demás insumos que necesite para las tortas que ella vende. Agradece por la oportunidad de crecimiento que está recibiendo, pues le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
This group was founded by members who belonged to another committee, who decided to continue working and help each of their families with their work. Currently the group is in their third cycle with the program, and their goal is to achieve the program's highest level.
Carmen is a member of the committee. She is 33 years old, is married to José, and together they have five children. 
Carmen sells cakes from her own home. She says that she has a good customer base because the products she makes are very tasty, and that gives her a very good reputation. She is very eager to get ahead and make progress.
She is requesting a loan to purchase flour, eggs, lard, sugar, and other raw materials she needs for the cakes that she sells. She is grateful to receive this opportunity to grow, because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, lard, etc.

loans.name: Responsabilidad Y Progreso Group

texts.es: La Sra. Nancy de 48 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 1 aún depende de ella. Tiene 8 meses con Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de helados y golosinas desde hace 4 años. Anteriormente trabajaba en un comedor popular y comenzó con la idea de construir su casa y dar estudio superior  a sus hijos. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado hacer estudiar a 4 de sus hijos. Actualmente su ingreso lo destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación, mientras que su esposo cubre los gastos de agua, luz y teléfono. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un taller de vulcanizador de autos. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de frutas y en la implementación de su negocio. Nancy pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Responsabilidad y Progreso”, el cual esta conformado por  6 personas y lleva 8 meses como presidenta del grupo.
texts.en:
Nancy, 48, has a spouse and five children one of which still depends on her.  She’s been with Edaprospo for 8 months and she has been selling ice-cream and snacks for four years.  She used to work at a low-cost eatery and started with the idea of building her house and providing higher education to her children.  With her effort and work she’s managed to put four of her children through school.

She currently uses her income to cover food costs while her husband covers water, electricity and telephone.  Her plan for the future is to open a tire repair shop.

She used her loan to buy fruit and to equip her business.  Nancy belongs to the “Responsabilidad y Progreso” (Responsibility and Progress) communal bank which has six members and she’s been its president for 8 months.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Salieu

texts.en:
This is Salieu.  He is 45 years old, married and has two children who are 16 and 12 years of age.  

In 2004, Salieu established his business, which focuses on selling stationary, clocks, flowers and other items.  He began this business because, after completing his high school education, there were no jobs available for him.  He works seven days a week, 10 hours a day and he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month.  He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL.  Salieu requires a loan in order to travel to buy more stationary and clocks in large quantity for his business.  

In the future, Salieu plans to expand his business in other locations.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stationary and clocks for his business.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.ru: Раби сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. До этого также получал кредит но по семейным обстоятельствам уезжал в Российскую Федерацию. На рынке он работает почти 6 лет, торгуя  мужской обувью. Сейчас у него начинается летний сезон продаж обуви, и торговля идет хорошо. Поэтому он планирует привезти широкий ассортимент товара. Жена его также торгует на рынке нижним бельем. В бизнесе Раби помогает старший сын, он ведет торговлю когда Раби уезжает за товаром.
texts.en: Rabi has been partnering with our organization since 2009.  Before that, he also obtained a loan but had to go to the Russian Federation due to family obligations.  Rabi has been working at the market for almost six years, selling men's shoes.  Currently, his summer season of shoe sales is starting, and sales are going well.  This is why he plans to bring in a wide selection of merchandise.  His wife is also involved in sales at the market and sells undergarments.  Rabi's oldest son helps him with this business - he runs the sales when Rabi leaves to get merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shоes

loans.name: Makhsud

texts.ru: Махсуд проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он более семи лет занимается торговлей. В основном Махсуд продает продуты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Makhsud lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 28 years old, married and has three children.  He has been involved in sales for over seven years.  Makhsud primarily sells food products.  He is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Izzatbibi

texts.ru: Иззатбиби сотрудничает с "Арванд" с 2004 года. В течении 8 лет она развивает свой бизнес благодаря кредиту нашей организации. Более 9 лет она торгует на рынке различным видам товара. Продукты питания она начала продавать 8 лет назад. Теперь она продает на рынке конфеты, вафли, печенья и  другие сладости.Ее бизнес успешно развивается.Она безмерно благодарно  за финансовую поддержку организации "Арванд".
texts.en: Izzatbibi has been partnering with "Arvand" since 2004.  She has been developing her business during the last eight years thanks to the loan from our organization.  Izzatbibi has been selling various types of merchandise at a market for over nine years.  She started selling food products eight years ago.  Now she sells candy, waffles, cookies and other sweets at the market.  Her business is developing successfully.  Izzatbibi is immeasurably grateful for the financial support from the "Arvand" organization.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del grupo fue una de las miembros, quien invito a sus amigas y vecinas y de alli surgio el comité llamado tajy poty. Esta integrado por 19 mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y crecer en cada uno de sus emprendimientos.
La sra.Blasida es integrante del grupo, ella esta casada con el señor Francisco, tiene  2 hijos pequeños que dependen de ambos. Blásida se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo en lo cual le va muy bien ya que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre compran de ella. Quiere seguir trabajando y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de  carne, huevo, tomate, lechuga, tapa para empanadas, etc.  Blasida tiene como meta avanzar con el negocio y poder vender mas cosas aparte de los comestibles.
texts.en:
The initial contact person for this group was one of the members who invited her friends and neighbors and from there the committee called “Tajy Poty” was born.  It’s composed of 19 very hardworking women who very much want to get ahead and grow in each of their enterprises.

Blásida is a group member.  She’s married to Francisco and has two small children still dependent on both of them.  Blásida sells all types of foodstuffs; she does very well because she has a good number of customers who always buy from her.  

She wants to continue working and this is why she’s requesting a loan to buy meat, eggs, tomatoes, lettuce and potatoes to make turnovers, etc.  Blásida’s goal is to advance with her business and to be able to sell other things besides foodstuffs.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, tomatoes, lettuce and potatoes to make turnovers, etc.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Sagrada familia es el grupo integrado por  18 mujeres, donde cada una tiene una actividad en la que trabaja. Ellas tienen  las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, por medio del trabajo en quipo y utilizando todos los medio que tienen.
Isabel es un ejemplo de lucha, es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de cambiar su vida y ayudar a su familia, es por ello que siempre da lo mejor de ella para salir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas y nos comenta que gracias a este trabajo puede ayudar en la casa con los gastos del día a día.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca la época de frio y quiere poder tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Sagrada Familia” (Holy Family) is a group made up of 18 women each working in her own activity.  They all want to continue working for their families with teamwork and using all means at their disposal.

Isabel is an example of this struggle.  She’s a very hardworking person who wants to change her life and help her family.  Because of this she always gives the best of herself to get ahead.  She sells all types of clothes and tells us that thanks to this work she’s been able to help at home with everyday expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to stock up on winter clothes because the cold season is approaching and she wants to have a good variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Susana is the coordinator of her group, Con Dios Adelante 3, 4, & 5 (Forward with God). This group is located in in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and the tourist industry dominate the economy. They all live in a "Batey" outside the city, surrounded by sugarcane fields. They are Haitian citizens working in the Dominican Republic.

Susana is the mother of four children and they live together in a modest home with her husband. She says that her most important challenge is to work to get what she and her family need, and to support her children. In the meantime she plans to continue to enjoy resting after her work day.

Susana is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around seven years, starting with some capital she and her husband saved. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes, shoes, womens' accessories and cosmetics products, etc. She wishes to have a successful business. Susana will uses her business profits to reinvest and to save. She dreams of having her own house.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, womens' accessories and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a father of seven adult children and is aged 62 years. He has 20 years of experience in the farming business. He also runs a retail shop business. His farm produces onions and vegetables but he now wants to venture into dairy farming as well.

Titus has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for a new venture into dairy farming. He strongly believes this will boost his income and the ease provisions of family basic needs through resale and milk for family consumption.

He too points at harsh weather conditions and animal diseases as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат с мужем разводят мелко рогатый скот. Муж Ибодат часто ездит в Российскую Федерацию на заработки, и по возможности  присылает ей деньги. У них 4 дочек, поэтому она копит на приданное дочерей. С каждым разом продажи  скота они приобретают скот по моложе и покупают что либо необходимое   для дома. Присылаемые мужем деньги хватает только на содержание семьи и на небольшое сбережение,а на бизнес почти не остается.  Получив новый кредит в "Арванаде"  она тем самым, планирует увеличить поголовье скота, и очень радуется этому.
texts.en: Ibodat and her husband breed small livestock.  Her husband often travels to the Russian Federation for work and sends money home when he can.  They have four daughters, and this is why Ibodat is saving for their dowries.  With each sale of livestock, Ibodat and her husband buy younger livestock and buy whatever necessities for home.  The money sent by her husband is only enough to support the family and to have small savings, and does not leave much for the business.  Ibodat plans to increase livestock headcount by obtaining a new loan from "Arvand" and is very happy about this.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is the father of three children aged five, three and one year.  He has been farming for five years.  He is currently producing mainly maize, potatoes and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Peter has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy and insure a dairy cow.  He believes that, as a result, his dairy will improve and generate increased income to enable the acquisition of more assets to secure the family future.  He also wants to venture into poultry farming. 

He laments the poor roads and prices for farm produce in the local markets.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Диловар предоставляет услуг, такси. В этой области он пять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Dilovar lives in the town of Istaravshan. He is 26 years old, he is married. Dilovar is providing a taxi service. He has been in this business for five years. He is taking out the loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair the car.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and has three adult children.  She is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and has been in farming for 19 years.  She says farming has been the primary means to earn her livelihood; although, she currently runs a cereals processing business in the local community as well, which supplements her earnings from the farming business.

Emily has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says that the additional dairy cow will increase the family income, thus improving the family’s wellbeing.  She plans to own a farm of five dairy cows in the future.

Emily says that poor road networks and animal diseases are the main challenges farmers in the area have to grapple with.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene 38 años,  es separada con 3 hijos de las edades de  (19, 12 y 10) años, ella se dedica a la  venta de comida que se encuentran en la zona de Tembladerani,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Verónica  utilizara este préstamo para refacción del local de expendio de comida. Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar la imagen de su negocio y así brindar a sus  clientes comodidad, la Sra.  Verónica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su atención en cuanto a su competencia en el mercado y  utilizara los beneficios para seguir  mejorando el ambiente de atención  a sus comensales, la Sra. Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Verónica is 38 years old, she is separated and has three children, ages 19, 12, and 10. She sells food in the Tembladerani area.
This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Verónica will use this loan for repairs in her place of business, where she sells her food. The reason she is requesting this loan is to improve the image of her business, so that she can make her customers more comfortable.
Verónica faces challenges in her business, which are to improve her attention to competition in the market. She will use her profits to continue improving an environment of service to her guests. 
Verónica is a very hard worker. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support that granting this loan has offered her.

loans.use: to make repairs in her place of business, which sells food.

loans.name: Aoko

texts.en:
Aoko is thirty-six years old and the mother of three children between the ages of six and 15 years.  She has been in farming for six years and her farm currently produces milk and vegetables, which she sells to the local market.  In addition, she runs a business, milling cereals.

Aoko has requested a loan in the amount of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says that the acquisition of a better breed of cow will improve both her milk production and the family income.  She aspires to be a leading supplier of milk to the local markets in the region.

She laments the shortage of animal feed in the area during the dry seasons.  However, she is pleased with the loan services provided by Juhudi Kilimo, saying that the loans have helped farmers to both acquire better breeds and improve their incomes.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Korir

texts.en:
Korir is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for the last six years and currently is supplying his milk and tea to the local markets. He also operates a motorcycle transport business popularly known as “boda boda”

Korir has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter, which will help in better feeding for his dairy animals. He adds that this machine will help reduce wastage of the fodder feed and man hours spent on preparing the feed. He says his improved income will help him to establish a good foundation for his family.

He laments of hostile weather conditions.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Haja.  She is widowed and has two children who are 5 and 9 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help in the business.  In 2002, Haja established her plastic utensils business. She began her business to be able to meet her family and personal needs. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Haja has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional plastic buckets, stove, plastic bowl, plastic dishes and set pans. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Haja plans to expand and move to a shop in the central market. Being that it is an open stall, when it rains business is disturbed. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic buckets, rubber bowls, and plastic dishes

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a father of two children who are seven and five years old. He lives with his family in Kitale, Western Kenya where he has been actively engaged in farming for six years. His farm is currently run with the help of one farmhand and produces milk and maize, which are both sold locally.

Michael has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will boost his farming income and enable him to meet his family needs. He aspires to have five dairy cows and supply his produce to Kenya Co-operative society, which offers better prices for milk.

He sees animal diseases as the greatest challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1996 году  Анар начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство Анар на сегодняшний день  приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы Анар планирует вложить в увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Anar is 44 years old, marreid and is raising four children. To find a source of income for her family Anar started animal husbandry business in 1996. The business started by Anar with a sum of 8,000 som (KGS) which now brings in around 9,000 som a month. With the goal to further develop her business Anar has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 35,000 KGS to buy sheep. Anar plans to invest the income from the loan to increase her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Mahukpego 14 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO 14 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ablawa Yvette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ablawa Yvette est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Ablawa Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ablawa Yvette est mariée à un gardien du nom de Isidore. Le couple a trois enfants dont un seul enfant est à leur charge. Aucun des enfants n’est scolarisé. Ablawa Yvette vit ensemble avec son enfant à charge et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Ablawa Yvette vend depuis cinq ans de l’igname, de jus de bissaps et de l’eau glacée dans son quartier au Benin. Ablawa Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ablawa Yvette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKPEGO 14, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "MAHUKPEGO 14" comprises three persons who are friends living in the same district. The group's representative, Ablawa Yvette, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 40 years old and lives in Benin. 

Ablawa Yvette did not attend school. She is married to a security guard named Isidore. They have three children, of whom only one is in their care. None of the children have had schooling. Ablawa Yvette lives together with her dependent child and her husband. She ensures, along with her husband, that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To ensure these expenses are covered, she has been selling yams, hibiscus drinks, and ice water for five years in her district in Benin. She gets her supplies  from a market in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and increase her sales and her revenues, Ablawa Yvette is requesting, along with the other members of the group MAHUKPEGO 14, a third loan from ALIDé. The two loan received previously have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of yams and hibiscus leaves

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya and has been in dairy farming for five years. His farm produces milk, which he sells to the local market. He also operates as a broker for tea, which he sources from the local farmers and sells to factories both within and outside of the Litein area.

Nathan has made a loan request for 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy a chuff cutter to improve his dairy animal's feeding. He says his focus is just to concentrate on making his dairy business better, enjoy the economies of scale with time and be able to provide his family with basic needs.

He says the major challenge remains poor market prices within the local market and the poor road system, which compels farmers to sell to the local markets.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Idrissa.  He is married, and has two children who are 5 and 13 years old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help a late sister with her child's education.  In 1998, Idrissa established his used clothing business. He began his business out of the need to be self reliant after helping a brother with his business for a long time. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Idrissa has already received and successfully repaid five loans and now requires a new loan to buy additional used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Idrissa plans to add to the business and expand. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
