Leonard is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where he lives with his family of four children. Three of the children are already schooling. He has been in mixed farming producing mainly milk and tomatoes for the local market. He also does lumbering for additional income though very sporadically.

Leonard has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and diversify his farming business. He reiterates this will make him earn income regularly, unlike relying on maize and tomatoes, which bring income seasonally. He adds the proceeds will help in educating the children.

He says the poor state of the roads and poultry diseases are the inherent challenges. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loan services to small-holder farmers.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh  loge à environ 22 km de la ville principale, ou il a ouvert une boutique de vente d’alimentation générale. Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine. Cheikh adore son métier et est très ambitieux. Il démarre sa journée à 7h 30mn du matin pour la finir à 22 h du soir.
Il vient solliciter pour la seconde fois un appui à l’IMCEC pour le financement de son projet. Il désirerait acheter  80 litres d’huile, 4 sacs de 50 kg de sucre, 2 tonnes de riz.
Bien qu’étant jeune et célibataire, il soutient beaucoup son père dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Il  a comme projet futur de devenir un grossiste.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh is housed about 22 km from the main city, where he opened a store selling grocery items. He has over five years of experience in this domain. He loves his trade and is very ambitious. He starts his day at 7:30 AM and finishes at 10 PM. 

Cheikh has just requested a loan for a second time from the microfinance institution IMCEC to finance his project. He would like to buy 80 liters of oil, four 50-kg sacks of sugar, and 2 tonnes of rice.

Even though he is young and unmarried, he does a lot to support his father in managing day-to-day family expenses. His future plans include becoming a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: to buy grocery items (oil, sugar, rice) to stock up his store

loans.name: Gladys Espinoza

texts.es: Gladys de oficio comerciante es originaria de León, madre de un hijo, soltera,  desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio  anteriormente tenia el negocio de pulpería actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de sal, recibe el apoyo de un hijo en esta actividad mientras ella se dedica a la costura ya que es costurera como otra  forma de obtener mas ingresos, sus expectativa es seguir trabajando en la producción de sal ya que quiere dejársela como herencia a su hijo para que tenga en que trabajar en un futuro. Solicita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra de producción de sal con el objetivo de detener la venta de sal hasta venderla a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Gladys is a merchant who is originally from León. She is single and the mother of one child. Gladys has been in the retail trade for 20 years. She previously managed a grocery store, but now she has a business that produces salt. Her son helps with the business, which also allows her to work as a seamstress in order to earn more income.

Her expectations include continuing her salt production business so that she can leave an inheritance for her son that will allow him to work in the future. Gladys is requesting a loan to pay for labor required of salt production. Her intention is to stop selling salt until she is able to get a better price.

loans.use: to pay for labor required of salt production.

loans.name: Salieu

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Salieu. He is married and has three children who are 4, 8 and 13 years old. He has two additional dependents who live with him to care for his parents (mother & father).  In 2005, Salieu established his used clothing business. He began his business out of the need to be self-reliant.. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Salieu requires a new loan in order to buy additional used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Salieu plans to open another stall for his wife on the outskirts of town. When it rains, business is disturbed because the stall is not well covered. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more poultry birds

loans.name: Tamara Kruspkaya

texts.es: Tamara es una joven de apenas 29 años de edad, soltera, con muchas aspiraciones en la vida, continua con su profesion como medico internista. Profesion que llego a culminar primeramente mediante la sabiduria que Dios le dio durante el transcurso de su carrera  y luego por el apoyo incondicional de parte de sus padres que son su real tesoro en esta tierra. La  joven al no tener compromiso mas que con sus padres y el sastifacer sus propios deseos ha venido haciendole mejoras a la vivienda de su mama. El objetivo de Tamara es el mejoramiento de su vivienda, en donde ha venido trabajando en tres ciclos de financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado. Es por tal razon que recurre una vez mas a la institucion para que sea por medio de ella este nuevo proyecto llevado a cabo comprando los siguientes materiales de construccion: veinte laminas de zinc, perlin, cemento, golosos entre otros. obteniendo con esta mejora a su hogar el cambio de techo en dos cuartos y brindales la seguridad adecuada a sus padres que es lo  esencial para ella.
texts.en:
Tamara is a young woman who just turned 29 years of age. She is single and has many aspirations in life. Tamara continues in her profession as a medical intern. She arrived at his profession mainly due to the guidance she received from God over the course of her career and the unconditional support she later received from her parents who are her real treasure here on earth. This young woman has no other commitments to her parents, so it gives her satisfaction whenever she makes improvements to her mother's home.

Tamara's goal is to make improvements to her mother's home and she has worked in three loan cycles with AFODENIC. She has returned once again to AFODENIC to receiving funding for her new project. Tamara plans to buy the following construction materials: 20 sheets of zinc, crossbeams, cement, screws, and other supplies. By obtaining these materials, she will be able to replace the roof over two rooms and provide greater security for her parents who are important to her.

loans.use: to replace the roof over two rooms in her house.

loans.name: Siphorose

texts.en:
Siphorose has been in mixed farming for five successive years with her farm producing mainly vegetables and eggs, which provide the income to meet her family's basic needs. She is married with eight children between 16 and eight years old.

Siphorose has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farm by buying more birds. She is focusing on embarking on dairy farming as well but once her poultry business is well established. She reiterates that the well-being of her family fully relies on farming.

She observes, however, that the challenges of drought and poultry diseases are real and need experience to limit losses resulting from the same.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer, aged twenty-seven, with four successive years in farming. His farm has been producing vegetables, onions and maize for the local market, save for small amounts consumed within the family. He also works as a teacher in a local primary school.

Peter has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes his venture into dairy farming will produce adequate milk to meet his family’s milk requirements and for resale to meet other needs. He hopes to own at least three dairy cows in three years.

He also concurs that harsh weather conditions are a challenge to farmers, especially with dairy animals which need better feeding.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of one child. She lives in the Coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. She runs a grocery stall which has been in operation for the last three years. She was introduced to the business by a friend and using the savings she had, Mariam went to the market, bought stock and started the business.

She is currently applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more vegetables and groceries. Although the business faces a challenge of price fluctuations and seasonal weather, i.e. drought and related effects, Mariam believes the business has a future and is determined to make profit from it.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and groceries.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a mobile money transfer shop, a booming business which has found its niche in the Kenyan market. The business has been in operation for the last five years. He started with a cash float (electronic credits that serve as virtual currency) of $500. The business helps one to send money through mobile phones as coded text messages through an agent, and James is one such agent.

James learnt of Milango from one of his friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to increase the till money. He aspires to open other businesses using the additional income from this loan.

loans.use: to increase the till money.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and owns a barber shop which has been in operation for eight years; he began the business from the savings he had made for a long period of time.

Said is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase shavers and other business equipment. He was introduced to Milango by his friends. Although the business faces the challenge of the high cost of purchasing equipment, Said believes that the addition of these new machines will help improve on his sales.

His ambition is to open other barber shops.

loans.use: to purchase shavers and other business equipment.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a mother of two children and lives in the coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She runs a retail shop which has been in operation for two years and was started from her savings. On learning of Milango from her friends, Eunice joined in order to access funds for business expansion. Besides this, Eunice also owns a motorcycle which she uses for a transport business.

Eunice is applying for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock, e.g. wheat and maize flour, sugar, soft drinks, etc. Despite the challenges of some clients not paying on time and price fluctuations, Eunice believes the income from this loan will help her pay fees for her children’s education, access better health care and also develop a residential house.

loans.use: to purchase retail stock, e.g. wheat and maize flour, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Minara

texts.ru: Минаре  23 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей пяти и  трех лет. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 2009 году Минара начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Минара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Минара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Minara is 23 years old, married and raising two children, who are five and three years old.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 2009.  The business, started with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS), today yields about 4,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Minara requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ivette Maribel

texts.es:
Ivette es una joven muy trabajadora y entusiasta, es madre y su única hija tiene 16 años de edad, a la cual ha sacado adelante sola, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo otro de sus atractivos turísticos es la famosa “bruja de Cachiche”, la cual es visitada por infinidad de turistas en cualquier época del año. Ivette es una madre amorosa, por ello su pasatiempo favorito es pasear con su hija para que ambas se distraigan un poco, asimismo le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Tallarín Rojo con papa a la Huancaína”.

Cada día Ivette se levanta con mucho entusiasmo, ya que le gusta su trabajo, ella se dedica al cuidado de niños, trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al dia  sobre todo con niños cuyos padres tienen que trabajar y no tienen quien pueda cuidadr a sus pequeños, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amorosa con los niños y porque como  son personitas tan delicadas y frágiles, necesitan mucho cuidado y los pdres de los pequeños tienen mucha confianza en ella ya que los cuida bien.

Ivette está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda para dar mayor seguridad a los niños que cuida, en especial poner pisos especiales para los niños, juegos educativos, entre otros, así podrá dar un mayor servicio en beneficio de los niños que ella cuida, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para realizar su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia, ya que actualmente vive en una casa alquilada”.
texts.en:
Ivette is a very hard-working and enthusiastic woman.  She is a mother, and her only daughter is 16.  She has taken care of her by herself.  Her home is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by having one of the country's most important tourist attractions, the "Laguna de Huacachina."  Another one of its tourist attractions is the famous "Cachiche witch," which is visited by many tourists all year round.  Ivette is a loving mother.  Her favorite pastime is spending time with her daughter so they can both distract themselves a little bit.  She also like to prepare her favorite dish, which is the delicious "red noodles with Huancayo style potatoes."  

Every day Ivette gets up with a lot of enthusiasm since she likes her job.  She makes a living by caring for children.  She does this for about 5 hours a day, mostly with children whose parents have to work, and they don't have anyone who can care for their little ones.  She believes that her business is going well because she is very loving with the children and because they are like delicate and fragile little people.  They need a lot of care, and their parents have a lot of trust in her that she takes good care of them.

Ivette is very thankful to the Kiva lenders.  Because of the support they have offered her, she will be able to make improvements to her home to give more safety to the children she takes care of.  In particular, she will have special floors put in for the children, educational games, etc., to give them better service.  This will let her increase her income, so she can keep fighting for her great dream: "to have her own home, since she currently lives in a rented house."

loans.use: To make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is a 57-year-old man who is married with four children. He is an IDP, or internally displaced person. (Much like a refugee, an IDP has been forced to flee his home due to threat or disaster but unlike a refugee is still within his nation's borders). Elman is a market vendor and has 17 years of experience in this field. He sells different kinds of home products, food, and beverages in his shop, which is right next to his house.

During his years of experience, Elman has learned the exact needs of his customers and tried to meet those needs. His monthly income is 150 AZN. Now Elman would like to renovate his shop and buy additional home products and food products. For this purpose he applied for a 1300 AZN loan. He promises to pay it back on time.

loans.use: to purchase additional home products and food products.

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en:
Nabi is a 24-year-old young man. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and he lives with his wife and daughter in the Bilasuavr IDP settlement. For the past five years, Nabi has been breeding cattle. He gets financial support from the government, but 100 AZN is too small an amount to cover his family's needs.

Cattle breeding requires a lot of physical activity and spending most of the time in the open air. Pasturing takes 80% of Nabi's time. He usually buys small calves to raise and fatten for five or six months and then resell at the livestock bazaar for a more profitable price. Nabi's monthly income is 50 AZN and this business is the only source of income for his family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes such as pilau and dolma. 

Nabi is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle. He needs his loan to increase monthly capital and to meet his customer's needs.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Kairkul

texts.ru: Каиркул 41 год, замужем, воспитывает трех детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1997 году Каиркул начала   заниматься животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных  продуктов. На сегодня в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 3 дойные коровы, 2 телки, 2 лошади и 10 овец. Также, Каиркул обрабатывает 1,50 га собственной и 5 га аренодованной земли, где она выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каиркул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота и семян ячменя. Доходы Каиркул планирует вложить в покупку техники для дома, а в дальнейшем – в  увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Kairkul is 41 years old, married and raising three children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry and farming in 1997.  The business, started with an initial sum of 2,000 som (KGS), today yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Today, her business contains three dairy cows, two heifers, two horses and ten sheep.  Kairkul also works on 1.50 hectares of owned and 5 hectares of leased land, where she grows barley.  In order to further develop her business, Kairkul requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock and barley seeds.  She plans to invest the earnings into a purchase of electronics for home and an expansion of her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Marapat

texts.ru: Марапат 53 года, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1980 году Марапат начала   заниматься животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое с покупки одной коровы хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных  продуктов. В настоящее время в хозяйстве семейства имеются 2 коровы, 1 бычок, 1 телёнок, и 11 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Марапат обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Марапат планирует вложить в увеличение своего  хозяйства за счет покупки породистых овец.
texts.en: Marapat is 53 years old, married and raised two children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry and farming in 1980.  The business, started with a purchase of one cow, today yields about 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  At the present time, the family business contains two cows, one bull, one calf and eleven sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Marapat requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock and barley seeds.  She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her business by purchasing purebred sheep.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay is 49 years old and married with three children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and he lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. For the past 10 years, Oktay has been breeding cow and cattle and selling milk, milk products, and cattle to be butchered. He also raises sheep. Oktay's father taught him how to look after cattle. He receives 120 AZN in financial support from the government, but this is too low to cover his family's needs. Oktay's business is the sole income in his family and it is not enough to cover basic needs of his beloved children.

Oktay usually buys small calves to raise and fatten for five or six months and then resell at the livestock bazaar for a more profitable price. He sells milk and yoghurt to his neighbors, which brings in 300 AZN per month. Milk, yoghurt, beef, and mutton are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and they always use yoghurt sauce as milk products are considered very healthy and also present in everyday life.   

Oktay is requesting a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, one milk cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is 28 years old and is married with two children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP Settlement. For the past five years, Aynura has been farmer and she raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. Her experience makes her a skilled person in her field. Aynura usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on many tables in Azerbaijan and families also make fresh punch.  Aynura's monthly income is 300 AZN. Raising crops is taking a lot of strength and working in the open air which is very hard for woman. Aynura's son helps her. 

Aynura is requesting a 600 AZN loan to invest in seeds and fertilizer. Her loan will allow her to improve the quality of her products and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru: Свете 55 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1995 году Света начала   заниматься торговлей овощами.  Начатый со стартовой суммы в 200 сом (KGS) бизнес, благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду Светы   приносит около 20,000 (KGS) сом в месяц. На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Света  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS).  Доходы от кредита Света  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса за счет покупки контейнера для торговли.
texts.en: Sveta is 55 years old, married and raised four children. To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in selling vegetables in 1995.  The business, started with an initial sum of 200 som (KGS), now yields about 20,000 som (KGS) per month, thanks to Sveta's persistence and hard work.  Today, the selection of products is limited, and this is why Sveta requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business by buying a container to conduct sales in.

loans.use: to broaden product selection

loans.name: Denia Lorena

texts.es:
Denia , vive en una pequeña comunidad rural llamada Coris, ubicada en la provincia de Cartago. 
Ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas menores.
Como forma de lograr independencia económica y superarse como mujer , realiza desde hace más de 10años, el diseño personalizado y producción de ropa deportiva y trajes de baño, en un taller ubicado en la misma propiedad en que está su casa de habitación.
Ella todos los días atiende su taller  de 1pm a 7pm en las mañanas va al gimnasio y a la vez entrega su producto, cobra y recibe pedidos nuevos, ya que la gran mayoría de sus clientas son mujeres que hacen ejercicios y asisten a gimnasios.
En este momento ella requiere apoyo económico para poder comprar suficiente materia prima, que por sus características debe hacerlo en volumen para bajar el costo, ya que es importada de Brasil y poder atender la demanda que tiene.
Ella tiene entre sus planes futuros registrar una marca para sus prendas.
Como meta suya y familiar es lograr capitalizar parte de sus utilidades para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Denia lives in a small rural community called Coris, located in the province of Cartago. She lives with her husband and their two young daughters.  

In order to gain financial independence and get ahead as a woman, for more than ten years she has made personalized designs and production of athletic clothing and bathing suits in a workshop located on the same property as her house. Every day she tends to her workshop from 1 pm to 7 pm. Mornings she goes to the gymnasium and delivers her products and collects and gets new orders. Most of her customers are women who exercise and go to gyms.   

At this time, she needs financial support to be able to buy enough materials. She has to do it in large quantities to lower the cost, since it is imported from Brazil and this way she can meet the demand she has. 

Her plans for the future are trademarking her brand of clothing. Her personal and family goal is to capitalize a part of her profits to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy materials for making athletic clothing.

loans.name: Famau

texts.en:
Famau is married and a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. For the past two years, she has worked as a sugar supplier in her coastal town. Famau got the capital to start her business from a contribution from her husband. Her lack of business capital led her to join Milango after receiving an invitation from a company staff member. 

Famau is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase sugar to sell. In the future, she hopes to save her income and have her own her work space instead of renting.

loans.use: to purchase sugar to sell

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru:
Токтокан 61 год, вдова.   В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1985 году Токтокан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы в 9,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Токтокан, ее хозяйство со скотом приносит около 9,500 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтокан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 45,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов овец. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Toktokan is 61 years old, a widow.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1985 with an initial sum of 9,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Toktokan's persistent and hard work, her business now yields about 9,500 som (KGS) in monthly profit.  In order to further develop her business, Toktokan requested a loan in the amount of 45,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “8 de diciembre” trabaja conjuntamente, ya que siempre hacen actividades para que de esa forma tengan un pequeño ahorro con el cual puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Señora Marta es una persona muy trabajadora, con ansias de trabajar y salir adelante para mejorar su estilo de vida y aumentar sus ingresos. Ella es cocinera y comenta que tiene muy buenas manos para la cocina, ya que sus platillos son muy ricos.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con verduras, hortalizas, condimentos y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo como microempresaria. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo con un gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
The “8 de diciembre” Women's Committee works together. They always do activities so that they have some small savings with which they can help one another. 

Marta is a very very hardworking person who wants to work and get ahead to improve her quality of life and increase her income. She is a cook and says that she is good in the kitchen and her dishes are delicious. She is asking for the loan to stock up on vegetables, produce, condiments and other ingredients to be able to keep working and growing as a micr-business woman. She is defined as a hardworking woman and above all as having an entrepreneurial spirit.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, produce, condiment and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ngale

texts.en:
Ngale is married and does not have children. He lives in the coastal town of Mariakani, Kenya. For the past 15 years, he has been a cobbler. He began repairing shoes and his business has grown. Ngale is currently making shoes. He learned about Milango from an employee and he joined to access funds to expand his business.

Ngale is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to purchase new shoes and shoe soles. In the future, his ambition is to expand his business, employ more staff, and own other shops.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and soles

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.ru:
Толгонай 52 года, замужем.   В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2002 году Толгонай начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  покупки 5 овец. Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Толгонай, ее хозяйство на сегодня насчитывает 18 овец. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Толгонай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов овец. Доходы от кредита Толгонай планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Tolgonai is 52 years old, married.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 2002 with an initial purchase of five sheep.  Thanks to Tolgonai's persistent and hard work, today her business contains 18 sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Tolgonai requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sanubar

texts.en:
Sanubar is 46 years old and married with two children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with her family in an IDP settlement. For the past 10 years, Sanubar has been a farmer and who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. Her experience makes her a skilled farmer and she usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on many tables in Azerbaijan and families also make fresh punch. Sanubar's monthly income is 300 AZN. Raising crops takes a lot of strength and work in the open air which is very hard for woman which is why her husband helps her. 

Sanubar is requesting a 600 AZN loan to invest in seed and fertilizer. Her loan will allow her to improve quality of her products and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Qizbas

texts.en:
Qizbas, a 59-year-old married woman, raises fruits and vegetables in her garden. She started this business 15 years ago. She chose this field because fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan and people like to eat them and to make fresh juices, which is very healthy. 

Her husband sells her crops in the central bazaar. He helps her because raising crops and working in the open air takes a lot of strength and is very hard for a woman.

Qizba's monthly income is 400 AZN. She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and to increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose she applied for a 1500 AZN loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nacira

texts.es: La Sra. Nacira  tiene 58 años y es Divorciada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  9 y 17 años, la Sra. Nacira  se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en su taller que se encuentra en la zona  12 de Octubre,  Este préstamo es la segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Nacira  utilizara  este préstamo  para la compra de una maquina de coser,  la Sra. Nacira  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son falta de una maquina industrial, para la confección de prendas por mayor, y  utilizara los beneficios para seguir mejorando y creciendo en su actividad para así generar mas ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de toda su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Nacira is a 58-year old divorced mother of two. Her children are 9 and 17 years old respectively. Nacira works sewing clothing in her own shop in the October 12th neighborhood. This will be her second loan from this institution. She will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine. The biggest challenge for her business is the lack of an industrial quality machine to fulfill wholesale orders. She will use the profits to continue improving and growing her business thus improving her quality of life and that of her entire family.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a 56-year-old woman, married with seven children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sharifa has bred cattle for the last 10 years. She was a housewife and her husband's salary was too low to cover the family needs, so Sharifa decided to start her business.  She receives 120 AZN in financial support from government monthly, but this is too low to cover the family's needs.

Sharifa usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells fora  more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 230 AZN and this business is main source of financial income in her family. 

Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. 

Sharifa wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase three cows and fodder.

loans.use: to buy three cows and fodder

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en:
Natavan is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Natavan has bred cattle for the last 10 years. She was a housewife and her husband`s salary as a laborer was too low to cover the family's needs, so Natavan decided to purchase her first cow. 

Natavan usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 70 AZN. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Natavan also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling homemade milk and yoghurt to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve the life conditions of her family. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan to purchase two beef cows, one milk cow and fodder.

loans.use: to buy two beef cows, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en:
Fadhila is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a married mother of five children. Fadhila carries out tree farming; many people in Malindi plant Casuarina/pine trees and other species for sale as poles, which has also helped provide a good outlook to the tourist town. Fadhila started her business from behind her house and has seen it grow with time.

Fadhila was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more tree seedlings. Her future ambition is to purchase a parcel of land for tree planting. Fadhila's business challenge is the dry season, a period when trees can dry up if they have not grown to a stable height.

loans.use: To purchase more tree seedlings.

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga, 52 years old, is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She is married and has one child. Shafiga has been engaged in poultry breeding for the last 10 years. Her father helps her run the business, which was her hobby before retiring, but then became her primary source of income. Shafiga's monthly income is 120 AZN.

Poultry meat is very popular among local people and many national dishes are made with chicken and turkey. People use different kinds of poultry in different seasons. In autumn and winter, people use goose and turkey; in spring and summer, they only use chicken. 

Shafiga would like to increase her number of poultry and has therefore applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She is going to buy more chickens, sell them for a profitable price, and thus increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu, 43 years old, is married and has two children. She is a farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 8 years. During this time, Arzu gained enough skills and experience to run the business. She chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy; many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every Azerbaijan family's table and people also make fresh punch with the fruit. Arzu usually sells her crop in the central bazaar with her husband's help. Her monthly income is 200 AZN.

As her products are in high demand, Arzu wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. She has therefore applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN, which she will use to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is single and runs a video show. The business has been in operation for the last three years and has been a source of income to Lilian, providing for most of her financial needs. 

Lilian started the business from her personal savings. After being introduced to Milango by her friends, Lilian is applying for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to expand the room to accommodate more customers and to buy seats to increase the seating capacity.

The business at times does not have constant/reliable customers for every season and thus is not predictable in terms of income. Her main ways of counteracting this is to diversify to video shooting for events like ceremonies and celebrations and also to open a beauty and cosmetics shop.

loans.use: To buy seats to increase the seating capacity of her video show.

loans.name: Mwalimu

texts.en:
Mwalimu is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a single man and runs a food stall which has been operating for the last four years. He started the business from his personal savings.

Mwalimu was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit for his business. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his business premise and buy seats to increase the seating capacity.

He intends to save the additional income from this business in order to set up some other forms of businesses. His dream is to open a restaurant in the future despite the challenge of high cost of fuel and price fluctuations.

loans.use: To renovate his business premise and buy seats to increase the seating capacity.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has been actively farming for six years, producing and selling maize in her rural home in Kitale. She also runs a hotel from the local market to supplement her farming income. Violet is married and has four children, all adults save for the last born.

Violet has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says that farming has been and still is the major source of income that helps to meet family needs, especially the children's education. Violet says that seasonal changes affect farming income.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a farmer in Kitale and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 14 years. She has been farming for ten years, producing maize, beans and vegetables which provide income to meet the family's daily needs.

Florence has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She hopes to grow her farm to three hybrid dairy cows and venture into the transport business, which will also help improve her dairy business. Florence is, however, weary of the challenges posed by diseases and drought.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Maria Auxiliadora” Empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2009 mediante la promoción hecha a la señora Martina. El comité está integrado por 12 mujeres de la misma zona y todas antiguas dentro del comité. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente. Mencionaron que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
La Sra. Martina, promotora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de chipas (Alimento típico paraguayo). Empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del día y comenta que es un trabajo muy cansador, pero que aun así no se deja vencer ni deja de luchar día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, lo cual venderá y podrá tener un poco más de ingresos. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y a Kiva por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, ya que le es muy valiosa.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Maria Auxiliadora” started working with the Fundación Paraguaya in the year 2009, after a promotion made by Martina.  This group includes 12 women who are from the same area, and all of them are long-time members of the communal bank.  These women are very united, responsible and cooperative.  They have a strong desire to work and get ahead, as a group and with their families.  They mention that they work very well together as a team, with a lot of effort and dedication, as part of the Foundation's "Commitee of Women" program.

Martina, the promoter of the group, has a business selling chipas (a traditional Paraguayan food). She starts to work in the early hours of the morning and she comments that it is very tiring work, but even so she does not give up and continues to fight each day.

She is requesting a loan to buy chipas that she will sell, so that she can have a bit more income.  She is grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the help that she is receiving, because it is very valuable to her.

loans.use: to buy chipas (traditional Paraguayan snacks) to sell

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene 45 años. Es soltero y nació en el Empalme. Tiene 17 años viviendo en Guayaquil. Esta separado pero tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad.  Desde muy corta edad aprendió el oficio de soldadura en varios talleres. Actualmente tiene su propio taller de cerrajería y trabaja con su hijo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche de lunes a sábado. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar maquinas y materia prima. Su meta próxima se seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 45 years old. He is single and was born in Empalme. Jorge Luis has been living in Guayaquil for 17 years. He is separated, but has three grown children. From a young age, he learned the welding trade at various workshops. He currently has his own metal workshop where he and his son work from 8am to 9pm, Monday through Saturday.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy machines and raw materials. His upcoming goal is to continue working so that he can increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy machines and raw materials.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene 29 años, curso hasta el bachillerato, piensa retomar sus estudios Universitarios para el siguiente semestre, actualmente vive en concubinato y es padre de una niña a la que ayuda y apoya en su educación con esmero junto a su pareja, hace 6 años que se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte de pasajeros, en el sector interprovincial, es afiliado al Sindicato de Transporte Carrasco, donde la gente acude a solicitar este servicio para viajar a la ciudad o viceversa, su pareja le ayuda a generar ingresos económicos dedicándose al área agrícola, donde anualmente cultiva yuca, para vender al mercado local, la única herramienta de trabajo con la que cuenta Juan es una vagoneta,  la que quiere vender para poder comprarse una de mayor capacidad para dar confort a sus pasajeros, además en su Sindicato están exigiendo un modelo de vehículo diferente al que el tiene, es por tal razón que solicita un crédito en nuestra institución, para reintegrar el costo del vehículo que el quiere comprar.
texts.en:
Juan, age 29, completed his high school education. He plans to return to his university studies next semester. Juan currently lives with his partner and is the father of a daughter. He helps and supports her education with great care along with his partner. For the past six years, Juan has been providing passengers with transportation services within the inter-provincial sector. He is a member of the Carrasco transportation union, an organization that provides transportation services to people who request to travel to and from the city. His partner helps to generate income by farming. She grows cassava on an annual basis and sells her crop at the local market.

Juan's only piece of work equipment is his minibus. He wants to sell it so that he can buy a larger vehicle, which will provide comfort for his passengers. In addition, his union requires that he drive a different type of vehicle than what he currently has. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from CIDRE to cover the cost of the vehicle that he wants to buy.

loans.use: to buy a passenger transport vehicle.

loans.name: Shafagat

texts.en:
Shafagat is a 41-year-old woman, an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her husband and seven children. She is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years. She chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.

Shafagat sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 250 AZN. Her husband actively helps her to raise crops.

As these products are in high demand, Shafagat wants to expand her business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose she applied for a loan of 500 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of Kitale town in Western Kenya where she lives with her nine children aged between 23 and 7 years. She has been in farming for three years and employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk and maize for the local market.

Beatrice has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She aspires to own four dairy cows within the next four years. She reiterates that the acquisition of an additional dairy cow will provide milk for family consumption as well as income to meet other needs.

Beatrice says animal diseases are the challenge in farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Isatu. She is a widow and has 3 children (aged 26, 16 and 2) and one additional dependent. In 2000, Isatu established her peanut business. She began her business because she wanted a reliable source of income to support her family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 which will increase her profit by Le 300,000 monthly. She needs a loan in order to buy peanuts by the bag. In the future, Isatu plans to build a house and to give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy peanuts by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Aracely de 35 años de edad, comerciante que inicio hace varios años a trabajar para apoyar a su familia. Continua con su pulperia que ya desde hace once años aproximado es su principal sosten. Su esposo la apoya quien es vendedor de materiales de construccion en un camion. Juntos han logrado ir construyendo su vivienda de concreto. Para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda recurre al financiamiento. Hoy con este nuevo prestamo continuara la infraestructura de la parte frontal de su casa, es decir el porche de su hogar, por lo que necesitara comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de zinc, perlines, porton de hierro, verjas de hierro entre otros y empezar asi la obra. Alcanzando con esto mayor seguridad para su vivienda y los suyos.
texts.en: Señora Aracely is 35 years old. She is a businesswoman who began to work a number of years ago to support her family. She continues with her convenience store, which has already been her principal support for approximately eleven years. Her husband, who sells construction materials in a truck, supports her. Together they have succeeded in constructing their concrete house. She is turning to financing in order to complete improvements in their house. Now with this new loan, she will continue the infrastructure of the front part of her house, that is, the porch of her house, because she will need to buy the following construction materials: zinc sheets, rafters, an iron gate, and iron railings, among other items. Thus she will begin construction and achieve better security for her house and her family.

loans.use: to build the front part of her house.

loans.name: Almabubu

texts.ru: Алмабубу 54 года, воспитала трех детей.  В 1999 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Алмабубу начала свой бизнес в торговле одеждой. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Алмабубу сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Алмабубу  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 93,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  летнего ассортимента одежды.  Доходы от кредита Алмабубу  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Almabubu is 54 years old, she has raised three children. In 1999 looking for a source of income for her family, Alambubu started her business selling clothing. Thanks to her hard work and steadfastness Alambubu was able to grow her business with a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). Today the assortment of goods is not in excess and this is why Alambubu has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 93,000 KGS to expand the summer variety of clothing. She plans to invest the income from the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase the variety of summer clothing.

loans.name: Minerba

texts.es: Minerva, tiene la edad  de  46 años, está casada,  vive con su hijo y el esposo actualmente. Ella  con el crédito pretende comprar  abarrotes como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, masa, aceite, sal, entre otras. Ella tiene pensado con este proyecto vender la mercancía a un precio mayor para así obtener ganancia y poder venderla a un excelente precio al mercado de la localidad, así poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Minerva is 46 years old, is married and currently lives with her son and husband.  She plans to buy groceries with her loan, including rice, beans, sugar, cornmeal, oil, salt, and other items.  She has a plan in mind to buy her goods at wholesale prices to get better margins and be able to sell them at an excellent price to the local market.  Thus, she will be able to make more profits to secure a better quality of life and economic stability. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had never before had a loan in any state-owned bank, but FUDECOSUR offered the loan more easily and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Alahaji

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Alhaji.  He is married and has 2 children aged 8 and 6 years. He has one additional dependent, living with him as his Sales Assistant.  In 2004, Alhaji established his business in Top- Ups and Charging of Phones. He began his business as there was no one to pay his fees after his high school education.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

Alhaji requires a loan in order to buy more mobile phone recharge cards. In the future, Alhaji plans to build his own house and educate his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Amor has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Amor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Amor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Adelina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Adelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Abdul.  He is married and has no children.   In 2000, Abdul established his Drinks and Provisions business. Abdul began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business as profit. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to purchase more powdered milk, sugar, tea and Ovaltine, etc. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his business.

loans.name: Cherrylen

texts.en:
Cherrylen is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Cherrylen has a business selling snacks or local delicacies like cassava cake, banana cake and "biko". She earns about  6,000 PHP per month doing this type of work. Cherrylen has requested a loan to buy stocks of raw ingredients for making snacks or local delicacies such as condensed milk, sugar, flour, butter and cheese.

loans.use: to buy raw  ingredients for making snacks or local delicacies

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de  22 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus dos  hijos  y la  esposa actualmente. El  con el crédito pretende comprar café en almacigo para su posterior siembra en una pequeña propiedad. El tiene pensado con este proyecto en un futuro producir café para su posterior venta, así  obtener  ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan, who is 22 years old, lives with his common-law wife and their two children. With the loan, he intends to buy coffee seedlings to plant later on a little piece of property. With this project, he plans to produce coffee to sell in the future. Thus he will obtain earnings that will give him a better quality of life and stable finances. This is the first loan that he will receive from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a better payment plan and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Christopher. He is married and has 4 children, ages 3, 6, 12 and 15. 

In 2005, Christopher established a local business selling foodstuffs such as fufu, garri, and palm oil. He began this business when he realized that his source of income could not meet his domestic expenses. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Christopher earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to purchase more garri and fufu for his business. Christopher plans to educate his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fufu and garri.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is a married woman with three children. Carmelita is 57 years old, residing in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Carmelita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been making a living through this business for 10 years, earning 2,000 per month. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Carmelita is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Carmelita wants to make improvements on her house and to help her children complete their study.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de  32 años, está casado,  vive con sus tres  hijos  y la  esposa actualmente. El  con el crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abono, agroquímicos, herbicida, foliares. El pretende tener el café en excelentes condiciones y con esta asistencia obtener el máximo de producciones del Café. El tiene pensado con este proyecto obtener  ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Juan is 32 years old and is married. He lives with his three children and his wife. With the loan he plans to buy supplies like organic and chemical fertilizers, herbicide and foliar. He aims to have his coffee in excellent condition, and with this assistance be able to get the highest yield of coffee from his crop. He is thinking that with this project he will be able to improve his earnings and become more financially stable. This is the first loan he has received through FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans before from other banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan which has more reasonable payments and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 58 years old with five grown-up children. She lives with her husband, Romeo, in the village of Carikrikkan Sur in the province of Isabela. Marcelina has been in the farming business for eight years with the help of her husband. She is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 for her business to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow. She hopes that someday she can buy more land in order to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon, 32 years old, is married to Rose. They help each other to manage their farm. In order to have a nice living condition, Marlon is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business. Marlon hopes that in the future he can expand his farm to meet the need of his family, especially the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his farming business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a married woman with determination and confidence in her life. She is 52 years old and lives in the village of Carikrikkan Sur province of Isabela. She manages a farm with the help of her husband Joseph. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 for her business in order to purchase fertilizer, chemicals and seeds to grow. In the future, she hopes that her business does well so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm input fopr her farm business

loans.name: Rofelo

texts.en: Rofelo is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. Rofelo has a field from which he harvests and sells tomatoes, bananas, and coconut during harvest time. He has had this business for 5 years and requested a loan for 8000 to buy fertilizer, insecticide, seeds and maintenance goods for the farm. Rofelo has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011. In the future, Rofelo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jamalbu

texts.ru:
Жамалбу 52 года, замужем. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, в 1985 году Жамалбу начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Также, Жамалбу обрабатывает 2,96 га земли, где сажает фасоль, картофель и многолетние травы.  
Обладая от природы талантом в пошиве и вышивке, Жамалбу принимает заказы на изготовление  национальных одеял, ковров и приданого для невест, что приносит небольшой доход в корзину семьи. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жамалбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров  и 10 овец. Доходы Жамалбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en:
Jamalbu is 52 years old and married.  As a source of income for her family, Jamalbu started a field crop farming and animal husbandry business in 1985.  Her business, which she started with an initial amount of 20,000 som (KGS), now brings close to 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  Jamalbu also cultivates 2.96 hectares of land and grows beans, potatoes and perennial grass.

Possessing a natural talent for sewing and embroidery, Jamalbu receives orders to make national blankets, carpets and dowries, which brings a small additional income to her family.

In order to further develop her business, Jamalbu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS), which will be used for the purchase of some dairy cows and 10 sheep.  She plans to invest her earnings into the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single lady and runs a business selling juice. She started this business with her own savings two years ago. Upon learning of Milango from her friend, Beatrice joined in order to access funds.
She is currently asking for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a juice extractor, cooler boxes, and new stock of fruits. The business has proven profitable to Beatrice and she looks forward to opening a juice parlor in the near future. Beatrice plans to save the additional income yet to be realized from this venture for her future goals. The only challenge is the price fluctuations, mainly arising from less stock. She believes this will change with the onset of rains.

loans.use: To purchase a juice extractor, cooler boxes, and new stock of fruits.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 32-year-old very responsible and hardworking woman. She is married and has children.  She has been engaged in poultry breeding for the last 10 years. Her husband is unemployment and her business is the only source of income for her family. Her husband helps Rana to look after the poultry.

Poultry meat is very popular among local people and many national dishes are made of chicken and turkey. People use different kinds of poultry in different seasons. In the autumn and winter, people use goose and turkey, in the spring and summer, only chicken. Rana's income per month is 350 AZN.

Now she would like to increase the number of poultry and for this purpose she applied for 1000 AZN. She is going to buy more chicken, sell them at a profitable price, and, hence increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Mariecar

texts.en: Mariecar is a very diligent and hardworking young woman. She makes sure that she can provide for all the needs of her family. She is 22 years old and married to Freddie. They help each other to sustain the needs of their new life as a married couple. For that reason, Mariecar is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and seeds to grow in her farming business. She hopes that her business will expand so that she provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and seeds to grow in her farming business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 70 years old, married, and residing at Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Violeta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been in this business for 14 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,600 PHP to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, milk, soaps etc. In 2010, Violeta joined GDMPC. In the future, Violeta hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as shampoo, milk, and soaps

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Тохир трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 19 лет он занимается откормом и купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он является собственником бизнеса, и его жена помогает ему в уходе за скотом. Тохир начинал свою деятельность с купле- продажи риса, а затем начал перерабатывать его и взял мельницу в аренду. Тохир хотел бы получить займ для покупки корма для скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Tohir is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and raising two children.  He has been involved in fattening up and buying-selling cattle for over 19 years.  He is the owner of this business, and his wife helps him to take care of the livestock.  Tohir started his business with buying and selling rice and then started to process it and leased a mill.  Tohir wants to obtain this loan to buy livestock feed.  He relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Ifelayo Group

texts.fr: IFELAYO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Afiavi Cécile (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée 49 ans. Afiavi Cécile ne vit plus avec son mari mais a un enfant scolarisé. Afiavi Cécile vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les charges de la maison. Afiavi Cécile n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Afiavi Cécile vend des produits divers notamment des boîtes de conserves, des pâtes alimentaires et des tissus depuis cinq ans par le système de distribution. Afiavi Cécile s'approvisionne au Benin et parfois à Lomé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Afiavi Cécile s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe IFELAYO pour consentir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The IFELAYO group is made up of three women who are friends and belong to the same savings group.   Afiavi Cécile, age 49, is the group's representative, and the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She no longer lives with her husband but has one child who goes to school.  She lives alone with her child and takes care of the household expenses alone.   She has never attended school.  

In order to meet her needs,  and for the past five years, Afiavi Cécile has been selling various goods such as canned food, pasta and fabrics, through the distribution system.  She stocks up in Benin and sometimes in Lomé.  In order to strengthen her activity and to better meet the demand from her customers, she has requested a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the IFELAYO group.  The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as canned food, pasta, fabrics...

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is a married woman. She is 37 years old and resides at Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Elsa own and operate a farm land, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,300 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, and seedlings. Elsa has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Elsa wants to have her own children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, and seedlings

loans.name: Kermekan

texts.ru:
Кермекан 52 года, вдова, воспитала 4 детей.   В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1980 году Кермекан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Кермекан, ее хозяйство, насчитывающее 10 овец и дойную корову, приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов.   
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кермекан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Кермекан планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Kermekan is 52 years old, a widow and raised four children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1980 with an initial sum of 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Kermekan's persistent and hard work, her business, containing 10 sheep and a dairy cow, now yields about 6,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Kermekan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Илхомчон занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. В этой области он 12 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Ilhomjon lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 40 years old, married and has three children.  Ilhomjon is involved in selling household goods.  He has been in this business for 12 years.  He is requesting this loan to expand the merchandise selection.

loans.use: to buy household goods

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru: Ойгул жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ойгул более 12 лет занимается выращиванием овощей. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Oygul is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  She is 49 years old, married and has two children.  Oygul has been involved in growing vegetables for over 12 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Princesita

texts.en:
Princesita is 53 years old, married and resides at Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines. She operates a fish pond where she raises fish to sell. She's been in the business for 21 years. 

Each month, she earns PHP7,160.00 doing this business. She requested a loan of PHP12,000.00 to purchase additional fish to raise. 

In 2008, Princesita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Princesita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Manuchekhr

texts.ru: Манучехр проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Манучехр более пяти лет занимается перевозками. Он в основном возит товары из города Душанбе. Кредит берет для ремонта грузового автомобиля.
texts.en: Manuchekhr lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 28 years, married and has one child.  Manuchekhr has been involved in transportation for over five years.  He primarily delivers goods from the city of Dushanbe.  He is requesting this loan to repair his truck.

loans.use: to repair his truck

loans.name: Wangninangbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINANGBE 1 est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine.  C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de  ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La  représentante du groupe, du nom de Nonhouégnon Séraphine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nonhouégnon Séraphine est âgée de 32 ans. Nonhouégnon Séraphine  est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Roland. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Nonhouégnon Séraphine  vend de riz préparé avec de friture depuis une dizaine d’années à son domicile. Nonhouégnon Séraphine  s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Nonhouégnon Séraphine  sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINANGBE 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANGNINANGBE 1 group is made up of three people who live in the same house and belong to the same savings group.  It is the third time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to increase their level of activity.

Nonhouégnon Séraphine is the group's representative and the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 32 years old and married to a tailor named Roland.  The couple has two children, both in school and both their dependents.  In order to provide for herself and her children, Nonhouégnon Séraphine has been selling rice and fried food for about ten years, from her home.  She stocks up in a city in Benin.  Eager to meet her customers' needs and in order to increase her turnover and income, she and the other members of the WANGNINANGBE 1 group, are requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  Their previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 48 years old, married, and has five children. 

Jessie owns and operates a business providing repair services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for 9 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Jessie joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment such as tires to improve the business. Jessie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as tires.

loans.name: Nazirakhan

texts.ru: Назирахан  52 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, 15 лет назад Назирахан начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с покупки 6 овец на сумму в 18,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня насчитывает 3 коровы и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назирахан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Назирахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Nazirakhan is 52 years old, married and raising three children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry 15 years ago.  The business, started with a purchase of six sheep with a sum of 18,000 som (KGS), today contains three cows and ten sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Nazirakhan requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Melanie provides motorelas or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has been running this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

Melanie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and tools for maintenance.

loans.name: Ndeye Maty

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Maty est une veuve de 55 ans qui vit dans une communauté du Sénégal. Elle est mère de 2 enfants  âgés respectivement de 22 et 30 ans. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du petit commerce. Elle vend de la glace et du jus . Elle a choisi cette activité de commerce sous l’influence  de son fils qui lui a offert un réfrigérateur afin qu’elle puisse avoir une occupation.  Tout ce qui l’intéresse  dans cette activité c’est la préparation d’un bon jus qui puisse être  apprécié par sa clientèle. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits entrant dans la préparation du jus qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite développer son activité, accroitre ses bénéfices  pour mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Ndeye Maty is a 55-year-old widowed woman who lives in a community in Senegal.  She is the mother of two children, age 22 and 30.  She has been involved in small retail business for over ten years and sells ice and juice.
