She chose this activity following the advice of her son who gave her a refrigerator, so that she could have an occupation.  What Ndeye Maty likes the most about her activity is to prepare a delicious juice that her customers can enjoy.

Ndeye Maty is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC, and she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for the purchase of supplies to prepare juice for resale.  She would like to develop her business and increase her profits, in order to better meet her own needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare juice for resale.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве  источника дохода для семьи, 10 лет назад Айнура начала   заниматься животноводством.  Начатое с покупки 1 телки  хозяйство  на сегодня насчитывает 2 коровы и 2 бычка, что позволяет иметь прибыль  в сумме 2,700 сом (KGS) с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего  хозяйства.
texts.en: Ainura is 44 years old, married and raising three children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry 10 years ago.  The business, started with a purchase of one heifer, today contains two cows and two bulls and allows her to earn a profit of 2,700 som (KGS) from sales of milk and milk products.  In order to further develop her business, Ainura requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Clementina es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida,es dueña de una panadería, en Finca Perú ella aprendió a ahorrar y trabajar mucho para progresar junto a sus 3 hijos, con las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió a administrar bien su negocio, con las ganancias de los préstamos logró muchas cosas como: comprar  su casa, brindar estudios profesionales a sus hijos y su negocio pudo prosperar. Recuerda mucho los consejos de Morenita (Fundadora de Finca Perú) que le ayudaron a ser mas fuerte y consecuente con las cosas que decidía. Ahora el préstamo que solicita lo destinará para la compra de harina, azúcar y leña para su panadería.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the "Bancomunal Nueva Vida" communal bank, and owns a bakery. In Finca Perú she learned to save and work hard so that she and her three children could move forward. Through the Bancomunal training, she learned to run her business well. 

With the earnings from the loans she achieved many things, such as buying a house and helping her children take professional studies. Her business was able to prosper. She remembers well the advice of Morenita (the founder of Finca Perú), which helped her to be stronger, and more consistent in her decision-making.

Now she will use the loan she is applying for to buy flour, sugar and firewood for her bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and firewood for her bakery.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 60 years old. He is married and has five children. At his age, Virgilio still works hard to provide for his family's daily needs. 

Virgilio has been involved in the farming business for 15 years. He has 1.5 hectares of land, where he grows rice. He sells his harvest to traders, and earned about 35,000 PHP from the last cropping. The income from it will help him to cope with the needs of his family and give his children a good life. 

Thus, Virgilio wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further grow his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Adolfino

texts.es:
Adolfino es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, tiene  25 años, es mecánico y comenta que se dedica en este trabajo desde los 12 años, y desde el año 2.005 alquila un local para tener su propio taller de motos. Dice que su negocio está ubicado en una zona estratégica, lo cual le ayuda a tener muy buena cantidad de clientes.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de progresar y salir adelante, es muy entusiasta y con un gran espíritu de trabajo y dedicación. Cuenta que su sueño es poder ampliar su taller y de esa forma poder tener más clientes, lo cual le ayudara a seguir creciendo como microempresario.
Adolfino solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva para la compra de repuestos para motos, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Está muy agradecido por la ayuda que está recibiendo, pues esa le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Adolfino is from the city of Curuguaty. He is 25 years old and says that he has been working as a mechanic for 12 years. Since 2005, he has rented a location where he has his own motorcycle workshop. Adolfino says that his business is located in a strategic area, which helps him to have a large number of customers. He defines himself as an extremely hardworking person who desires to progress and move forward. Adolfino is very enthusiastic and possesses a great spirit for work and dedication. He indicates that his dream is to expand his workshop so that he can have more customers, which will help him to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

Adolfino is requesting assistance from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that he can buy motorcycle parts. This will help him fulfill orders for his customers. He is grateful for the help he has received, which he says will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El  cliente es una persona joven, es soltero y no tiene hijos, realizó un curso de Mecánica automotriz a nivel técnico medio. El servicio de mecánica, le genera un ingreso que le ayuda a sustentarse, cuenta con un personal fijo, el trabajo que realiza es local, y cuenta con herramientas principales para desarrollar su actividad.
Hace 9 años que trabaja como mecánico, inicio como ayudante, ahora ya tiene su propio taller, la experiencia que tiene, ayuda a conocer bien el mercado para el cual trabaja, no lleva registro escrito de sus egresos e ingresos, pero se verificó la fuente de sus ingresos económicos en la visita y entrevista realizada. El cliente desea implementar mas herramientas para mecanica automotriz y asi poder dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
This client is a young person who is single and has no children. He completed a technical course in automobile mechanics. He provides repair services in order to earn an income to support himself. The client has a permanent staff and he performs his work in a shop that has the primary tools necessary to develop his business. He has worked as a mechanic for nine years. He started out as an assistant, but now he has his own shop. The experience he possesses helps him to gauge the market in which he works. Even though he keeps no written records of his expenses and revenue, the CIDRE staff was able to verify the source of his income through an on-site visit and interview.

The client wants to acquire more auto repair equipment so that he can provide better service.

loans.use: to acquire additional auto repair equipment.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 21 integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Son mujeres que luchan día a día por dar un mejor futuro a sus familias y a sus hijos.
Una de las integrantes, la Sra. Ramona, se dedica a la venta de bijouterie. Cuenta que ella tiene mucha creatividad y la demuestra con los bijouterie que hace. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perlas, cuentas, hilos, ganchos y demás insumos necesarios para seguir haciendo su trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y creciendo como una microemprendedora.
texts.en:
This committee consists of 21 members from the city of Encarnación. They have learned how to work together so that they will be able to help one another. These women strive each day to provide a better future for their families and their children.

One of the members, Sra. Ramona, sells costume jewelry. She says that she has plenty of creativity, which is demonstrated in the jewelry pieces that she produces. Ramona says that all of her efforts are intended to help her family and provide for their daily needs. She is requesting a loan to buy pearls, beads, thread, hooks, and other supplies that she needs to continue her work. Her goal is to continue working and growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy pearls, beads, thread, hooks, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with one child. Gloria is 65 years old and is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gloria owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000.00 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2010, Gloria became a member of GDMPC. In the future, Gloria wants to make improvements to her house and to finish the studies of her child.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Huat

texts.en: Huat lives with his wife and a son in Bayan-Ulgiy province in Western Mongolia. His son studies at a local secondary school and his wife is retired. He started his food market business in 1998. Since 2006, due to changes in the building, he started retailing motorcycles and spare parts with the previous business assets. The business has been profitable because the need for motorcycles always exists in the countryside. He is an experienced businessman in trading. Huat is a responsible and resourceful man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing a few motorcycles ans I plan to sell them in the countryside". The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to buy the motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycles

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 27-year-old single man. Two years ago Hassan opened his own butcher shop; his twelve years of experience provided him with special talent. He is liked by most of his clients, because of the special discounts he gives and best quality products he sells.

Hassan is a hardworking man who seeks perfection in his business. Hassan has applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a Renault  Rapid Car necessary for transporting meat from the wholesale market to his shop in a healthy and clean way, to keep his customer pleased.

He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can, to keep his customers pleased. He also dreams of making  his own beautiful family in the future.

loans.use: To buy a Renault  Rapid Car necessary for transporting meat

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 30-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been working as a butcher since 2004.

His business is going on just fine but his butcher shop needs maintenance to keep his customers pleased. That's why Ahmad applied for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance for his shop, and to start a new business for his wife from home. He will help his wife start her own home business that has to do with selling makeup, perfumes and accessories.

This new business will help in improving his family's social and financial situation, and will sure improve his children's educational level. He hopes to improve his family and business as much as he can.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance for his shop, and to start a new business for his wife

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29-year-old divorced man, who is spending his life raising his only child in a good and healthy environment.

Mohamad started his own business in 2010, and with his 15 years of experience in his domain, Mohamad gained his customers' trust and support.

Mohamad was only fourteen when he started working, his teenage years aren't impressive to talk about since they were invested in working to support his family. He works hard to avoid his only child having this kind of life through hard work and his good reputation, to make sure his clients won't leave him one day.

Mohamad applied for a Youth loan from KIva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy  car hardware necessary for his business. This hardware  will help a lot in increasing his income. He hopes to expand his working place in the future and employ others to help in handling customers' requests.

loans.use: To buy  car hardware necessary for his business

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 35-year-old married man with no children. He works in construction and specializes in cement work. His business is going on fine but he needs a little update in his tools. That's why Abbass applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy the necessary tools for his business.

Abbass is a hard worker.  He is well-known in the region and has 23 years of experience in this field.  He was only twelve years old when he had to start working in order to help his parents earn their living.  He had a hard childhood which he hopes he won't let his family suffer from in the future.  He hopes to open a big construction company in the future.

loans.use: buy tools for his cement business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 31-year-old married man and father of two children. Thirteen years ago, Mohamad started his own business.  He is a blacksmith. This business is highly requested in his region, that's why Mohamad had to keep his business updated through buying special products with encouraging prices.  With the help of a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, Mohamad will be capable of doing it. These products will increase his income and will improve his family's living.

Mohamad is a hardworking man with a good reputation.  Most of his customers are neighbors, friends and relatives.  He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two cycles.  His previous loan helped a lot in improving his business.  Mohamad is a goodstanding borrower.

loans.use: buy blacksmith products

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 55-year-old married man and  father of six children.  Husein works in repairing electric problems for cars for twenty years. In 1996, he opened his own business, which created a positive effect on his family's social and financial situations.

Today, Husein is applying for a loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary electric parts for cars that might be requested by certain customers.  He likes to keep his business always updated with special tools and machines to keep his work perfect as much as he can.  Husein hopes to start trading in cars electric spare parts, which has a good income.

loans.use: buy car electric parts

loans.name: Souheil

texts.en:
Souheil is a 24-year-old married man with no children. He has worked as a blacksmith for 9 years. In 2005 he opened his own garage to improve his living, and it’s going just fine.

Souheil is working hard to improve his business more and more, that’s why he has applied for a Youth loan from KIVA partner Al Majmoua. He will use the funds to buy an important iron compressor that is necessary for his business. This machine will help a lot in improving his business, in both the quality of work done and in saving time.

Souheil hopes to expand and improve his business more through increasing his machines to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy an important iron compressor necessary for his business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 20 years old, single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and two siblings, one of whom is working while the other is still in school. Hussein has worked as a salesman in a cellphone shop since 2010. Today, he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his university fees. This Kiva loan will allow him continue his education and get a good job. In the future, he plans to have a good job and help support his family.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents and two siblings, both of whom are in school. He earns a living by working in a mini-market, and has reached an advanced level at his university. He still needs to pay the rest of his school fees and is requesting this loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to the fees and pursue his Master’s degree. In the future, he plans to request more Kiva loans in order to get advanced university degrees.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Nansalmaa

texts.en:
Nansalmaa is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and the children are school students. 

She started her home product sales business in 2007 by renting a counter. As well as, she also operates a meat trading  business since 2010.
 Over the years she gained many trusted suppliers and regular customers. 
She travels through rural areas to collect her supply, and transport is her biggest expense. Therefore, she is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy a car to save her expense. A quick calculation shows that it will save her 40% and it would help her to explore additional suppliers.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is a 47-year-old divorced man who lives with his two children in Bulgan province in Central Mongolia. His oldest child studies at the college. He has been running the taxi service business for many years. He is an experienced driver who has a plan to open a multi-taxi service with other taxi business entrepreneurs in the town. The business has been the only financial source for the family members and there are many regular customers who appreciate the service he supplies. 

Narangerel is a diligent man who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by building a garage for the van to keep it normal without having the expense of the public garages." He wants to continue the business successfully. The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to build a car garage.

loans.use: To build a car garage.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is a 41-year-old divorced woman who lives with her son in Dornogovi province in Central Mongolia. Her son studies at the secondary school.

Dulamsuren started a sewing business in 2007 in a rented room in a building. Since that time, she has been making many clothes and supplying good services to her customers. She purchases her supplies from the local market. The advantage of her business is that she makes clothes for an individual person's request that are well-suited and this makes the customers happy. She purchases supplies once or twice a 6 months. 

Dulamsuren is a talented woman who says that "I would like to develop my business activity. I am planning to buy some rare and good materials so that I could make more fashionable and pretty clothes to increase the income." The total amount she is requesting is 800,000 MNT to buy sewing materials.

loans.use: buy sewing materials

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg is a 36-year-old divorced woman who lives with her son and mother in the capital city of Mongolia. Her son studies at the secondary school. She has started making slippers and other handmade crafts at home with her mother. It has been 18 years that she has been producing the products. She delivers the products to the two big store's souvenir counters. It has been a profitable and successful business. Battsetseg is a talented crafter who says that, "I would like to develop the business by buying materials in large quantities. I just received a big reservation and need to buy some materials for this. I have a plan to save for my son's future". The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy the necessary materials for the handcrafts.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for the handcrafts

loans.name: Suh-Ochir

texts.en:
Suh-Ochir lives with his wife and son in the traditional 'ger' in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife is on maternity leave. 

Suh-Ochir started a taxi-service business a few years ago and has been improving his livelihood since then. He is trying very hard to support his family. However, his car has broken down and needs to be repaired. He needs some support for the car repairs so that he can support his family. 

Suh-Ochir is a goodnatured man who says "I would like to have some support to pay for the car repairs and to straighten my land because it is located at the bottom of a hill." The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to repair the car and prepare his land to build house.

loans.use: To repair the car and prepare his land to build house

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 47 years old. He is married and lives in Vanadzor city with his wife and only son. Artur's son is a third year student at Haybusak University in Yerevan. Artur's son is studying in the medical department. Artur says that his son has always dreamed to be a doctor so after graduation his dreams will come true and he will treat sick people. 

Artur is a policeman and his wife is housewife. 

Artur is asking for a 125,000 Armenian Dram (AMD) loan to pay his son's tuition for the second semester. This is Artur's second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to pay his son’s tuition for the second semester

loans.name: Thiabakhoye

texts.fr: Madame Thiabakhoye est une  femme mariée de 39 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle exerce la profession d’enseignante dans une garderie depuis plus de 14ans. Mais parallèlement elle s’active dans le secteur du petit commerce et vends des objets  divers. Elle a choisi sa profession d’enseignante par passion et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus  c’est le fait d’inculquer du savoir aux petits enfants. Elle est sociétaire  du guichet de l’U-IMCEC qui se trouve dans sa zone d’habitation  et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat d’habits, de  chaussures  et de produits cosmétiques qui seront destinés a la vente. Ses bénéfices l’aideront à renforcer ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie sociale au sein de son  foyer.
texts.en: Thiabakhoye is a 39-year old married woman who lives in Senegal. She has been teaching in a creche for more than 14 years, but at the same time she has a small business selling a variety of items. She was enthusiastic to go into the teaching profession and is particularly interested in communicating knowledge to small children. She has been a shareholder/member of the U-IMCEC branch in the area which she lives in and is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics to sell on. The profits she makes will help her to boost her income and improve her household's social conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Ablawa Opportune

texts.fr: Ablawa Opportune est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Ablawa Opportune a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Ablawa Opportune est veuve mais a trois enfants à charge dont deux sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Ablawa Opportune vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre à ses divers besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Ablawa Opportune fait de l’élevage de volailles dans sa région au Benin depuis une dizaine d’années. Ablawa Opportune s’approvisionne dans une ville du Benin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère son activité, Ablawa Opportune contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Ablawa Opportune sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit reçu antérieurement par Ablawa Opportune a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Ablawa Opportune is 51 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at primary level. She is a widow but has three children in her care, two of whom are her own children. All the children are at school. Ablawa Opportune lives alone with her children and covers all the household expenses by herself. In order to provide for her various needs, as well as those of her children, she has been raising chickens in her region of Benin for the past ten years. She gets her supplies from a town in Benin.

The income her business procures allows Ablawa Opportune to contribute to the various household expenses. In order to satisfy her ever-growing customer bases, she is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The first loan she was granted has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Antoinette est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Antoinette est mariée à un certain Yves. Antoinette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Antoinette a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Antoinette assure ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Antoinette vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc et des produits divers (riz, pâtes alimentaires, huile végétale etc.) depuis quatre ans dans son quartier au Benin. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère ses activités, Antoinette contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Antoinette sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Antoinette a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Antoinette is 42 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man called Yves. Antoinette attended school very little. She has four children, all of whom are at school and in their care. Antoinette covers the various household expenses together with her husband and children. In order to contribute to the family's various needs, Antoinette has been selling corn, cassava flour and various other products (rice, pasta, vegetable oil, etc..) for the past four years in her district of Benin. She gets her supplies in a region of Benin. The income generated by her activites allows Antoinette to contribute to the family's various expenses. In order to satisfy the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan she received has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, cassava flour and other products

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. 

To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products. Elsa has been in business for four years and earns 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Francisco Gabriel

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es peluquero, y gracias a su trabajo y sacrifico ha podido salir adelante e ir mejorando sus ingresos. Es una persona que desea seguir trabajando y de esa forma ser un gran microempresario. Gracias a la ayuda que ha recibido pudo ir mejorando cada día más.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de Shampoo, Cremas de Enjuague, Tintes, Máscaras Capilares, Ampollas Restauradoras, etc. con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma darle un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco is a hairdresser who, through his work and sacrifice, has been able to get ahead and improve his income.  He wants to continue his line of work and become an important small business owner.   Thanks to the support he has received he has been able to improve his lifestyle on a daily basis.

He is requesting a loan to buy shampoo, cream rinse, hair color, conditioners and restorative hair treatments, which will enable him to continue working and providing good customer service.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, cream rinse, hair color, conditioners, and restorative hair treatments.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.en:
Bernardino is 40 years old and married. 

The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this business for 24 years. He earns about PHP 35,000.

He's asking for a loan of 38,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and rice seedlings for his farm. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity to develop his business and have financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gina  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy additional canned goods, beverages, snacks and drinks to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is from the town of Cabatuan. She is the proud mother of two children. 

Norma helps to support her family through their family farm. She is married to George who has helped her to manage their family farm for 24 years. She is known for being a hardworking and honest person. 

At this time, she would like a loan of PHP 38,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm business. According to her plan, this investment will increase her income. 

In addition to helping her children, Norma dreams of renovating the family home. Even though life is difficult, she enjoys being a farmer living in the  Philippines.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm business

loans.name: Etiennette

texts.fr: Etiennette est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Etiennette a très peu fréquenté l’école. Etiennette est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Etiennette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux divers besoins de la maison, Etiennette vend de charbon de bois, des bois de chauffage et de sirop de bissap de façon secondaire depuis environs cinq ans. Etiennette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Etiennette contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Etiennette sollicite pour une sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Etiennette ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Etiennette is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She attended school very little. She is married to a man called Julien and the couple has four children in their care, two of whom are their own children. Some of the children are at school. Etiennette lives with her children and husband, and the couple cover the various household expenses between them. In order to provide for the household's various needs, Etiennette has for the past five years been selling charcoal, firewood and, as a secondary product, bissap sirop (a drink made from hibiscus flowers). She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. The income she generates from this business enables Etiennette to contribute to the various household expenses. In order to satisfy her ever-growing customer base's demands, she is requesting a sixth loan from Alidé. The previous loans she has been granted have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y comenta que gracias a la ayuda que ha recibido ha podido mejorar su trabajo y de esa forma ofrecer un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes. Acude nuevamente a la fundación paraguaya y a kiva para solicitar un préstamo, el cual quiere invertir en la compra de pintura poliéster, masilla, y demás insumos que necesite para poder seguir trabajando.
Agradece por la nueva oportunidad de crecimiento que esta recibiendo, pues nuevamente le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Anibal is a hard-working entrepreneur who says that thanks to the support he has received his work has improved and he is offering much better customer service.  He has come to the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva once again to request a loan which he wants to use to buy polyester pain, putty and other supplies needed for his job.

He is grateful for this new growth opportunity which will be be very beneficial to him.

loans.use: To buy polyester paint, putty and other supplies.

loans.name: Las Cariñositas Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento LAS CARIÑOSITAS  esta  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco de emprendimiento es la Sra. Rafaela  tiene 40 años esta casada  tiene 3 hijos  de las edades de 10, 15 y 9 todos en edad escolar,  todavía dependen de ella, ella se dedica a la  venta de edredones, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rafaela utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de edredones por mayor para surtir su negocio y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Rafaela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y  utilizara los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, la Sra. Rafaela es una persona muy trabajadora, se siente orgullosa y feliz por su trabajo y por apoyo que le brinda la institución.
texts.en: The communal bank LAS CARIÑOSITAS is comprised of eight members, seven women and one man.  The president of the entrepreneur bank is Mrs. Rafaela who is 40 years old, married and has three children, aged 15, 10 and 9, who are all in school and depend on her.  She sells comforters for a living and this is her first loan cycle within the instititution.  Rafaela will use the loan to buy wholesale comforters to stock her business and increase her working capital.  Rafael faces challenges such as competition, and she will use the business profits to improve her lifestyle.  She is a hard worker and proud of her work, and grateful for the support she receives from the institution.

loans.use: To buy wholesale comforters.

loans.name: Marlo

texts.en:
Marlo is 43 years old, married and thankful because he has been blessed with three children. 

He has been a farmer for almost 20 years. He usually plants rice and raises hogs to sell. His ambition in life is to improve the standard of living for his family and to give his children the best education possible. Sometimes, there are problems and complications, but through their strong determination, they can survive. 

Marlo aims to cultivate two hectares of farm land to plant more rice. But he lacks capital, thus he wants to apply for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds and also to pay for the labor costs required to plant rice.

He believes that this loan will help him to grow his business. He is hoping that he will have a bumper harvest to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds and also to pay for the labor costs required to plant rice

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 37 years old. She manages a small eatery business in front of her house. The advantage of her house's location is that it is near the highway. Consequently, her target markets are passengers and drivers. She wants to increase her customers in order to gain a higher income. Therefore she needs to offer a variety of delicious food. 

Therefore, Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 as additional working capital. It would be used to purchase vegetables, meat and rice to cook; as well as some utensils, such as spoons and forks. She hopes to increase her sales through the loan. The income generated in this business will be saved for the educational purposes of her four children.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat and rice to cook; as well as some utensils, such as spoons and forks

loans.name: Elvio

texts.es:
El señor Elvio tiene 41 años está acompañado desde hace 8 años con el señora Nilda de 35 años de edad, el señor es separado y en su primer matrimonio tuvo tres hijos.
El Sr. Elvio tiene su negocio de carpintería desde hace 9 años, hace cajones para verduras y frutas y los comercializa en su propio negocio, actualmente está iniciando otro negocio de chanchería que lo pone en una propiedad que tiene. Su familia le ayuda todo a llevar adelante sus negocios, y así pueden cumplir con todos los compromisos. Elvio se define como una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y con un gran espíritu de progreso.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de maderas, clavos que lo utilizará en su negocio y así poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Elvio is 41 years old and lives with Nilda, 35.  He is separated from his first wife with whom he had three children.

Elvio has been in the carpentry business for nine years, making vegetable and fruit crates which he sells himself.  Currently he is starting another business raising pigs on land he owns.  His family helps with the business activity in order to meet all the obligations.  Elvio defines himself as a hard worker who is determined to get ahead through a great spirit of progress.  He is requesting a loan to buy wood and nails so he can fill the orders he has.

loans.use: To buy wood and nails.

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Lodivina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lodivina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lodivina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snacks, beverages to sell

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en:
Delfin is from Cabatuan. He is married and thankful because he has been blessed with three children. 

Delfin has been involved in business for thirty years. He is an experienced farmer. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Working on the land is hard work that requires a lot of effort and funds. Therefore Delfin wants to borrow  PHP 38,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds. 

He knows that the land will always provide a good harvest, if you work hard enough.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Evamie

texts.en:
Evamie is married with one child. She is 26 years old and lives in Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Evamie used her last loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Her business grew and became successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan to buy more products to sell, such as lipsticks and lotion. 

Looking forward, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, such as lipsticks and lotion

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 48 years old, married and thankful because he has been blessed with three children. 

He has been a farmer for almost 25 years. He usually plants rice and raises hogs to sell. His ambition in life is to improve the standard of living for his family and to give his children the best education possible. Sometimes, there are problems and complications, but through their strong determination, they can survive. 

Jaime aims to cultivate two hectares of farm land to plant more rice. But he lacks capital, therefore he wants to borrow PHP 38,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds and also to pay for the labor costs required to plant rice. 

He believes that this loan will help him to grow his business. He is hoping that he will have a bumper harvest to support the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds and also to pay for the labor costs required to plant rice

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La Sra. Paulina tiene 47 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 17; 13; 12 y 10 todos se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la  fabricación de instrumentos musicales como quena y zampoña en su domicilio  que se encuentran en la zona de Masaya,  Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Paulina  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina cortadora para su negocio, la razón para solicitar este préstamo que le falta dinero para la compra de una maquina para realizar su trabajo. La Sra. Paulina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son ampliar su negocio y utilizara los beneficios reinvirtiendo el dinero en compra de materia prima, la Sra. Paulina es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Paulina is 47 years old, married and has 4 children, aged 17,13,12, and 10. All of them go to school. She makes musical instruments such as the quena and the zampoña at her home in the Masaya area. This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Paulina is going to use this loan to buy a cutting machine for her business. The reason she has asked for this loan is she needs the money to buy the machine to do her job. Paulina faces challenges in her business, such as making it bigger. She will use the profits to re-invest the money buying raw materials. Paulina is a hardworking and enterprising person. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy materials to make musical instruments.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Maurice. He is married and has four children aged 19, 9, 4 and 2 years. He has just started running his own mobile money transfer business.

Maurice grew up with his uncle, who runs several businesses around Lusaka. He learned a lot about how to run a successful business from helping his uncle. He is excited that he has finally started running a business of his own. He says he gets immense satisfaction knowing that the money transfer services he provides make people’s lives easier.

Maurice’s small shop is located in Kamwala, one of the busiest markets in Lusaka. This means that he has a lot of customers coming to his shop. Sadly, due to a very low working capital, he cannot serve them all. He says this is a particularly big problem in the afternoons, as by that time of the day most of his money has run out and the banks are closed. This limits the number of customers he can serve in a day to a mere 10-20, when, if he had more money, he would be able to serve more than 50 customers.

When he gets the Kiva loan, he will use the money to increase his working capital so that he can serve more customers and make more profits. In the future, Maurice plans to open another shop to increase his profits so that he can take care of his growing family and send his daughter to college. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase his working capital so that he can serve more customers and make more profits.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es: Miriam de 31 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, dedicada al comercio desde hace varios años. Su negocio lo ha venido diversificando, gracias al apoyo incondicional de Afodenic y kiva quienes le han brindado la oportunidad de pertenecer a la familia de creditos. Para lograr el equilibrio en sus ventas recurre una vez mas a la institucion, ya que la demanda de sus ventas crece dia a dia y sus clientes le hacen encargos mayores. El objetivo que se proyecta con este nuevo credito es invertirlo una vez mas en su negocio comprando de esta forma los siguientes productos: cosmeticos avon, vogue y zermat; asi como tambien invertir una parte de este prestamo en compra de ropa nueva y variada. Lo que está contenta ya que se está consolidando económicamente, y producto a este fortalecimiento en su economia les podra brindar a sus pequeños hijos mejores condiciones de vida y una educacion de calidad.
texts.en: Miriam is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been a merchant for several years. She has been diversifying her business thanks to the unconditional support of Afodenic and Kiva, which have offered her the chance to belong to the loan group. To achieve balance in her sales she is turning to the institution once more. Her sales demands are growing day to day and her customers are making larger orders. The objective of this new loan is to invest once more in her business by buying the following products: Avon, Vogue and Zermat cosmetics as well as new and varied clothing.  She is happy because she is getting financially stable and because of that she will be able to offer her young children a better quality of life  and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Flordelis has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 10 years.  She requested a loan for 35,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 
Flordelis has been a member of HSPFI since 2005.  In the future, Flordelis hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional product  to sell like beverages and snacks

loans.name: Purita

texts.en: Purita is 64-years-old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 4 children.  Purita is a farmer and has been managing a gardening business for 6 years.  Every month she earn 2,000.00 from this work.  She has requested a loan of 5,000.00 to purchase fertilizer.  Purita has been a member of GDMPC in 2010.  In the future, Purita hopes her children  finish their studies .

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose, 50-years-old, is married. The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been in this rice farming business for 24 years. With his last crop, he earned about PHP 25,000.

He is asking a loan of 38,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm. This and future loans from KIVA would be very useful to him as he sees them as the only chance for growing of his business and achieving financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is a married woman with four children. She is 34 years old and a good community member of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Six years ago, she began cultivating their rice farm to earn a living. Nanette grows a good variety of rice on her farm. She typically earns a total of PHP 13,000 a month.

Nanette is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC. It will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Nanette hopes for a bountiful harvest and to be able to cultivate additional farmland to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase manure

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman from the town of Cabatuan in the province of Isabela. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Flora does her best to improve their business and take care of their children.

Flora requested this loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. She also hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is industrious wife and a mother of two.  She is helping her husband in providing the needs of her family by trading rice. She has been in the business for over three years and has been a significant help to her family.  She is able to cover their daily household expenses and save for the allowances of her children. 


She wants to earn more in order to save enough funds for the education of her children. She is future oriented because she would like her children to avoid the hardships faced due to lack of education.


Maribel is asking a for loan of P10,000 to buy additional rice to sell.  With the additional business, she will be able to earn a higher income.  She hopes for your kind approval.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sel

loans.name: Lotgarda

texts.en:
Lotgarda is in the business of selling fish, vegetables and snacks in the village.  She is able to cover the allowances of her children through this business.  But she is aiming for higher income and to make it possible, she is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy more fish and other goods for sale. 


She hopes to earn a higher income to save for the education of her five children, as well as to improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish and other goods for sale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and married with five children. She is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a business raising crops and her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. Josephine has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month.

Josephine joined GDMPC in 2011. She is requesting a loan of 17,400 PHP to buy fertilizer such as manure to increase her farm production. She plans to use the additional revenue, generated with her loan, to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her farm production

loans.name: Antoliano

texts.es:
El señor Antoliano  tiene 48 años de edad el está casado con  la señora Ana quien tiene 46 años, ambos son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Tienen 2 hijos, quienes son la razón de lucha y de esfuerzo de ambos.
Antoliano tiene una carnicería donde vende todo tipo de cortes de carnes de primera calidad y también tiene un camión trasganado donde realiza fletes de animales. El es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y seguir ayudando a su familia.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de animales, los cuales quiere faenar para poder venderlos en su carnicería. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Antoliano is 48 years old. He is married to Ana who is 46 years old. They are both from the city of Caacupé. They have two children who are their reason for fighting and strength. 
Antoliano has a butcher’s shop where he sells all types of cuts of high quality meat. He also has a truck for transporting animals. He is a very hard working person. He wants to move ahead and continue helping his family. 
He is requesting a loan in order to purchase animals. He wants to slaughter them in order to sell them in his butcher shop. His goals are to be able to continue working and to growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: purchase animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 39 years old and married with 6 children. She is from Tukuran, Zambaonga del Sur.

Mercidita used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell at her store. Her business has grown. Now, she is requesting a new loan to purchase more inventory to expand product offerings at her store. She is positive that this will help grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is from Sto. Niño,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a married, 39-year-old woman with six children.

Paulita used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell at her general store. Her business is successful, and she is requesting a new loan to buy more items to sell such as noodles, soaps, shampoo etc. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, soaps, shampoo etc.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cipriana Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Cipriana Celestina es casada, tiene 34 años de edad, cursó el primer año de educacion primaria, tiene 4 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este trabajo como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, ya que espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y con capital amplio.
texts.en:
Cipriana Celestina is 34 years old, married, and completed the first year of her 'educación primaria' (education for children aged 7-14).  She has four children, three of whom are in school.  Her business is weaving 'cortes' (traditional skirts).  She started out as a worker and now has six years experience.  She has the support of her husband who works in commerce.

Cipriana Celestina is requesting a loan to buy threads of different grades and colors.  She hopes, in the future, to have a large business and a lot of capital.

loans.use: to buy threads for making traditional skirts

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa pequeña comerciante y mujer esforzada. Luego de trabajar un tiempo en el extranjero decide regresar al pais y empezar con ahorros su propio negocio. Hoy en dia agradece a Dios por la bendicion de contar con su pulperia, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso economico para ella y los suyos. Sumandole a ello el ingreso extra que obtiene por el arriendo de un cuarto en su casa de habitacion, mismo que ocupa para cubrir parte de los gastos basicos del hogar. Con creditos anteriores realizo inversiones que le impulsaron a que en esta nueva opotortunidad de financiamiento lo re-invirtiera en el inventario de su negocio. Siendo Afodenic una puerta de financiamiento para lograr este incremento a sus ingresos. Con este tercer ciclo de credito comprara los siguientes productos: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azucar, cafe, maiz, golosinas, gaseosas, productos de aseo para el hogar, productos de aseo personal entre otros, logrando con la inversion poder cubrir la totalidad de sus gastos básicos, aumentar sus productos y por ende sus ganancias,asi como tambien el cumplimiento de sus pagos.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is a small shopkeeper and a hard-working woman.  After working abroad for some time, she decided to return to her country and use her savings to start her own business.  She now thanks God for blessing her with her grocery store which is the main source of income for herself and her family.  She makes additional income through renting out a room in her home.  This helps cover part of her household's basic expenses.  Candida Rosa invested her previous loans in her business and she will once again invest her new loan in buying inventory for her business.  Afodenic's loans have been a gateway to her achieving an increase in her income.

Candida Rosa will use her third loan to buy the following products: rice, beans, oil, sugar, coffee, corn, candies, sodas, household cleaning products, personal hygiene products, etc.  This investment will enable her to cover all of her basic expenses, increase her product inventory (and thereby her profits), and also meet her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Flavia Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Flavia Valentina es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la talabartería la elaboración de sandalias para damas, inició este negocio junto con su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 30 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su producción de sandalias, ya que quiere tener un negocio capitalizado y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flavia Valentina is married, is 50 years old and she did not have the opportunity to study. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are studying. She is dedicated to the craft of leatherwork to make sandals for women. She began this business together with her husband and up to now she has 30 years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband who is dedicated to the same work.

She seeks a loan to increase the production of her sandals because she wants to have a business that is capitalized and makes larger profits.

loans.use: to buy materials to make sandals

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Beverly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cereals and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is earning an income through her small plot of land where she plants a variety of vegetables. She patiently sows the land and plants in order to produce vegetables to sell in the market. The earned income is usually used for household expenses and she has not been able to save for her children’s education. She feels difficulty in providing the needs of her seven children, but still thankful because they are helping her with their source of income.  

Now, Violeta is requesting a loan of P10,000 to use to maximize her business. It will be used to buy a variety of seeds and vegetables such as eggplant and squash to sell. She hopes that through the loan she will now be able to save for the educational purposes of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seeds and vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 41-year-old married woman. For the past nine years she has reared chickens and sold mineral licks for cows in Kiambu. Rose's monthly income is 20,000 KES. 

Rose is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to increase her stock of mineral licks and buy chickens to raise. She plans to use her profit to expand her business and open a shop.  In the future, Rose wants to be build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Jamilette Del Rosario

texts.es: Jamilette Del Rosario  tiene 27 años de edad, su actividad  a la que se dedica es a la venta de mercadería en general en el cual ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio, sus clientes la visitan por la calidad de ropa que ofrece. Esta emprendedora tiene dos hijos que todavía se encuentra a su cargo y su sueño es  que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y que su negocio  crezca cada día. Jamilette Del Rosario está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como camisas, blúmer, sandalias, pantalones, faldas entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en: Jamilette Del Rosario is 27 years old. The activity to which she dedicates herself is the sale of merchandise in general. She now has years of experience with this business.  Her clients visit her because of the quality of the clothing that she offers. This entrepreneur has two children that can still be found in her care and her dream is that her children will complete their studies and that her business will grow each day. Jamilette Del Rosario is seeking financing to buy products like shirts, underwear, sandals, pants and skirts among other products that her clients require.

loans.use: to buy shirts. underwear, sandals, pants and skirts among other products that her clients require.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a 59-year-old widow with 4 children. She has owned and operated a retail store at home for the past 5 years. She earns about 3,500 PHP monthly from business operations.

She became a GDMPC member in 2006, and is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase daily use merchandise to sell in order to earn more income. She hopes to sustain the store's revolving funds to prolong business operations. Magdalina is planning to renovate her house so she may have a better place to live in.

loans.use: to purchase daily use merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who has five children. She is 46 years old and resides at Molicay, Ozamis City, Philippines. Anita owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting rice to sell to earn a living, and she's been 8 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,244 PHP to purchase fertilizer. In 2007, Anita joined GDMPC. She hopes to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo, 50-years-old, is married. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has eighteen years of experience. With his last crop, he earned about PHP 35,000. Now, he is asking for a loan of 38,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting his farm. Future loans from KIVA would be very useful to him, as he sees the loans as the only chance for the growth of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings and pay the labor cost for planting his farm.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and is married with three children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, and beverages. Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

Juliet is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, beverages, and snacks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 59 years old and married. He works full-time as a rice farmer. When the harvest comes, Oscar's hard work means that he can sell good-quality products to increase his net profit. His income is about 29,000 PHP each season (every five months). Oscar has over 31 years of experience in this field. His wife manages their hog-raising business and earns additional income to help meet their daily needs. 

Oscar is requesting a 38,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his rice field. He hopes to help improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for his rice field

loans.name: Raquil

texts.en:
Raquil is 31 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is married with three children. Raquil's business has been growing as she has wished and now she is requesting a loan from GDMPC. 

Raquil will use her loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes her business will continue to progress.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rhaida

texts.en: Rhaida is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Rhaida has a shop that sells RTW's like jackets and raincoats. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of shirts, slippers and raincoats to sell as well as  jackets and t-shirts. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rhaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of different kinds of clothing to sell, like jackets and t-shirts.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Marivic has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 12 years. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo and soap. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, shampoo and soap to sell.

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en:
Elpidio is 56 years old and is married to Estelita. They are both farmers in the village of La Paz. Elpidio and his wife are very thankful because they have been blessed with three children. Elipidio is a responsible father. He has been engaged in his business for twenty-five years. He earned about PHP 30,000 with his last crop. 

Right now, Elpidio is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 38,000 to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm business. He is hoping that he will have a plentiful harvest to support the education of the children.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, age 22, is selling firewood as a source of income. She patiently does such activity because she was not able to look for a better job. For now, to increase her income, she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy wood to sell at a higher price.

Julie is wishing for a comfortable life with her family soon, so sacrifice and patience are her weapons to grow and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, she has earned a living selling fuel. Catherine usually earns about 5,000 PHP each month. She joined GDMPC in 2011.

Catherine is requesting a 10,384 PHP to purchase more fuel to sell. She hopes to improve her business one day.

loans.use: to buy fuel to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 35 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a shop where she sells a variety of eggs. Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

Margie is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy additional socks of eggs to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Phillomen

texts.en: Phillomen is 36 years old, from Njabini, and is married with two children. She is a farmer and has been for many years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers, dairy meal and seedlings for her farm. She was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. She hopes to be the leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, dairy meal and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Solaika

texts.en:
Solaika is 44 years old and is married with seven children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past four years, Solaika has run a shop where she sells ready-to-wear clothing, personal care products, and accessories. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Solaika is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of wallets, perfumes, baby oil, and shavers to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, personal care products, and accessories to sell

loans.name: Narita

texts.en:
Narita is 48 years old and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Narita's husband is a laborer. For the past four years, Narita has been a banana planter and she earns 1,000 PHP each month. She been a member of the Kiva partner GDMPC since 2011.

Narita is requesting a 2,674 PHP loan to purchase farm chemicals. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Hipólita

texts.es: Hipólita es socia del Bancomunal Suni, es madre de 3 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace más 10 años, se dedica  a la venta de golosinas, queso y carne en las ferias. Ella aprendió a ahorrar, cuenta que antes tenía muy poco capital, ahora su negocio está creciendo porque todo lo que ella aprende en las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal lo pone en práctica y lo mejor es que le ayudan con la educación de sus hijos, ahora el préstamo que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de carne y queso que venderá en las ferias.
texts.en:
Hipolita is a member of the Suni communal bank. She has three children and has been a member of Finca Perú for more than 10 years. She sells snacks, cheese, and meat in the market. 

Hipolita learned how to save because before she had very little capital. Now, her business is growing because she applies in practice everything that she learns in the communal bank trainings. The best part is that they help her with her childrens' education. 

Hipolita will use this loan to purchase meat and cheese that she will sell in the market.

loans.use: to purchase meat and cheese to sell at the market.

loans.name: Osias

texts.en:
Osias is 57 years old and married with four children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past five years, Osias has been operating a general store where he sells a variety of products to local community member to earn a living. Each month Osias earns 5,000 PHP. He joined GDMPC in 2008.

Osias is requesting a 9,800 PHP loan to purchase new items to expand his product offering. In the future, he hopes to improve the general living condition of his family.

loans.use: to purchase items to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Japherson

texts.en: Japherson is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD to purchase assorted foodstuff and serving dishes for his food production business. Japherson will use the profit from his loan to expand his business and start a poultry business. His dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to expand his food production business and purchase chicken

loans.name: Abelino De Los Angeles

texts.es: Albino De Los Ángeles tiene 61 años de edad, el negocio que tiene el emprendedor es la venta de pollo tiene ya años de experiencia en el negocio lo cual la calidad de producto y el servicio que le ofrece a sus clientes le ha permitido aumentar sus clientela. Este emprendedor es una persona luchadora que toda la vida ha trabajado  para ofrecerle a sus hijos una calidad de vida mejor. Albino De Los Ángeles está solicitando financiamiento para comprar variedad de pollo y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Albino De Los Ángeles is 61 years old.  This entrepreneur’s business consists of selling chicken and he has many years’ experience.  The quality of the product he offers has allowed him to increase his number of customers.  This entrepreneur is a hard worker who has worked hard to provide a good quality of life for his children.  Albino De Los Ángeles is asking for a loan to buy a variety of poultry to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh and all the members of Kertha Bakti group decided to continue to borrow from MUK. Because they need to increase the population of the pigs, they need a bigger loan size. They will still need loans until they can support their businesses by themselves.

Ni Luh gets full support from her husband. He helps Ni Luh to maintain the pigs. With this loan she will purchase two superior piglets and use the rest for feed. The profit will be used as capital for her business.

Ni Luh wishes she had access to a vet who would always be ready when needed.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Paquito

texts.en: Paquito is from Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old. Paquito is married and has three children. Paquito owns and operates a general store. Paquito been in his business for five years and earns 20,000 a month from it. In 2008, Paquito joined GDMPC. Paquito is requesting a loan of 32,700 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.en:
Having succeeded in the previous loan, I Ketut got a new loan from MUK. 

His profit from breeding cows has helped to support the education of his children and he is very grateful for that. 

Today he got loan of 8,000,000 IDR. He will use this to buy a female cow for 4,000,000 IDR and one male calf for 2,000,000 IDR. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase fertilizer for his fields. 

I Ketut currently has three female cows and one male calf. He hopes to sell lots of calves to make the most profit. He still has two children who he hopes to put through college so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy one female cow, one male calf and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become commonplace to have pigs that are raised to improve the family's income. But the problem is most of them do not know the correct way of raising pigs. To enhance their capabilities, they joined in a group to exchange information as well as to apply for loans.

Ni Ketut, 35, a housewife, became the head of the group Mertha Sedana. The group hopes to enhance their capabilities in terms of raising pigs and get the capital to support their businesses. Ni Ketut will use her part of the proposed loan to buy three piglets and food. In five months, the pigs will be ready for sale. The profits from this venture will be fully used to support the family economy.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and food.

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Made successfully maintained her pigs and her husband supported her business because the result improved the family's income. She also successfully renovated the barn. 

Now she needs a new loan to purchase piglets and she also has a plan to buy a saw. Because the loan is not enough to purchase all of this, her husband will also give her money to support the business. 

She hopes the loan will give her healthy piglets that she can later sell.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a saw.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
To earn a living, Maria has a business selling snacks such as banana cake, cassava cake, hot cake, "biko and benignit" (a stew or soup) and different kinds of juices. She earns about PHP 3,000 per month doing this type of work. 

Maria has a requested loan to buy raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, cheese,and powdered juice.
 
Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making juices and native delicacies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary used her previous loan to add more stock of spare parts. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

Mary will use the loan to purchase more stock of spare parts for her shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and see it grow.

loans.use: To add stock of spare parts to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is from Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 73 years old. Rita is married and has seven children. 

Rita used her last loan to purchase fertilizer and expand her business. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to buy feeding supplies for her swine business. 

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for her swine.

loans.name: Bebelonie

texts.en:
Bebelonie is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and her two children are in school.

Bebelonie has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a loan amount of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

Bebelonie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is requesting her fourth loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy products for her general store.  The income from her store helps to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the Philippines. Merlinda has a sari-sari store (general store) where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has run this business for three years. 

Merlinda is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.  Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, membre du groupe de crédit  Alpha, Femme  dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans. Elle est  vendeuse de braises, farine de manioc. Son mari est un évangéliste intercesseur dans une Eglise de réveil. Il ya 6 mois qu’elle  fut informée de micro crédit qu’octroi l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, elle bénéficia son premier crédit de 50$ pour démarrer ses affaires. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses  enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  2eme  crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Ainsi elle a  décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  3 sacs de braises et 1 sac de farine de manioc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une parcelle dans le futur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en: The customer, who is a member of the Alpha loan group, is a dynamic woman and entrepreneur who is 30 years old. She sells live embers and cassava flour. Her husband is an evangelical mediator in a revivalist church. Six months ago she was informed about the micro-loans that IMF-Hekima grants and thus she was given her first loan of US$50 in order to begin her business. The profits she makes from her activity are used for her savings, to buy food and to help out with her children's schooling. Meanwhile, she has been granted a second loan. During this period, the customer has seen her business prosper and so she has decided to increase her loan for this new cycle. This new loan will enable her to get fresh supplies: three sacks of live embers and one sack of cassava flour. For the future she would like to see her children grow up buy a piece of land.
