loans.use: to buy herbal tea leaves, fruit, and grain

loans.name: Dotou Group

texts.fr: DOTOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Odile Mimounatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans. Odile Mimounatou est une veuve et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont seulement un reste à sa charge. Odile Mimounatou vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule ses différentes charges. Odile Mimounatou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Odile Mimounatou mène comme activité la vente de produits divers dans une région du Bénin. Odile Mimounatou exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans et s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Odile Mimounatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DOTOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
DOTOU is a group composed of three persons who are friends. The group's representative, Odile Mimounatou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 46 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children, all of whom have had schooling. Only one of the children remains in her care. 

Odile Mimounatou lives alone with her children and ensure by herself her different expenses are covered. To cope with these expenses, she has been selling a variety of goods in a region of Benin. She has been in this business for fifteen years and gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Odile Mimounatou  is requesting, along with the other members of the group DOTOU, a second loan from ALIDé. The loan receive previously was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Cesar Eduardo

texts.es: Cesar nació hace 25 años en Montecristi. Está casado y tiene 2 hijos. Nos cuenta que su ciudad natal es muy visitado por el turismo. Sus paisajes y su clima son muy atrayentes. También es conocida por que aquí se encuentra ubicada la asamblea nacional donde el presidente se reúne con sus subalternos para la toma de decisiones en beneficio del país. Otros de sus atractivos con sus playas y la variedad de comida. Cesar inicio su negocio hace 2 años, no fue por iniciativa propia sino por la de un amigo que ya se dedicaba a esto. Su negocio es la fabricación y venta de botones de tagua. En el Ecuador no es muy llamativo pero el extranjero los botones de tagua son considerados una maravillosa artesanía y son muy costosos. En el negocio trabajan él y una empleada, quienes producen los botones desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm. Su esposa también le ayuda cuando no está en su trabajo o atendiendo a sus hijos. El préstamo lo va a emplear en comprar la Pepa de tagua materia prima para su producción. Su meta futura es comprar maquinaria para la fabricación de productos hechos de tagua.
texts.en: Cesar was born 25 years ago in Montecristi. He is married and has 2 children. He tells us that his hometown is a busy tourist destination. Its landscapes and climate are very attractive. It is also known for being the place where the Parliament convenes, where the President and his cabinet make decisions for the future of the country. Other attractive features include the beaches and a great variety of food. Cesar started his business 2 years ago, not on his own but on the suggestion of a friend who was already versed in the trade. He makes and sells tagua nut buttons. In Ecuador, they are very common, but abroad, they are considered a great example of traditional handicraft and are very valuable. His operation consists of himself and a female employee, and they both make buttons from 7 am to 5 pm. His wife also helps when she is not at work or taking care of their children. The loan will be used to buy tagua nut, the raw material out of which he fashions buttons. His goal for the future is to buy machines to make products out of tagua nut.

loans.use: buy tagua nut.

loans.name: Russianica

texts.en:
Russianica is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

To earn a living, Russianica has a business selling chorizo, longganiza and hot dogs. She earns about PHP 1,000 a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like pork, beef, garlic, salt for making such food and plastic cellophane.

Russianica has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Russianica would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making chorizo, longganiza and hotdogs.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is 54 year olds, married, and has nine children.  He lives in Bundibugyo,Uganda where he is a fish seller, which he has been doing for five years. Saidi got his initial start from the wages he earned when he was working for someone else. 

Saidi is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more fishing nets.  His business goal is to expand into new markets though high fuel and transportation costs are a hindrance to his business. He plans to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more nets for fishing.

loans.name: 01.06.04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hoa is applying for a loan to purchase fruit to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit.

Hoa is 52 years old, she is married and has 3 children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 01.06.04 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
Hoa lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en: Inocencia is a widow who has 7 children. She is 72 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis, Occidental. Inocencia used her last loan to purchase additional goods to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina has intentions to improve her family's living situation. So, this 60 year old woman is selling rice as source of income. She has been blessed with seven children who help her in raising them from their poor living conditions. 

She has just been doing her best way of providing for the needs of her family. Now, Merlina is requesting loan of PHP8,000 to buy 5 sacks of rice to sell. She hopes to gain greater income to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 46 years old and she is a hard working widow living with her five children  in Hioma, Uganda. She is an accountant, a job she has been doing for 18 years, at a tea estate. She faces the challenge of price fluctuations. Her family goal is to educate his children. Rose needs the loan facility to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena proves to be a responsible mother. She works untiringly at the public market where she sells fruits and vegetables from her stall from 6am to 7pm. She had been doing this since she got married to Arnulfo, eight years ago. The couple has one child. Her spouse also helps her to manage the business. They usually earn PHP500 a day. Now, she is borrowing a loan of PHP20,000 as additional capital to increase her merchandise. This way, her income will increase too. From her loan, she will buy cabbages, potatoes, trays of eggs and bananas to sell.

Someday, with good profits from the business, she will give a progressive life to her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, potatoes, trays of eggs and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Echo Mysterieux De Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Philamar est le coordinateur de son groupe Echo Mysterieux de Miniere. Ils habite dans la région de Miniere d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité.  Il n'est pas  marie il est pere de 15 enfants

Philamar a dirigé son  business de menuisier pendant les 5 dernières années.  Avant de commencer (menuiserie),  il etait a cultivateur seulement. Philamar  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du quincaillerie

Philamar espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et produits alimentaires.

Philamar dit que son but principal  est agrandir son business et être possede un moyen pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Philamar is the coordinator of the group Echo Mysterieux de Miniere. He lives in the region of Minere in Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He is not married. He is a father of fifteen children. 

Philamar has been running his furniture-making business for the last five years. Before starting (in the making of furniture), he was just a farmer. He would like to use this loan for investing in hardware products. 

Philamar hopes this loan will help him to expand his business. Some other group members have need of a loan for commerce, such as in charcoal or grocery items. 

Philamar says that his main goal is to expand his business and to own a means to transport his goods.

loans.use: to buy hardware

loans.name: Juanita De Los Angeles

texts.es: Juana De Los Ángeles es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado en el crédito para invertir en la  negocio en la compra de medicamentos para ofrecerle a sus clientes, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante ya tiene definido sus clientes fijos y eventuales a quienes le ofrece sus productos. Esta emprendedora ya ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito anterior ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con deseos de superación toda la vida ha luchado para brindarle a su familia lo mejor, actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para comprar medicamento como cremas, pastillas, jarabes, vitaminas, jeringa, entre otros productos que les solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en: Juana De Los Ángeles is an entrepreneur who has been supported by loans to invest in her business purchasing remedies to offer her customers.  She carries out this activity in an ambulatory fashion and has established a regular clientele as well as chance customers she offers her products to.  She’s worked with Fundación León 2000 already and showed herself to be responsible with her previous loan and to have the desire to improve. She’s striven her entire life to provide the best for her family.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy medicines like creams, pills, syrups, vitamins, syringes, among other products requested by her customers.

loans.use: to buy more products requested by her customers.

loans.name: Fenita

texts.en:
To make a living, Fenita has been engaged in rice production for twenty years. She is also engaged in the hog-raising business for their extra income. She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family from poor living conditions. 

Fenita is married to a farmer and has three school-aged children. According to her, through the income generated from her business, she has been able to give daily allowances to her children in school. At this time, she is requesting a loan of PHP 38,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 33 year old living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a cattle business, which he has run for a period of 12 years now. He has 3 children of school going age and his dream is to educate his children up to the university level. 

Price fluctuations and inadequate capital to purchase stock are hindering factors to the business. He would like to build a permanent home and move the business to a more permanent location. Ben wants a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca, 64, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is a parent and a mother to her four children. She, with the help of her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Francisca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 31,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Francisca hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 31 year old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and he has practiced for a period of 11 years. After realizing that the meager salary he earns could not help him to meet his needs, he decided to venture into the produce business. He would like to educate his children, upgrade his studies and build a permanent home. Patrick wants a loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is willing to work hard every single day to give his family a good quality of life. He has devoted himself to rice production for five years. He is now 33 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. His wife is engaged in hog-raising business in their village. They work hard to provide for their needs and to be able to send their child to school. 

Rogelio is requesting a loan of 38,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizer for his rice production. He hopes to grow his business and harvest more rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizer for his rice production.

loans.name: Dos-Sou Group

texts.fr: DOS-SOU est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe du nom de Rostande Julie Abla (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans. Rostande Julie Abla est mariée à un certain Benoit. Le couple a trois enfants, tous à leur charge et dont certains sont scolarisés. Rostande Julie Abla vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Rostande Julie Abla a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Rostande Julie Abla mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (tissus, chaussures, boissons et accessoires pour les jus) depuis une dizaine d'année au Benin. Rostande Julie Abla s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et parfois à Lomé. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et de se faire plus de profit, Rostande Julie Abla sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DOS-SOU un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
DOS-SOU is a group composed of three persons who are friends. The group's representative, Rostande Julie Abla (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 32 years old and married to a man named Benoit. They have three children, all in their care. Some of the children are in school. Rostande Julie Abla lives together with her children and husband and jointly ensures along with her husband that the household expenses are covered. 

Rostande Julie Abla did not attend school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling a variety of goods (cloth, shoes, drinks, and supplies for making juices) for about ten years in Benin. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin and sometimes from Lomé.

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Rostande Julie Abla is requesting, along with the other members of the group DOS-SOU, an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, shoes, beverages, and supplies for making juices

loans.name: Patricia Tatiana

texts.es: Patricia  de 35  años vive (manta Guayaquil). Ella empezó este negocio con poca capital gracias a los prestamos fue incrementando su capital le gusta mucho la artesanía  ese es su pasión.  Tiene su local en un lugar tranquilo donde no hay mucho peligro. Trabaja todos los días es casada  su esposo se dedica a la venta de lentes  no  tienen hijos. A futuro anhela tener su negocio mejor . Con el préstamo comprara (artesanía)
texts.en: Patricia, 35, lives in Manta, Guayaquil.  She started this business with little capital and thanks to the loans gradually was able to increase her capital.  She likes crafts very much; they are her passion.  She has her store in tranquil place that isn’t too dangerous.  She works every day. She’s married and her husband sells glasses; they do not have any children.  In the future she’d like to have a better business.  She will use her loan to buy crafts.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 29 years old and married to Obed. They have been blessed with five children.

Norah sells eggs and also operates a retail shop in Nakuru. She has been in this business for five years. 

This will be Norah's first loan, and she plans to buy more eggs to sell and supply to her customers. This will enable her to meet the high demand for eggs from her customers and therefore earn more income.

In the future, Norah hopes to open more businesses and increase her income as well as improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more eggs for sale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 27-year-old gentleman with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He started as a tax collector in the town council and then he saved enough money to buy local brews. He has been in this business for six years.

Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are factors affecting his operations. Julius would like to build a permanent home, and his business dream is to expand into new markets. Julius wants a loan to buy local brews to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brews to sell.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah is a 34-year-old married man with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in this service for seven years.

Josiah would like to educate his children, buy a car and build a permanent house. 

Josiah intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets, sand and cement to construct his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, sand and cement to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham, 55 years old, is married to a housewife and blessed with four school-aged children. The family harmoniously lives in Cabatuan, Isabela. Abraham has been growing rice for almost 20 years. He earned PHP 40,000 at the last cropping.

Abraham is requesting a loan of PHP 38,000 to purchase farm supplies. He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs. He hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve his family's status in life.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is single. He has been a rice farmer for 6 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and to support labor costs in order to get the best harvest during rice production. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and to make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to support labor costs.

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad is 57 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children, ages 15, 18, 20 and 23. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She grows rice and corn crops to sell. Solidad has been a farmer for 30 years. Her husband is also a farmer and also works as an appliance agent.

Solidad is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Solidad hopes to be able to provide for all her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Akolemin Group

texts.fr: AKOLEMIN est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des membres de la même famille. La représentante du groupe du nom de Abikou Jacqueline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgé de 61 ans. Abikou Jacqueline est mariée à un certain Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants dont deux seulement sont à leur charge. Certains enfants sont scolarisé. Abikou Jacqueline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les charges de la maison. Abikou Jacqueline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Abikou Jacqueline mène comme activité la vente de condiments et de façon secondaire la vente de poissons à son domicile et par le système de distribution depuis une dizaine d'année au Benin. Abikou Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Abikou Jacqueline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKOLEMIN un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AKOLEMIN is a group composed of three persons belonging to the same family. The group's representative, Abikou Jacqueline (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 61 years old and married to a man named Antoine. They have three children, of whom only two are in their care. Not all of the children have had schooling. Abikou Jacqueline lives together with her children and husband and jointly ensures, along with her husband, that the household expenses are covered.

Abikou Jacqueline did not attend school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling condiments for about ten years; secondarily, she has been selling fish out of her house and by the distribution system in Benin. She gets her supplies  from a market in Benin. 

With the goal of responding better to the requirements of her burgeoning customer base and making more profit, Abikou Jacqueline is requesting, along with the other members of the group AKOLEMIN, a third loan from ALIDé. The  loans received previously were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and some condiments

loans.name: Julio Silvino

texts.es: Julio nació en Manglar Alto reciento de Guayas. Tiene 47 años actualmente vive en Libertad. Es casado y tiene un hijo. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y su hijo asiste a la escuela. Gracias a sus esfuerzos tiene casa propia y un negocio. Nos cuenta que su padre le enseño la ebanistería desde que tenía  15 años. Le mostro como trabajar la madera haciendo camas, literas, aparadores, muebles etc.  Se siente muy orgulloso porque ahora está siguiendo sus pasos enseñándole a su hijo. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo. No tiene empleados porque no podría pagarle, el único ayudante es su hijo cuando no se encuentra  en la escuela. Entrega sus productos acabados en Guayaquil ya que pagan mejor. El préstamo lo desea para comprar un motor y madera. A futuro le gustaría tener un taller con todos los implementos necesarios para aumentar la producción.
texts.en: Julio was born in Manglar Alto, Guayas District.  He’s 47 years old and currently lives in Libertad.  He’s married and has a son.  His wife does domestic chores and his son attends school.  Thanks to his efforts he has a house of his own and a business.  He tells us that his father taught him cabinet making since he was 15 years old.  He taught him how to work with lumber making beds, cots, display cases, furniture, etc.  He feels very proud because he’s now following in his footsteps teaching his own son.  His work schedule is Monday to Sunday.  He has no employees because he’d be unable to pay them; his only helper is his son when he’s not in school.  He delivers the finished products in Guayaquil because he’s paid better there.  He needs the loan to buy a motor and lumber.  In the future he’d like to have a workshop with all necessary equipment to increase production.

loans.use: to buy a motor and lumber.

loans.name: Nadia Francia

texts.es: Nadia de 53 años vive (playa villamil ). Ella empezó hace 31 años solo cociendo ropa con una maquina de Esa manera se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio, es más que por donde vive no hay donde vendan tela y ella le vende a sus clientes las telas. Adicional tiene una farmacia ya que izo un curso de enfermería. A futuro anhela tener su empresa con el préstamo comprara ( maquinas de coser).
texts.en: Nadia, 53, lives in Playa Villamil.  She started 31 years ago just making clothes on a single machine.  She realized that it was a good business.  In fact, around where she lives there are no fabric shops so she sells fabric to her customers.  She also has a pharmacy since she took a nursing course.  In the future she’d like to have a firm and will use the loan to buy sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores nació en Santo Domingo. Tiene 53 años. Está casada y tiene un hijo. Desde que se caso vive en San Jacinto de Buena Fe. Buena Fe es cantón de Los Ríos es tranquilo y le gusta vivir ahí por la seguridad que presenta para su hijo. Su esposo es albañil. Su tienda la empezó con el bono que brinda el gobierno y la ha incrementado trabajando todos los días. Se siente muy satisfecha porque le permite cuidar a su hijo y descansar. Actualmente la agobia la preocupación por su salud ya que hace poco la operaron del útero. Este es su primer préstamo y lo va a utilizar en la compra de una vitrina y poder vender productos de bazar para aumentar su tienda.  Sus proyectos futuros es mejorar su vivienda y seguir dando estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Dolores was born in Santo Domingo.  She’s 53 years old, married and has a son.  Since she got married she’s been living in San Jacinto de Buena Fe.  Buena Fe is a canton in Los Ríos.  It’s tranquil and she likes living there because it’s safe for her son.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  

She opened her store with a stipend she got from the government and she’s enlarged it working every day.  She feels very satisfied because it allows her to care for her son and to rest.  She’s currently a little concerned about her health because she recently underwent uterine surgery.  This is her first loan and she is going to use it to buy a display case and to be able to sell kitchenware to expand her store.  Her future plans are to make home improvements and to continue providing schooling for her son.

loans.use: to buy a display case, perfumes and rice.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is a father of two children, who are five and eight years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for five years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizer, and support labor costs to get the best harvest during rice production. With the profits, Etienne plans to expand the area he is using in order to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and support labor costs.

loans.name: Manuel Roberto

texts.es: Manuel de 34  años   vive (fortín Guayaquil) . El decidió entrar a este negocio que de hacer fletes en tricimoto porque cuando cogió una liquidación lo que le pareció bien fue trabajar en tricimoto. Porque le gusta. Es casado tiene 3 hijo su esposa es cocinera. Trabaja todos los días solo para darle a su familia lo que necesite.  la dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia . A futuro el anhela tener su propia casa y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios. Con el préstamo comprar ( artículos para el auto).
texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old and lives in Fortín Guayaquil.  He decided to get into this business of rickshaw delivery because when he was laid off it seemed like work on a rickshaw was a good option.  He is enjoying it. 

He is married and has three children.  His wife is a cook.  He works every day alone to give his family what they need.  The difficulty he has is with local crime.  

In the future, he longs to have his own home and that his children complete their studies.  With the loan he will buy parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Roberto Agustin

texts.es: Roberto   de 40 años vive (duran  Guayaquil). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es el de vender ropa  a parte se dedica a vender artesanías le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con  solo ya que su esposa lo abandono hace 5 años con sus hijos . La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. A futuro anhela tener su negocio grande para las artesanías  y tener su vivienda en buen estado. Con el préstamo comprara (ropa artesanías).
texts.en: Roberto, 40, lives in Duran, Guayaquil.  He decided to go into this business because it’s a good way to earn money to give his children what they need.  The business is selling clothes; he also sells crafts.  He likes it and thanks be to God does well.  He works every day by himself since his wife abandoned him five years ago with his children.  The difficulty he faces is crime.  In future he hopes to have a large crafts business and to have his house in good condition.  He will use the loan to buy clothes and crafts.

loans.use: to buy clothes and crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella vende diferentes variedades de papa, ella compra papa al por mayor para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solicitan en el mercado donde ella trabaja,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. 

La socia desea el prestamo para aumentar mas mercaderia de papa para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Rasca” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Cusco Department.  She alternates her daily chores with the business of selling potatoes.  She sells various varieties of potato.  She buys potatoes at wholesale and then resells them to customers who request them in the market she works in.  This is how she supports her family.  She wants to enlarge the potato selling business.

She wants the loan to increase the potato merchandise for her business.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato is from the village of La Paz. He is 48 years old and married with seven children. His wife manages their hog-raising business for their extra income. Renato has been engaged in rice production for almost 20 years. He earned approximately 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from his last crop. They worked hard to provide for their needs and give their children a good quality of life and to be able to send them to school. Now, he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase seed and fertilizer for his rice production. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his rice production

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He is 44 years old, married, and has a 17-year-old child. Florencio grows rice crops to sell. He works hard to provide for his family's needs. He is also engaged in fishing. He said he does everything to improve the standard of living of his family.

Florencio is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets. Florencio hopes to earn better.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets

loans.name: Makhbula

texts.ru: Махбула жительница города Исфара. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Махбула занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает фрукты. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов и овощей.
texts.en: Makhbula is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 46 years old, married and has three children.  Makhbula is involved in sales at a market.  She sells fruits.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  Makhbula is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жительница города Исфара. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Змира занимается торговлей фруктов. В этой области она 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
texts.en: Zamira is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 27 years old, married.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation for work.  Zamira is involved in selling fruits.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruits.

loans.use: to purchase tangerines, kiwi and several varieties of grapes

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is a 23-year-old single young woman. Her brother is a worker in a photography store. He gets a salary, but not enough to cover all his needs and costs.

Ameena is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing necessary home furniture such as living room furniture and carpets. Taking this loan will offer to Ameena's house a better look and suitable furniture. This will allow Ameena and the rest of her family to enjoy living at home.

Ameena is photographed while choosing a carpet for her home.

loans.use: to purchase necessary home furniture and carpets.

loans.name: Lazos Unidos Y Rumbos Distintos Group

texts.es: Corina es integrante de la nueva alcancía comunal “Lazos Unidos y Rumbos Distintos”  la cual está conformada por 07  mujeres emprendedoras y entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa- Prosperidad. Corina de 37 años de edad es casada y no tiene hijos. Ella brinda servicio de costura, lleva en ese rubro hace mucho tiempo. Tuvo que trabajar mucho para mejorar su negocio, lo que pudo ahorrar con sus trabajos para la compra de una máquina de coser. También ofrece productos de belleza la cual trabaja a pedidos, de donde obtiene un dinero extra para su familia. El dinero que solicito lo invertirá en su negocio de costura comprando telas, tijeras, cintas, etc. A futuro tiene como objetivo instalar una boutique donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas de vestir confeccionado por ella. Corina  agradece el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Corina is a member of the new communal bank "Lazos Unidos y Rumbos Distintos" ("United Ties and Different Paths"), which was formed by 7 enterprising and enthusiastic women upon beginning to work with El Programa Prosperidad. 
Corina is 37 years old, married, and has no children. She provides a sewing service, and has been in this line of work for a long time. She had to work a lot to improve her business. What she was able to save with her work went towards the purchase of a sewing machine. 
She also offers beauty products, for which she takes orders, and she makes some extra money for her family from that. The money she requested will be invested in her sewing business by buying fabric, scissors, ribbon, etc. In the future her objective is to set up a boutique where she can sell garments that she herself made. Corina is grateful for the loan granted to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors, and ribbon.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is a father of six children who are between 5 and 15 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for 20 years. He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers and to support labor costs to get the best harvest of rice production. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin, 40 years old, is married and blessed with one child. To make a living, he has been growing rice for several years. He earned 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) at the last cropping. Edwin is requesting a loan of PHP 38,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm business. He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs. Edwin hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve his family's status in life.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana es socia del Bancomunal Gotitas de Amor, tiene 33 años de edad,es dueña de una chacra donde siembra cereales y luego los vende en las ferias y , es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú hace 3 años, ella tiene deseos de progresar en su negocio y en su vida personal, aprendió a ser líder con las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semilla y el pago de los peones para su chacra de cereales.
texts.en: Juana is a member of the “Gotitas de Amor” (Little Drops of Love) communal bank.  She’s 33 years old and owns a plot of farmland where she grows cereals that she then sells at various street markets.  She’s the mother of four children and has been a member of Finca Perú for three years.  She wants to make progress with her business and in her personal life.  She learned to be a leader through her communal bank training.  She will use her current loan requested to buy seeds and to hire day laborers for her cereal field.

loans.use: to buy seeds and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Maria De Las Nieves

texts.es: María de las Nieves es socia del Bancomunal Gotitas de Amor, es dueña de una zapatería donde se confeccionan calzados, es socia de Finca Perú hace 3 años, ella esta muy contenta porque gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal aprendió del ahorro,a ser responsable, solidaria y a conducir bien su negocio, ahora con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cuero para confeccionar mas calzados.
texts.en: María de las Nieves is a member of the Gotitas de Amor (Little Drops of Love) communal bank, and is the owner of a shoe shop where she makes footwear.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years.  She is very happy because thanks to the skills of her communal bank she learned to save, to be responsible, supportive, and to conduct her business well.  Now she will use the loan she is requesting to buy leather for making more footwear.

loans.use: to buy leather for making shoes.

loans.name: 01.03.08 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quyết is the group leader of the 01.03.08 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. Quyết has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to offer tailor-made and clothing repair services. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main harship that Quyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Quyết is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Quyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Quyết has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, Quyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase machines for tailoring

loans.name: Dorcy

texts.en:
This is Dorcy, a 49-year-old resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. A single parent who manages her family's household while operating a business, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Dorcy operates a tailoring business offering curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, Dorcy is requesting a Php 18 000 loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Dorcy hopes her business grows, and dreams of being able to give her children a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Agua Dulce Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AGUA DULCE” iniciará su decimo quinto ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lupe. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de carne, venta de salchipapas, ferretería, cerrajería, venta de broster, servicio de fotografía y filmación, lubricantes, venta de verduras.

La señora Lupe,  indica que hace  quince años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus compañeros. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de carnicería que viene trabajando hace años, esta actividad la aprendió de su madrina.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de una moledora eléctrica, misma que lo instalará en su espacio de comercio, ya que ella solo tiene un equipo manual. Ella nos cuenta que el negocio que realiza lo desarrolla todos los días y lo comercializa en su espacio de venta en El Alto. Este negocio le ayuda a apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cinco hijos
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que se tiene.
texts.en:
The “Agua Dulce” (Sweet Water) communal bank will start its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Lupe.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have meat sales, “salchipapas” [fried potatoes with fried sausages], hardware, locksmith, Broaster-style chicken sales, photography and filming, lubricants and vegetable sales.

Lupe indicates that she’s been a member of a Pro Mujer communal bank for 15 years having been invited to join by her fellow members.  At present, she has a butcher shop that she’s had for years.  She learned this activity from one of her godmothers.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy an electric grinder that she’ll install in her butcher shop because she only has manual equipment.  She tells us that the business she develops her business every day and sell in her sales space in El Alto.  This business helps her support her family since she has a spouse and five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings she has.

loans.use: to buy an electric grinder.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela es socia del Bancomunal Gotitas de Amor, tiene 37 años de edad, es socia de Finca Perú hace 2 años, es madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, comenta que sus hermanos tienen una carpintería  y ella ahora desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de thinner, triplay y clavos para la carpintería,ahora ella desea dedicarse a ese negocio porque es mas rentable y tiene la confianza que lo hará muy bien, tiene muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que en el tiempo que esta en Finca Perú ella pudo aprender muchas cosas gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal que ahora las pondrá en práctica.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Gotitas de Amor (Little Drops of Love) communal bank, is 37 years old, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.  She is a mother of three children and makes a living by selling cosmetics.  

She says that her brothers have a carpentry business, and she now wishes to use her loan to buy thinner, plywood, and nails for carpentry.  Now she wants to make a living with this business because it is more profitable and she has the confidence that she will do it very well.  

She is eager to work because in the time she has been with FINCA Peru she could learn many things that she is now putting into practice thanks to the training from her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy thinner, plywood, and nails for her carpentry.

loans.name: Luz Abigail

texts.es: Luz Abigail es socia del Bancomunal Gotitas de Amor, tiene 20 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la venta de ropa para señoritas, gracias a las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió a ser más responsable y solidaria,esta muy agradecida que le hayan enseñado cosas que no sabia, y eso le ayudo para a tener un negocio más próspero y a tener estabilidad económica, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mas variedad de ropa para su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Abigail is a member of the communal bank Gotitas de Amor. She is 20 years ols, has a son, and sells misses' clothing.
Thanks to her communal bank's trainings, she learned how to be more responsible and solidary, and she is very grateful for having been taught things that she didn't know. It helped her make her business more prosperous and have financial stability. 
She will use the loan she is requesting now to invest in purchasing a wider array of clothing for her business.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Kaija

texts.en:
William is 44 years old and has five children.  He sells produce, such as maize and beans, in Kagadi town, which he has been doing for eight years.

William is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy maize and beans to sell.  He faces the challenges of of price fluctuation and inflation, which erode most of the profits.  His personal goal is to educate his children up to the university.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Ofilio Federico

texts.es: Ofilio Federico tiene 55 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es a brindar los servicios de transporte este negocio ya tiene años de experiencia sus clientes lo buscan para que les brinde el servicio. Este emprendedor inicio su propio negocio de la necesidad de generar ingresos y apoyar en los gastos del hogar y sacar a sus hijos adelante. Ofilio Federico está solicitando financiamiento para comprar, llantas, aceite, y  mantenimiento al vehiculo.
texts.en: Ofilio Federico is 55 years old.  The activity he does is provide transportation services.  He has years’ experience in this business and his customers seek him out for it.  He started his business needing to generate income to cover household expenses and move his children forward.  Ofilio Federico is asking for this loan to buy tires, oil and to service the vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires, oil and to service the vehicle.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, su esposo labora como trabajador independiente, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir un muro en la parte trasera de la vivienda , ya que lo que divide el terreno , son laminas de zinc ya muy viejo , plástico y pedazos de maya . Doña Margarita está muy feliz con el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva  ya que con el préstamo anterior logro invertir en su negocio y ahora cuenta con más clientes y un poco mas de Ingreso. Esta vez necesita el préstamo para priorizar su gran necesidad de realizar el muro , lo cual invertirá en piedra , cemento , hierro , etc.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in Ticuantepe with her family; her husband works as an independent laborer to help her with household expenses.  Her plan for the family is to build a wall in the rear of the house because what currently separates the property is very old metal sheeting, plastic and pieces of wire mesh.

Margarita is very happy with the support Afodenic is giving her through Kiva funds because with her previous loan she was able to invest in her business and now she has more customers and a little more income.  This time around, she needs the loan to prioritize the great need she has of building the wall.  She will buy stone, cement, rebar, etc.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 59 años es casada con 04 hijos independientes. Con su trabajo y esfuerzo Elena ha cumplido algunos de sus objetivos como apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios Universitarios, construir parte de su casa y mantener su negocio.  Ella  cuenta con una tienda la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad,  empezó en este rubro hace varios años, aprendió mucho de su hermano mayor quien  contaba con dicho negocio, también nos comenta que ofrece servicios de cocina. Elena  se siente satisfecha ya que puede colaborar con su familia que es lo más importante. Elena  invertirá el préstamo en la compra de vinos y licores ya que piensa ofrecer en su tienda.  Ella está agradecida a Edaprospo por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Elena, 59, is married and has four independent children.  With her work and effort Elena met some of her objectives which were to provide her children with university educations, to build part of her house and to maintain her business.  

She has a store where she sells basic staple items.  She started this line of work many years ago.  She learned much from her older brother who had said business and she also tells us that she also offers cooking services.  

Elena feels satisfied because she can collaborate with her family which is what’s most important.  Elena will use the loan to buy wine and liquor that she plans to offer in her store.  She is grateful to Edaprospo for the granted loan.

loans.use: to buy wine and liquor.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married.  He has been a rice farmer for eight years.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and support payment of labor costs in an effort to produce the best possible rice harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been farming in order to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).  Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations.  For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions.  Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support payment of labor costs.

loans.name: Naumy

texts.en:
Naumy is 31 years old and a single mother of one child.  She sells handbags and has been in the business for the past three years.  She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES from her business.

Another client introduced her to KADET LTD and this is her first loan.  She will use this loan to purchase more handbags to stock and sell in her business.  

In the future, she hopes to acquire a permanent location from which to operate her business.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags to stock and sell.

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem is 36 years old and married.  He lives in Gaza. He has a coffee shop; which he has owned since June 2007. 

Hatem is requesting a loan, which he will use to expand the size of his coffee shop and buy new chairs. He hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to expand the size of his coffee shop and buy new chairs.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом житель города Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он развозит пассажиров по маршруту Исфара-Чилгази. В этой области Илхом восемь лет. Он берет кредит для ремонта машины марки ГАЗЕЛЬ.
texts.en: Ilhom is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 36 years old, married and has four children.  He transports passengers along the Isfara-Chilgazi route.  Ilhom has been in this business for eight years.  He is requesting this loan to repair his Gazel vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his Gazel vehicle
